insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1, 'Prin Accounting I', 'ACCT-101', '101', 'An introduction to the basic principles of Accounting, and how to account for business transactions. Emphasis on the understanding of how financial statements are prepared, and how they are used as a basis for decision making by business owners, investors, creditors, government and others interested in the financial condition of an economic entity and the result of its operations. Topics include Analyzing Transactions; the Matching Concept and the Adjusting Process; Completing the Accounting Cycle; Accounting for Merchandising Business; Accounting Systems, Internal Controls, and Cash; and Receivables. 3 semester hours ', 1, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2, 'Managerial/Cost Acct', 'ACCT-103', '103', 'Introduction to Managerial and Cost Accounting used by management in conducting daily operations, planning future operations, and developing overall business strategies. Topics include Process Cost System, Cost Behavior and Cost-Volume-Profit Analysis, Profit Reporting for Management Analysis, Budgeting, Performance Evaluation Using Variance from Standard Costs, and Cost Allocation and Activity-Based Costing. Prerequisite: Accounting 101 and 102. 3 semester hours ', 1, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3, 'Financial Accounting Systems', 'ACCT-210', '210', 'Accounting systems for internal control, cash management, accounts receivables, inventories, plant assets, payroll, taxes, and other liabilities. Study of manual and computerized system. 3 semester hours ', 1, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(4, 'Intermediate Accounting I', 'ACCT-300', '300', 'Study of generally accepted accounting principles underlying the preparation of basic financial statements; balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow statement. Emphasis on standards issued by the Financial Accounting Standards Board and reporting requirements of the Securities and Exchange Commission. 3 semester hours ', 1, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(5, 'Intermediate Accounting II', 'ACCT-301', '301', 'Study of generally accepted accounting principles relating to accounting for leases, post-employment benefits, deferred taxes and other specialized topics. Emphasis on Financial Accounting Standards Board Statements. 3 semester hours ', 1, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(6, 'Advanced Accounting', 'ACCT-302', '302', 'Coverage of selected advanced topics including accounting for investments, accounting for mergers and acquisitions, consolidation and currency translation, segment reporting, and accounting for government and not-for-profit organizations. 3 semester hours ', 1, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(7, 'Cost Accounting', 'ACCT-303', '303', null, 1, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(8, 'Taxation of Individuals', 'ACCT-311', '311', 'Study of accounting and income tax law as it applies to individuals and business entities. Concepts of gross income, allowable deductions and credits, determination of tax liabilities. 3 semester hours ', 1, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(9, 'Taxation of Entities', 'ACCT-312', '312', 'This course concentrates on federal income taxation of Corporations, Partnerships, Subchapter S Corporations, and Gift and Estates.  It introduces students to the income tax rules and regulations pertaining to these \"taxable entities\", while enhancing an awareness of the complexities and sources of tax law', 1, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(10, 'Multinational Accounting', 'ACCT-327', '327', 'A global perspective of accounting practices. Development and role of accounting in selected countries, comparative practices in financial reporting and disclosure, setting international accounting standards, and examinations of auditing and taxation issues. Prerequisite: Accounting 101 3 semester hours', 1, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(11, 'Auditing', 'ACCT-335', '335', 'Study of generally accepted auditing standards, practice and procedures in the audit of financial statements. Includes study of ethical issues and professional responsibilities of the Certified Public Accountant to investors, creditors and others who rely on the auditor?s opinion when using audited financial statements to make decisions. Prerequisite: Accounting 308 3 semester hours ', 1, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(12, 'Govt and Not-For-Profit Acct', 'ACCT-338X', '338X', 'The course will focus on the development and use of financial information as it pertains to governmental and not-for-profit entities. Students will identify and apply appropriate accounting and reporting standards, preparing fund basis and government-wide statements for state and local governments, preparing financial statements for private not-for-profit organizations, using nonfinancial performance measures to evaluate governmental and not-for-profit entities, and describing auditing requirements for these entities.', 1, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(13, 'Financial Accounting', 'ACCT-400', '400', 'his course is an introduction to American financial accounting principles based on FASB and IASB, including the measurement, processing, and communication of accounting information. Users of such accounting information include business owners, managers, creditors, prospective investors, and others interested in the financial condition of an entity and the results of its operations. Topics covered include the accounting cycle, merchandising, services, fixed assets and corporate accounting issues. Prerequisite: Admission to graduate study. 3 semester credits', 1, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(14, 'Accounting, Business Law & Ethics', 'ACCT-500', '500', 'The course focuses the fundamentals of Accounting,  and also, how the legal and ethical environment of business impacts business  decisions. There is an introduction to the basic principles of Accounting: how to account for  business transactions. Emphasis on the understanding of how financial statements are  prepared, and how they are used as a basis for decision making by business owners, and others  interested in the financial condition of an economic entity and the results of its  operations. The Law component introduces how the legal environment of business impacts  business decisions with broad ethical, and critical thinking examples throughout. Knowledge  of the legal aspects of running a business will enable the student to conduct  business within the legal framework and understand the ethical dimension of business  decisions. Topics include: Introduction to Business Ethics; Financial Regulation  (Sarbanes-Oxley, Dodd-Frank) Business Crimes, Torts, and Contracts; the Constitution and  Government Regulation of Business; Business Organizations; Employment and Labor Laws; Consumer  Protection and Environmental Regulation; and Ethical Conflicts including  Corporate Loyalty v. Whistleblowing, and Privacy and Technology. Broad ethical critical  thinking will be examined using legal cases, decisions, essays and articles.', 1, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(15, 'Management/Cost Accounting', 'ACCT-505', '505', 'This course provides an introduction to managerial and cost accounting used by management in conducting daily operations, planning future operations, and developing overall business strategies. The objective is to gain an understanding of the role of accounting in the management process of planning, directing, controlling, and improving the organization\'s objectives (goals) and to translate those objectives into a course of action. This course includes a comprehensive review of the following topics: basic managerial accounting concepts; job order cost accounting; process cost accounting; break-even point and target profit; budgeting; and standard cost variances. ', 1, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(16, 'International Accounting', 'ACCT-508', '508', null, 1, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(17, 'Intermediate Accounting', 'ACCT-510', '510', 'This course applies generally accepted accounting principles to the preparation of financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, statement of cash flows, and retained earnings statements. Accounting for leases, employee benefits, deferred taxes and other specialized accounting topics will also be explored. Prerequisites: ACCT 400/600 and completion of all core courses or concurrent registration in final core courses. 3 semester credits', 1, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(18, 'Auditing', 'ACCT-520', '520', 'This course examines laws and methods for conducting commercial audits. Ethics, attestation standards, controls and fraud detection are among the topics that will be discussed. Application of generally accepted accounting practices to the review of financial statements, as well as the responsibility of the certified public accountant to the various users of the statements will also be explored. Prerequisites: ACCT 600, ACCT 610 and completion of all core courses or concurrent registration in final core courses.', 1, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(19, 'Personal Taxation', 'ACCT-530', '530', 'This course is an overview of the major types of personal taxes used by governments to raise revenue. Emphasis is placed on the taxation of individuals and tax planning considerations for the individual.', 1, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(20, 'Business Entity Taxation', 'ACCT-535', '535', null, 1, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(181, 'Formulas & Indv Constituents 1', 'ACH-511', '511', 'The student will explore the traditional Chinese Medicine Materia Medica and learn to discriminate between herb categories, their general applications and associated Treatment Principles and Individual, unique applications , signs and symptoms.  The student will explore at least 100 Herbs.  This course will focus on Herbs from the Release Exterior, Clear Heat, and Drain Downwards categories.  In addition at least 10 representative formulae that reflect these categories will be investigated.  This course will serve as partial basis for the formulae courses.  Prerequisities: Satisfactory progress in first year curriculum from MSTCM program.  2 lecture credits, 36 hours. ', 16, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(182, 'Formulas & Indv Constituents 2', 'ACH-512', '512', 'The student will explore the Chinese medicine Materia Medica in depth and learn to discriminate bewteen herb categories, their general applications and associated Treatment Principals and Individual, unique applications, signs and symptoms.  the student will explore at least 100 herbs.  This course will focus on Herbs from the Drain Damp, Transform Pjlegm and Stop Cough, Aromatic Herbs that Transform Damp, Food Stagnation categories.  In addition at least 10 representative formulae that reflect these categories will be investigated.  This course will serve as partial basis for formulae courses. Prerequisites: satisfactory progress in first year curriculum from MSTCM program. 2 lecture credits, 36 hours.', 16, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(183, 'Formulas & Indv Constituents 3', 'ACH-523', '523', 'The student will explore the traditional Chinese Medicine Materia Medica in depth and learn to discriminate between herb Categories, their general applications and associated Treatment Principals and Individual, unique applications, signs and symptoms.  the student will explore at least 100 herbs.  This course will focus on Herbs from the Regulate Qi, Regulate and invigorate Blood, Warm Interior and Expel Cold, Tonify (Qi  and Blood) categories.  In addition at least 10 representative formulae that reflect these categories will be investigated.  This course will serve as partial basis for the formulae courses.  Prerequisites: satisfactory progress in first year curriculum from MSTCM prgram.  2 lecture credits, 36 hours.', 16, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(184, 'Formulas & Indv Constituents 4', 'ACH-524', '524', 'The student will explore the traditional Chinese Medicine Materia Medica in depth and learn to discriminate between herb categories, their general applications and associated Treatment Principals and Individual, unique applications, signs and symptoms.  The student will explore at least 100 herbs.  This course will focus on Herbs from the Tonify (Yang and Yin), Stabilize and Bind, Calm Shen, Aromatic Substances to Open Orifices, Extinguish Wind and Stop tremors Expel Parasites, External Applications categories.  In addition at least 10 representative formulae that reflect these categories will be investigated.  this course will serve as the partial basis for the Formulae courses.  Prerequisites: satisfactory progress in first year curriculum from MSTCM program.  2 lecture credits, 36 hours.', 16, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(185, 'Formulas 3', 'ACH-617', '617', 'This course will be be a continuationand amplification of the previous herbal curriculum with emphasis on herbal formulae.  The student will explore at least 40 formulae including reiterating and expanding content from previous courses.   This course will focus on Formulas that Reduce Food Stagnation and Formulas that Expel Parasites.  The student will learn the name, actions, indications, cautions and contraindications of the classical base formulae acording to the traditional categorization based on treatment principles.  In addition the student will explore the traditional structure of herbal formulae as a prelude to formula modification (general, assistant, etc.) In addition the stduent will review and reiterate content from the Formilas and thier constituents course. Prerequisites: ACH 511, ACH 512, ACH 523, ACH 524 2lecture credits, 36 hours ', 16, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(186, 'Internal Medicine and Modifications 1', 'ACH-619', '619', 'This course will be a continuation and amplification of the previous herbal curriculum with an emphasis on internal medicine applications of herbal formulae.  The student will reexamine previously studied herbs and formulae from previous courses with special attention to clinical application and formula modification according to clinical presentation.  Prerequisites: ACH 617, 628, 635, 2 lecture credits, 36 hours.', 16, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(187, 'Internal Medicine and Mod 2', 'ACH-628', '628', 'This course will serve as a companion course to ACH 619.  This course will be a continuation and amplification of the previous herbal curriculum with an emphasis on internal medicine applications of herbal formulae.  The student will reexamine previously studied herbs and formulae from previous courses with special attention to clinical application and formula modification according to clinical presentation.  Prerequisities: ACH 617, ACH 635, 2 lecture credits 36 hours.', 16, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(188, 'Formulas 1', 'ACH-635', '635', 'This course will be a continuation and amplification of the previous herbal curriculum (ACH 511, ACH 512, ACH 523 and ACH 524) with an emphasis on herbal formulae.  The student will explore at least 30 formulae including reiterating and expanding content from previous courses.  This course will focus on Formulas that Release the Exterior, Formulas that Clear Heat, Formulas that Drain Downward, Formulas that Harmonize, Formulas that Treat Dryness, and Formulas that Expel Dampness.   The student will learn the name, actions, indications, cautions and contraindications of the classical base formulae according to the traditional categorization based on treatment principles.  In addition the student will explore the traditional structure of herbal formulae as a prelude to formula modification (general, assistant, etc.) In addition the student will review and reiterate content from the Formulas and their constituents courses.  Prerequisites: ACH 511, ACH 512, ACH 523, ACH 524 2 lecture credits 36 hours. ', 16, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(189, 'Formulas 2', 'ACH-636', '636', 'This course will be a continuation and amplification of the previous herbal curriculum (ACH 511, ACH 512, ACH 523, ACH 524) with an emphasis on herbal formulae.  The student will explore at least 30 formulae including reiterating and expanding content from previous courses.  This course will focus on Formulae that Warm Interior Cold, Formulas that Tonify, Formulas that Regulate the Qi, Formulas that Regulate that Invigorate the Blood, Formulas that Stop Bleeding and Formulas that Stabilize and Bind.  The student will learn the name, actions, indications, cautions and contraindications of the classical base formulae according to the traditional categorization based on treatment principals.  In addition the student will explore the traditional structure of herbal formulae as a prelude to formula modification (general, assistant, etc.)  In addition the student will review and reiterate content from the Formulas and their constituents courses.  Prerequisites: ACH 511, ACH 512, ACH 523, ACH 524 2 lecture credits, 36 hours.  ', 16, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(190, 'Special Topics', 'ACH-641', '641', 'This course will explore special topics in TCM herbal medicine.  These will include but not be limited to dui yao ( herbal combinations and modules), external applications, pediatrics, classical formulae from seminal texts. Content will also reflect the availability of special guest lecturers.  Prerequisites: ACH 636, 619, 2 lecture credits 36 hours.', 16, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(33, 'Evidence Informed Practices', 'ACS-511', '511', 'The basic principals of clinical and laboratory research are examined with a special emphasis on the applications of acupuncture and oriental techniques in the research setting.  Application of research to case evaluation will be emphasized', 4, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(43, 'Clinical Education 1', 'ACS-631', '631', 'Under the supervision of licensed faculty members, the interns start by observing patients for 30 clinic hours, then move into the area of direct patient care. All patient diagnoses and management plans are reviewed and approved by a clinic faculty member prior to the initiation of patient care. The student will begin to practice clean needle technique, removal and disposal of needles. The student will acquire proficiency in tongue and pulse diagnosis. Prerequisite: Pass Clinical Entrance Exam. 0 lecture hours, 12 laboratory hours, 8 semester credits, 245 total hours', 4, 8, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(44, 'Japanese Acup Tech', 'ACS-637', '637', null, 4, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(46, 'Preceptorship 1', 'ACS-711', '711', 'The students observe and administer care in established acupuncture facilities under the supervision of licensed physicians and acupuncturists. This exposure to a variety of clinical settings helps prepare the student for both private practice and integrative patient care. Prerequisite: Completion of all first year courses. 0 lecture hours, 4 laboratory hours, 2 semester credits, 75 hours total', 4, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(47, 'Clin Education 2', 'ACS-712', '712', 'Students continue to administer care to patients under the supervision of licensed faculty. Students are monitored as to their progress toward completing the qualitative and quantitative requirements necessary for the successful completion of the program. Eligibility for the internship is successful completion of the previous clinical internship. Prerequisite: ACS 631 Clinical Internship 1. 0 lecture hours, 12 laboratory hours, 8 semester credits, 215 total hours', 4, 8, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(48, 'Clinical Procedures 2', 'ACS-714', '714', 'This course explores the clinical applications of the skills and knowledge learned to date for patient care in the UB Clinics. In addition, UB Clinics skills including using electronic health system for charting, and communications with patients and other health providers in the UB Clinics is reviewed. Communication with other providers in multi-disciplinary clinics and hospital settings is explored.  Prerequisites: ACS 623, ATD 727, AWB 621. 0.5 lecture credits, 0 lab credits, 0.5 total credits.', 4, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(50, 'Preceptorship 2', 'ACS-722', '722', 'This is a continuation of ACS 711. Students increase their clinical skills working under a variety of health care professionals, all of whom must have the appropriate credentials to practice in the field of acupuncture. Prerequisite: ACS 711. 0 lecture hours, 4 laboratory hours, 2 semester credits, 75 hours total', 4, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(51, 'Clinical Education 3', 'ACS-723', '723', 'Students continue to administer care to patients under the supervision of licensed faculty.
