insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2731, 'Medical Mandarin', 'ATD-501EX', '501EX', 'Mar 10 2018 9:39 AM Michael Giampaoli This course bridges the language gap that non-Chinese students of Traditional Chinese Medicine and Acupuncture encounter on a daily basis in both didactic and practice settings.  This class will provide students of TCM a foundation in the Chinese language most commonly encountered in the study of TCM.  Students will learn the basics of the radicals that make up the characters, their meaning and how to write.', 120, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2732, 'TCM History & Philosophy', 'ATD-511', '511', 'The student studies the different eras of Chinese history and the effects on Oriental Medicine theories. This course includes the study of the development of Naturalism, Philosophical and Religious Taoism, Confucianism, and Buddhism and their contributions to Chinese Medicine. For each philosophy, the course examines how the philosophy views the human relationship to nature, and the human relationship to the universe. In addition, the impact of philosophy and religion on the oriental medical paradigm is explored. Prerequisite: none. 1 lecture hour,', 120, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2733, 'Traditional Chinese Theory I', 'ATD-512', '512', 'This course includes the classic theories of yin and yang and the Five phases that are fundamental to understanding the Oriental medical relationship between humans and the universe. Normal physiology is studied through the fundamental substances (Qi, Blood, Essence, Spirit and bodily fluids), and organs. The basic theory of illness and diagnosis using four examinations (sight, listening and smelling, palpation, and asking) and Eight Parameters are covered. Co-requisites/ Prerequisites: Anatomy 1 and Physiology 1. 2 lecture hours, 2 semester credits', 120, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2734, 'Trad Chinese Diagnosis I', 'ATD-513', '513', 'The basic theory and characteristics of the pathogenesis and pathogenic factors are covered including the seven emotions, disharmony of Yin and Yang, abnormalities in Qi, Blood, Spirit, Essence and Bodily fluids, and organ disharmonies are covered. Techniques in inquiry, palpation, tongue and pulse diagnosis are covered. Diagnoses incorporating the eight parameters as well as root and stem concepts are covered for each of the twelve zang-fu. Prerequisite/co- requisite: ADT 512 Oriental Medical Theory. 2 lecture hours, 2 semester credit', 120, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2735, 'Seminar 1', 'ATD-515', '515', 'This course will help the student to negotiate their first year in the Acupuncture program. The student will be guided through overviews of Chinese Medicine as preparation for integrating material from the entire curriculum. The student will be introduced to Chinese Medical terminology as well as the range of resources and the different perspectives on this terminology and the concepts contained therein. In addition the student will be introduced to concepts of information literacy and its use in research methodology. Prerequisites: none. 1.5 lecture hours, 1.5 semester credits', 120, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2736, 'Traditional Chinese Diagnosis 2', 'ATD-524', '524', 'This course will provide the student with further understanding of Oriental Medicine diagnosis, expanding on concepts from Oriental Diagnosis I. Traditional Chinese Medicine organ diagnoses, eight principle and febrile disease diagnoses will be stressed. In addition, treatment principles and acupuncture treatments based on these diagnostic systems will be explored. Differential diagnoses of common disease entities will be explored. Differential diagnoses of common disease entities will be explored. Students will also continue to practice pulse and tongue diagnosis. Prerequisite: ADT 513 Oriental Diagnosis I. 2 lecture hours, 2 semester credits', 120, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2737, 'First Year Sem 2', 'ATD-526', '526', 'This course will be a continuation of the first year seminar 1.  The student will be guided through the application and integration of concepts and skills acquired in the first semester curriculum.  The student will begin applying these through the use of case studies and clinical examples.  The basics of applying diagnosis and generation of treatment prinicipals will be reinforced in a collegial setting.  Group activities such as case analysis and grand rounds will also be introduced.  Prerequisutes ATD 518', 120, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2738, 'Seminar 2', 'ATD-529', '529', null, 120, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2739, 'Independent Study', 'ATD-599', '599', null, 120, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2740, 'Second Year Seminar 1', 'ATD-617', '617', 'This course will help the student understand case study and to begin learning the skills necessary to become an AOM clinical practitioner. The student will be guided through case study and case analysis as utilized in clinical practice as preparation for integrating material from the entire curriculum into the clinical setting. Case presentations and clinical skills are emphasized through a problem based learning format using TCM principles as the foundation. In addition, the student will gain a basic understanding of the ethical and legal issues surrounding licensed practice in the field of acupuncture. Prerequisites: ATD 529. 1.5 lecture hours, 1.5 semester credits', 120, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2741, 'Seminar 3', 'ATD-618', '618', 'This course will be a continuation of the second year seminar one. The student will be guided through the application of case analysis, integrative patient care, diagnostic, assessment and treatment application skills acquired in clinical observation and the first year?s curriculum. The student will begin applying these through analyzing clinical cases. Advanced applications in 8-parameter, 5-element, zang-fu, wen bing and shan han lun diagnosis and treatment principles will be reinforced in a collegial setting using interdisciplinary case analysis and grand rounds. Prerequisites: ATD 617. 1.5 lecture hours, 1.5 semester credits', 120, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2742, 'Differential Diagnosis and Pathomechanis', 'ATD-711', '711', 'This course compares and contrasts diagnosis and treatment between Western and Oriental diagnoses. Western medical diagnosis of these diseases is incorporated so that the student is able to collaborate with western physicians. Major and common categories of diseases including respiratory tract, infectious, gastrointestinal, genitourinary and musculoskeletal diseases are covered. Prerequisite: ADT 513 Oriental Diagnosis I. 2 lecture hours, 2 semester credits', 120, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2743, 'Trad Chinese Internal Medicine', 'ATD-715', '715', 'This course focuses on the diagnosis and oriental treatment of major illness. Treatment planning includes acupuncture, qi gong, and massage. Diagnoses cover respiratory illnesses, gastrointestinal, genitourinary, gynecological, and psychological illnesses. Rootstem and 5 Element treatments are included. Prerequisite: ADT 513 Oriental Diagnosis I. 2 lecture hours, 2 semester credits.', 120, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2744, 'Adv Pulse & Tongue Dx', 'ATD-717', '717', 'This course is designed to increase the diagnostic skills and clinical applications of these uniquely oriental diagnostic parameters. The student studies healthy and diseased tongues and pulses and discusses how findings in these areas change the treatment principles and strategies. Case studies from the clinical internship are used to increase both depth and breadth of skill. Prerequisite: ADT 524: Oriental Diagnosis II. 1 lecture hour, 1 semester credit', 120, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2745, 'Case Studies 1', 'ATD-727', '727', 'The student will be guided through case study, case analysis and pattern differentiation as utilized in clinical practice as preparation for integrating material from the entire curriculum into the clinical setting.  Case presentations and clinical skills are emphasized through a problem based learning format using TCM priniciples as the foundation.  Emphasis for this class is on cases associated with problems of fluid dynamics and chronic pain, which are frequent chief complaints in the AOM clinical setting.  Prequisite: ATD 526', 120, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2746, 'Case Study Organization and Application', 'ATD-728', '728', 'Students learn to transition from the development of pattern diagnosis to TCM treatment principles which then lead to point and modality applications. Emphasis is placed on an accurate assignment of symptoms to pattern diagnosis; logical treatment principles reflecting the priorities and totality of the patterns diagnosis; and the most efficacious acupuncture point and adjunctive modality prescriptions to help the patient achieve health. Prerequisite: ADT 524: Oriental Diagnosis II. 1 lecture hour, 1 semester credit', 120, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2747, 'Acup Gynecology', 'ATD-729', '729', 'This course is designed to familiarize the student with oriental diagnosis and acupuncture treatments of common gynecologic conditions. Special emphasis is placed on understanding those points forbidden to needle or moxa in cases where the patient?s pregnancy status is unknown. Prerequisite: ATD 524: Oriental Diagnosis II. 1 lecture hour, 1 semester credit', 120, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2748, 'TCM Geriatrics', 'ATD-742', '742', null, 120, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3188, 'Ubai Clinic Safety Procedures', 'AWB-501', '501', 'This course prepares the student for being able to perform in the UBAI clinic. HIPPA, Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) standards, UBAI clinic specific safety practices and procedures are presented. The student will practice safe and proper needle removal, pole moxibustion, and electrical stimulation needle techniques. The student will be shown and will practice clinic room set and clean-up procedures and patient draping.  A review of fire safety and personal safety procedures will be offered.  Completion of this course and passing the clinic HIPAA and OSHA BBP quizzes is required before performing any duties in the UBAI clinic. Prerequisites: none. 0.5 lecture hours, 0.5 semester credits.', 153, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3189, 'TCM Safe Practices', 'AWB-521', '521', 'The course prepares the student for emergency situations both in and out of the office. CCAOM Clean Needle Techniques and a review of Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) standards are presented.  In addition the student will practice safe and proper needling, moxabustion, bleeding, electrical stimulation and cupping techniques.  Allopathic treatments alonf with natural remedies for common complications of acupuncture and related therapies are discussed.', 153, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3190, 'Research Methodology', 'AWB-522', '522', null, 153, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3191, 'Pharmacology', 'AWB-523', '523', 'This course examines the most commonly used pharmacologic agents to be encountered in the clinical setting. The general principles of pharmacology (pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetics) are covered. Uses and side effects of antibiotics, anti-inflammatory agents, hormones and cardiac drugs are surveyed. Drug- nutrient and drug-herb interactions are discussed. Prerequisite: none. 1 lecture hour, 1 semester credit', 153, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3192, 'Western Bio Ind Studies', 'AWB-599', '599', null, 153, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3193, 'Medical Ethics', 'AWB-621', '621', 'This course is designed to provide the student with a basic understanding of the ethical issues surrounding practice in any medical field.  Upon completion of this course, the student will be able to identify concepts of medical and professional ethics as they apply to the practice of health care.', 153, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3194, 'Pharmacology 2', 'AWB-725', '725', null, 153, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(374, 'Basics of Data Science Programming', 'BAI-301', '301', 'Success requires knowledge of your functional area and mastery of the data that fuels it. This course provides the technical understanding and critical thinking skills needed to adopt, learn and apply relevant tools and techniques to analyze data with confidence. Students will gain hands on experience with structured query language (SQL) and R, from an applied perspective. In addition, they will be exposed to database, programming, analytics and statistical concepts. They will emerge ready to engage in additional study or to secure jobs in the marketplace that require these skills.', 23, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(375, 'Data Science Basic Inference & Visualiza', 'BAI-302', '302', 'This course introduces the student to business analytics and visualizations. The course covers how to manage business analytics studies, exploratory data analysis, and analytical visualization. It is assumed that the student is comfortable with programming, and is able to learn and use new programming languages.', 23, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(376, 'Data Science Advanced Modeling', 'BAI-303', '303', 'This course introduces the student to inferential modeling in business analytics. The course covers how to manage business analytics studies, a review of exploratory data analysis, and analytical visualizations, followed by advanced modeling techniques. It is assumed that the student is comfortable with programming, and is able to learn and use new programming languages, and has a firm understanding did exploratory data analysis.', 23, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(212, 'Biochem Metabolism & Nutr', 'BC-511', '511', 'This course covers the biochemical principles involved in maintaining functional homeostasis. 2 lecture hours, 2 semester hours', 18, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(213, 'Biochemistry,Metabolism & Nutrition: II', 'BC-612', '612', 'This course is a continuation of BC 511. 2 lecture hours, 2 semester hours', 18, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(214, 'Biology Study Skills', 'BIOL-100', '100', 'A course to expose students with limited science backgrounds to basic animal anatomy and physiology and assist in the development of appropriate learning and study skills. Students will develop writing and presentation skills that will support them as they move into the more detailed basic science coursework required of science majors. 2 class periods; 1 two-hour recitation; 3 semester hours ', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(215, 'General Organism Biology', 'BIOL-101', '101', 'The course examines the diversity of life in terms of their taxonomy, anatomy, physiology and ecology. Emphasis is placed on variation, adaptation, and evolutionary mechanisms.  No prerequisites for Biology majors; Non-major prerequisite: 11 Basic Biology course with a grade of \"C\" or better\"  or instructor\'s permission.  3 class periods; 1 three-hour laboratory; 4 semester hours', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(216, 'Cell-Molecular Biology', 'BIOL-102', '102', 'Students are exposed to the general biological principles that govern all living organisms. Concepts dealt with include origin of life, structure and function of cells at the cellular and molecular level, biochemistry, genetics and evolution. Prerequisites: Any BIOL or CHEM course    C or better or instructors permission 3 class periods; 1 three-hour laboratory period; 4 semester hours', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(217, 'Elementary Microbiology', 'BIOL-106', '106', 'This course is designed to provide students with an introduction to and overview of the key areas of microbiology for the healthcare professional. The course will cover the structure, growth, metabolism and genetics of microorganisms associated with human diseases. The course then covers host-microbe interactions and microbial diseases, and methods of control of infectious agents. 	 3 class periods; 1 two-hour laboratory period; 4 semester hours', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(218, 'Introduction to Consevation Biology', 'BIOL-107', '107', 'This course will introduce to discipline of conservation biology. The first two-thirds of the course will focus on the biological aspects of the discipline. Topics covered will include patterns of biodiversity and extinction, causes of extinction and population declines, techniques used to restore populations, landscape level conservation planning, and the role of conservation in protecting ecosytems services. The final third will cover the practical aspects of implementing conservation actions and will include lectures on conservation economics and conservation law.', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(219, 'Elementary Human Anatomy and Physiology', 'BIOL-111', '111', 'A fully online one semester human anatomy and physiololgy course for non-science majors to fulfill the University\'s natural science requirement for online Psychology majors and other undergraduates. 3 credits', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(220, 'Anatomy and Physiology I', 'BIOL-113', '113', 'Anatomy and physiology combined to yield a workable knowledge of the human body. Structure and function taught concurrently, each in terms of the other to engender appreciation of interlocking relationships. Available to biology majors as an elective. 2 75-minute class periods, 1 two-hour laboratory periods, 4 semester hours  Lab Fee Assessed', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(221, 'Anatomy and Physiology II', 'BIOL-114', '114', 'Anatomy and physiology combined to yield a workable knowledge of the human body. Structure and function taught concurrently, each in terms of the other to engender appreciation of interlocking relationships. A 2 75-minute class periods, 1 two-hour laboratory periods, 4 semester hours  Lab Fee Assessed', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(222, 'Biology Cooperative Educational Program', 'BIOL-200', '200', 'Students may earn up to 3 credits doing trained volunteer work in a field relevant to the discipline.  A written report will be required describing significant work achievenment resulting from work experience.  Approximately 100 hours are required to be considered equivalent to one credit.  Prerequisite:Permission of Chair. By arrangement; 1-3 semester hours; maximum 3 credits; pass/fail only.  Revised 4/4/2019', 19, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(223, 'Bio-Survival', 'BIOL-201', '201', 'Learn to recognize local plants and animals and learn how they can be used to survive in the wilderness, pitch a weather resistant camp, make fires, purify water and navigate on and off trails. A 3-day final survival hike is required.  Prerequisite: 1 Basic Biology course and Biology Department approval.  3 class periods; field trip required; 3 semester hours', 19, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(224, 'Human Evolution', 'BIOL-202', '202', 'A three hour studio-type course, integrating the lecture and lab experience. Students will cover the basic principles and mechanisms of micro- and macroevolution and its impacts on the distribution of human populations, human health and human behavior. The class will combine lecture, reading, discussion, independent projects, and hands-on exercises from the biological literature and other disciplines involved in the study of human migration and the evolution of human socialiality. Prerequisite: Bio 101 and Bio 102. 3 class periods;  3 semester hours', 19, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(225, 'Human Sexual Biology', 'BIOL-203', '203', 'Human sexual biology is examined within the context of male and female reproductive system structure, function, and dysfunction. Modern biomedical and biotechnological issues and methodologies as they might relate to the future course of human sex and reproduction are explored. 2 semester hours ', 19, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(226, 'Wildlife Biology & Conservation', 'BIOL-207X', '207X', 'The course will introduce students to the biology, ecology and conservation of Connecticut species of concern. Species case studies will be taken from the State of Connecticut Wildlife Action Plan. The course will engage students with local experts in wildlife conservation and the projects and initiatives to study and protect local wildlife.', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(227, 'Comparative Anatomy', 'BIOL-210', '210', 'An integrated study of vertebrate structure from a phylogenetic approach. Laboratory studies will include dissection of representative forms. Prerequisite: Biology 101 with a minimum grade of  C. 2 class periods, 2 three-hour laboratories, 4 semester hours  Lab Fee Assessed', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(228, 'General Physiology', 'BIOL-211', '211', 'Physiological and biochemical control and functioning in systems. Laboratory work designed to acquaint the student with basic physiologic experimentation, and the interpretation and presentation of data. Required of all biology majors. Prerequisite: Biology 101, 102. 3 class periods; 1 three-hour laboratory; 4 semester hours', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(229, 'Anatomy & Physiology I', 'BIOL-213', '213', 'This is part two of a two semester course intended for biology majors. This course is an in depth survey of human anatomy and physiology that examines the relationships between structure and function. The lecture topics will include basic chemistry, cell biology, histology, organs and organ systems. The two-hour laboratory includes experimental activities, microscopy and gross anatomy. Dissections will be used to study select organ systems. Although it is not required, it is recommended that students take this course in sequence (BIOL 213 then BIOL 214).', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(230, 'Anatomy and Physiology I', 'BIOL-213X', '213X', 'Anatomy and physiology combined to yield a workable knowledge of the human body. Structure and function taught concurrently, each in terms of the other to engender appreciation of interlocking relationships. Available to biology majors on a restricted basis. 3 class periods, 1 two-hour laboratory periods, 8 semester hours  Lab Fee Assessed', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(231, 'General Anatomy & Physiology II', 'BIOL-214', '214', 'This is part two of a two semester course intended for biology majors. This course is an in depth survey of human anatomy and physiology that examines the relationships between structure and function. The lecture topics will include basic chemistry, cell biology, histology, organs and organ systems. The two-hour laboratory includes experimental activities, microscopy and gross anatomy. Dissections will be used to study select organ systems. Although it is not required, it is recommended that students take this course in sequence (BIOL 213 then BIOL 214).', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3246, 'Gen Anatomy & Physiology II', 'BIOL-214X', '214X', 'This is part two of a two semester course intended for biology majors. This course is an in depth survey of human anatomy and physiology that examines the relationships between structure and function. The lecture topics will include basic chemistry, cell biology, histology, organs and organ systems. The two-hour laboratory includes experimental activities, microscopy and gross anatomy. Dissections will be used to study select organ systems. Although it is not required, it is recommended that students take this course in sequence (BIOL 213x then BIOL 214x).', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(232, 'Field Biology', 'BIOL-217', '217', 'Students will design and implement a small  research project requiring field work in a New  England ecosystem as specified by the instructor.  Emphasis on the relationship between abiotic  factors and plant communities. Prerequisite: BIOL  101 1 class period, field trip required; 1 semester  hour', 19, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(233, 'Ecology', 'BIOL-223', '223', 'Relationship of living organizations to their environment, distribution, climatic factors, ecological succession, homeostatic and adaptability of the organism are considered. Field trips designed to emphasize and illustrate major habitats, life zones, and ecological principles. Required of all biology majors. Prerequisite: Biology 101, 102. 3 class periods, field trips by arrangement, 1 three-hour laboratory, 4 semester hours  Lab Fee Assessed', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(234, 'Internship', 'BIOL-300', '300', 'Practical application of previous course work during supervised training in commercial, government or private laboratories. A written report will be required describing significant work achievements resulting from work experience.   Approximately 100 hours are required to be considered equivalent to one credit.  Prerequisite: Permission of Chair. By arrangement, 1-16 semester hours, Pass/Fail only  Revised 7/2/19 cr', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(235, 'Histology', 'BIOL-303', '303', 'Detailed analysis of the microscopic structure of animal cells and tissues. Laboratory work limited to study of prepared microscopic material. Prerequisite: Biology 102, 211. 3 class periods; 1 three-hour laboratory periods; 4 semester hours', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(236, 'Genetics', 'BIOL-307', '307', 'The laws of biological inheritance and their practical application to life; fundamental observations and concepts of classical and molecular genetics from Mendel to modern molecular biology.  Topics include basic principles of heredity, chemical nature of the genetic material, genomics, cytogenetics, mutation, gene expression and regulation.  Brief consideration of population genetics. Required of all biology majors. Prerequisite:  Biology 101-102. or permission of instructor. 3 class periods; 3 semester hours', 19, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(237, 'Genetics Laboratory', 'BIOL-307L', '307L', null, 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(238, 'Animal Nutrition (Bio-300X)', 'BIOL-315X', '315X', 'A study of the nutrient requirements of animals during their life cycle under various physiological and pathological conditions. With the increases in global population and human consumption of meats, milk, and eggs per capita, agriculturally important animals are the major source of high-quality proteins, as well as vitamins and minerals, for consumption by humans and their companion animals, to sustain their optimal growth, development, reproduction, and health.  Therefore, animal nutrition has great scientific, social and economic significance.', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(239, 'Mycology/Parasit/Virology', 'BIOL-317', '317', 'Overview of medically significant fungi, parasites, and viruses. Emphasis will be placed on pathogenesis, modes of transmission, and identification. Laboratory techniques used in isolation, cultivation, and identification will be used. Also included will be discussions of epidemiology and host response regarding these microorganisms.  Prerequisite:  Biology 101,102  with a minimum grade of C.  3 class periods; 2 two-hour laboratory periods; 4 semester hours', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(240, 'Environmental Health', 'BIOL-318', '318', 'This course is designed to explore current environmental and public health concerns and issues. Students will gain an understanding of the interaction of individual and communities with the environment, the potential impact on health of environmental agents. The sequence of major topics begins with environmental epidemiology and toxicology, policy and regulation. The course then covers specific agents of environmental diseases. Domains of environmental health are addressed. Prerequisites:  Biology 101 and 102 3 class periods; field trips by arrangement, 3 semester hours', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(241, 'Microbiology', 'BIOL-320', '320', 'Presentation of fundamentals of microbiology.  Bacteria, fungi and viruses; their relationships to man, industry, and agriculture.  Laboratory study of cultural, morphological, physiological, and genetic properties of representative types. Emphasis on development of technique.  Prerequisite:  Biology 211  2 class periods; 2 two-hour laboratory periods; and some nonscheduled laboratory work. 4 semester hours', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(242, 'Cell Physiology', 'BIOL-321', '321', 'A lecture course exploring the homeostatic mechanisms of the cell. Chemical composition, metabolism, permeability, synthesis and growth. Required of all biology majors. Prerequisite: Biology 211,  B or better or instructors permission 3 semester hours', 19, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(243, 'Endocrine and Reproductive Biology', 'BIOL-324', '324', 'A review of endocrine tissues, the hormones they produce, and their mechanisms and interactions with special emphasis on human reproductive endocrinology and physiology. Prerequisite: Biology 211, B or better or instructors permission 3 semester hours', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(244, 'Marine Biology & Ecology I', 'BIOL-330', '330', 'Examination of the history of ocean exploration/marine science field and the local Long Island Sound organisms, classifications and ecosystem. The course will focus on the geological, physical and chemical aspects of the marine environment. Students will design an intertidal project proposal that can be executed locally. 3 lecture hours/week.   Prerequisite: Biology 101 & 102 or permission of the instructor', 19, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(245, 'Marine Biology &Ecology I Lab', 'BIOL-330L', '330L', 'Students will conduct field trips work, include collection of samples and data from local field sites, laboratory analysis of those samples and statistical analysis of their data. 1 3 hour lab/week Pre/co-requisite: Biol 330', 19, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(246, 'Marine Biology &EcologyII Lab', 'BIOL-331LX', '331LX', 'Students will conduct an experiment of their own design in the local intertidal zone, analyze their data, and present their findings in the context of the relevant literature. 3 lab hour/week Pre-requisite: Biol 330 and Biol 330L', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(247, 'Marine Biology & Ecology II', 'BIOL-331X', '331X', 'The course will focus on the biodiversity (Primary producers, invertebrates, mammals, fishes, and reptiles) and ecology of global marine communities and ecosystems, both including nearshore and off-shore. Students will read and analyze current scientific research papers pertinent to the northeast and discuss current topics including climate change, human impacts on the marine ecosystem. 3 lecture hours/week.  Prerequisite: Biol 330', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(248, 'Medical Microbiology', 'BIOL-332', '332', ' The study of infectious disease processes; the biology of pathogenic microorganisms; the etiology, pathology, diagnosis and epidemiology of viral and bacterial disease. Prerequisite:  Biology 320  2 class periods; 2 two-hour laboratory periods; and some nonscheduled laboratory work. 4 semester hours', 19, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(249, 'Medical Microbiology', 'BIOL-332L', '332L', null, 19, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(250, 'Comp Physiology & Anatomy', 'BIOL-340X', '340X', 'Lab Fee Assessed', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(251, 'Immunology', 'BIOL-341', '341', 'Consideration of the basic principles and concepts of the mechanics of immunity and the relation of immunological phenomena to biological problems. Prerequisite: BIOL  211 or instructors permission. 3 lecture hours; 1 three-hour laboratory period; 4 semester hours', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(252, 'Medical Genomics', 'BIOL-343', '343', 'This course covers the basic biochemistry of proteins and nucleic acids and the techniques used to isolate, quantify, and characterize them. The class focuses heavily on the genomics of disease processes and the techniques used to diagnose and manage them. The course includes both laboratory exercises and review of case studies. Prerequisite: Bio 102. 3 semester hours', 19, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(253, 'Toxicology', 'BIOL-344', '344', 'Pharmacology studies the effect(s) of drugs on living organisms. Toxicology is the study of adverse effects induced by exogenous and endogenous physical and chemical agents, including therapeutic agents. The pharmacokinetics (toxicokinetics) - pharmacodynamics (toxicodynamics), of certain classes of drugs and toxic agents, and their effect, at the molecular, cellular and organ level will be covered. The student will be introduced to all aspects of toxicology including forensic toxicology. Prerequisite: CHEM 206 and BIOL 211.', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(254, 'Molecular Biology', 'BIOL-345', '345', 'The study of genes and their activity at the molecular level, DNA replication and repair, transcription, translation, recombination, translocation, and mutations. Techniques and experiments leading to important discoveries on DNA will be covered.  Required of all biology majors. Prerequisite: BIOL 211,CHEM 206. Minimum grade of C 3 lecture hours; 1 three-hour laboratory period; 4 semester hours', 19, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(255, 'Selectes Topics', 'BIOL-380', '380', 'Modern concepts in the area of the instructor\'s specialty. To be announced each semester. 1-4 semester hours Spring 2018 - Northeastern Bees requires BIOL 101', 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(256, 'Selected Topics', 'BIOL-380A', '380A', null, 19, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

An acceptable paper must be presented. Prerequisite: Permission of the instructor and Department Chair. 1-3 semester hours *A student may take not more than 6 semester hours of total combined credit in 398 & 399', 19, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');
