insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(980, 'Principles of Economics I-Macro', 'ECON-201', '201', 'Analysis of basic concepts; national income, employment, monetary and fiscal policy and economic growth. 3 semester hours', 55, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(981, 'Principles of Economics II -Micro', 'ECON-202', '202', 'An analysis of price, output, income distribution, market structures and international trade. 3 semester hours', 55, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(982, '^Money & Banking', 'ECON-301', '301', null, 55, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(983, 'Managerial Economics', 'ECON-311', '311', 'The theoretical analysis of the behavior of the consumer and the firm. Problems of income distribution, welfare economics, and general equilibrium analysis. Prerequisites: ECON 201 and ECON 202; junior or senior status. 3 semester hours', 55, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(984, 'Economic Forecasting', 'ECON-376', '376', 'Macroeconomic forecasting to improve asset allocation and investment performance over the business cycle. Examining and forecasting the behavior of stock, bond, commodity and currency prices. Forecasting tools to analyze the economy and forecast price movements in the financial markets. Prerequisites: ECON 201 and ECON 202; junior or senior status. 3 semester hours', 55, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(985, 'Economics', 'ECON-400', '400', 'This is a course for managers in both micro and macro economics. Topics addressed will include the prevailing patterns of economic institutions, national income analysis, international trade, prices and production; economic development, market structure and consumer decision analysis, competition, monopoly and monetary policy issues. Prerequisites: Admission to graduate study. 3 semester credits', 55, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(986, 'Business Economics', 'ECON-500', '500', 'ECON 500 - Business Economics This course is a graduate introduction to the  study of economics and finance, two interrelated  and integral fields in the study of business.  This course develops the foundation in  understanding how the real economy works, and how  finance connects the real economy to the monetary  system via the financial system. The course  starts by discussing how the market system works,  including basic macroeconomic concepts relevant  to the study of finance. Subsequently, the course  delves into how capital budgeting decisions made  by firms are essential to achieve macroeconomic  goals. Topics include financial statements, time  value of money, the financial markets, and how  firms make capital budgeting decisions. In  additional to textbook readings, students will  use current events to complete', 55, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(987, 'Economics Elective', 'ECON-ELECTV', 'ELECTV', null, 55, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1178, 'Curriculum Dev', 'EDLD-551', '551', 'This is a study and development of models for curriculum design and implementation at all levels of schooling. Emphasis is placed on current research and practice relevant to curriculum design and the planning and monitoring of curriculum plans in educational settings. Such topics as: curriculum assumptions, goals and objectives, knowledge and content, curriculum evaluation, implementation and staff development strategies are examined. 3 semester hours', 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1179, 'Intro to Educational Leadership', 'EDLD-601', '601', 'This course will focus upon contemporary society and changing policy issues that confront managers and leaders of educational thought throughout the 21st Century. Seminal issues such as the impact of political forces upon federal, state, and local educational policies will be considered. Labor relations will be analyzed. Empowerment of teachers will be examined. 3 semester hours', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1180, 'Admin:Org & Staff Ed Inst', 'EDLD-611', '611', 'This course will focus upon contemporary society and changing policy issues that confront managers and leaders of educational thought throughout the 21st Century. Seminal issues such as the impact of political forces upon federal, state, and local educational policies will be considered. Labor relations will be analyzed. Empowerment of teachers will be examined. 3 semester hours', 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1181, 'Org,Admin & Supv RDLA', 'EDLD-611A', '611A', 'This course focuses on the role of the Reading and Language Arts Consultant as an educational leader in schools and school districts and focuses on issues of organization, administration, and supervision of reading and language arts programs. Note: Students enrolled in this course must also concurrently enroll in EDLD 611 Administration: Organizing, and Staffing Educational Institutions. While EDLD 611 focuses on the broader issues of educational leadership in schools, EDLD 611A specifically focuses on reading and language arts programs and personnel. 1 semester hour', 58, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1182, 'Contemp Educ Issues', 'EDLD-613', '613', 'This is an investigation of concepts, research findings, and practices focusing on the development and change of educational organizations in relation to relevant goals and objectives. Emphasis is placed on such areas as leadership theory and behavior, organizational climate, human relations and communications within the organization, and change strategies. Theoretical concepts of leadership are integrated along with practical applications. 3 semester hours', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1183, 'School Facility Leadership/Mgt', 'EDLD-614', '614', null, 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1184, 'Research & Data Informed Supervision', 'EDLD-615', '615', null, 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1185, 'School Finance', 'EDLD-618', '618', 'This is a study of educational fiscal control including: budget preparation and presentation, accounting procedures, tax structures, analyses of costs, comparative data and auditing. Includes federal, state and local phases of support of educational systems. Special emphasis is given to New York and Connecticut fiscal patterns. 3 semester hours', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1186, 'School Law', 'EDLD-619', '619', 'This is a study of the legal basis for public education in the United States; a study of state and federal statutes providing for education. An examination is made of statutes, court decisions, and policies and practices arising out of these factors. The legal status of boards, teachers, administrators, pupils and parents is examined with special emphasis on New York and Connecticut. 3 semester hours', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1187, 'Eval School Effective', 'EDLD-621', '621', 'This course examines the various ways to evaluate the effectiveness of a school?s performance: student achievement, faculty performance, faculty morale, provision for diverse student needs and development of student emotional growth. The course examines how data can and should affect instructional issues. 3 semester hours', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1188, 'Wkshop Curr Dev', 'EDLD-651', '651', null, 58, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1189, 'Supervision:Eval/Prof Dev', 'EDLD-652', '652', 'This is a study of concepts and strategies focusing on the evaluation of teachers and other educators for purposes of performance improvement and quality assurance. Emphasis will be placed on research findings, current practices, and the achievement of competency related to classroom observation and evaluation, the planning and implementation of professional development, and the creation of organizational climate and human relationships conducive to effective evaluation and professional growth of educators. 3 semester hours', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1190, 'Map It Forward: Curriculum Ldrshp', 'EDLD-661X', '661X', 'The course is designed to increase knowledge, understanding, and competencies required for researching and designing curriculum considering the needs of 21st century learners. Topics to be examined include: UDL, CBC, extended knowledge of the CCSS with additional focus on the NGSS and C-3 framework for social studies.', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1191, 'Spvs Prg Students w/Exceptionalities', 'EDLD-664', '664', 'The emphasis is on the administrative aspects of Special Education programs for schools. 3 semester hours', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1192, 'Urban Leadership', 'EDLD-680A', '680A', 'Offered by arrangement. 1-6 semester hours', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1193, 'Internship Educ Leadership', 'EDLD-681A', '681A', 'A cooperatively guided administrative experience in a school system. Pre-requisite: Completion of major portion of the requirements for the Sixth Year Professional Diploma and permission of major advisor. 3 semester hours', 58, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1194, 'Spec Topics:Supervision', 'EDLD-682', '682', 'Special department offerings including workshops, conferences, institutes focusing on new developments in the field. 1-6 semester hours', 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1195, 'Internship-RLA', 'EDLD-683', '683', 'This course is a cooperatively guided administrative experience in the area of literacy education for those desiring to be certified as Reading and Language Arts Consultants. The internship includes a series of practicum experiences in a variety of school settings and includes research in the area of literacy education. Students gain practical field based experience through a range of tasks and situations characteristic of the position of the Reading and Language Arts Consultant in school settings. 6 semester hours', 58, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1196, 'Classroom Behavior Mgt for Educ and Admn', 'EDLD-699', '699', null, 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1197, 'Continuing Doctoral Seminar', 'EDLD-800D', '800D', 'The seminar meets periodically during the academic year and for two full weeks each summer, for three consecutive summers. It provides opportunities for students to work with scholars and leaders from a variety of disciplines to broaden perspectives on educational leadership and to develop an intellectual style for dealing with educational problems. 6 semester hours per year', 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1198, 'Program Dev and Curriculum Theory', 'EDLD-801', '801', 'EDLD 801 section A: Emphasis of this seminar is on a historical overview of curricula theory and the current research and practice relevant to curriculum design, planning and monitoring in educational settings. This course provides an introduction to conceptions of curriculum and their effects on pedagogy from a historical perspective, with particular emphasis on discerning and interpreting how social, cultural, and political circumstances shape educational practices.  EDLD 801 section B: The focus of this seminar is on professional development processes and applications. Topics to be examined include the following: understanding by design, concept-based professional development goals and objectives, needs assessment, implementation strategies, and evaluation techniques for conducting rigorous professional development designed to improve organizations and personnel. ', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1199, 'Constitutional Law', 'EDLD-804', '804', 'Legal questions relating to personnel, students, community, religion, finance, school property, teacher organizations, equality of opportunity and other legal and political issues with which the educational leader must be familiar in order to be effective in decision-making and organizational development are investigated. Emphasis is placed on landmark judicial decisions, recent statutory developments, and constitutional background. Students will read, analyze, and interpret significant Supreme Court decisions regarding educational matters as well as pertinent lower federal and state court decisions. The principal of non-judicial remedies will be explored and the appeals process will be examined in detail.', 58, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1200, 'Grant Writing, Procurement and Policy', 'EDLD-805', '805', 'EDLD 805 Section A: This seminar provides the background and experience in the grant writing process for major federal and state discretionary competitions and private funding agency grants.  EDLD 805 Section B: This seminar will focus on the preparation of proposals to National Science Foundation, the United States Department of Education (USDOE)-including Office of Special Education Programs (OSEP & OSERS), The Institute of Educational Science (IES), The United States Department of Health and Human Services (USDHHS), and the Connecticut State Education Department. Private foundations and organizations will also be considered for competitions that total $100,000 or more.', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1201, 'Policy', 'EDLD-806', '806', null, 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1202, 'Q.A.& Eval Strat', 'EDLD-806A', '806A', 'This course considers current techniques for designing, implementing and analyzing projects in education and typical models for facilitating decision-making. The elements of personnel and program assessment within the contemporary educational system are included. Strategies focusing upon experiential learning and community contact are featured, and the student will be exposed to collection and analysis of real data and related computer simulation activities. Statistical and evaluative investigations are emphasized which are both fundamental and sufficiently sophisticated for advanced decision-making and leadership. This course is required. 6 semester hours', 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1203, 'Quant Analy & Eval Strat', 'EDLD-806B', '806B', 'This course considers current techniques for designing, implementing and analyzing projects in education and typical models for facilitating decision-making. The elements of personnel and program assessment within the contemporary educational system are included. Strategies focusing upon experiential learning and community contact are featured, and the student will be exposed to collection and analysis of real data and related computer simulation activities. Statistical and evaluative investigations are emphasized which are both fundamental and sufficiently sophisticated for advanced decision-making and leadership. This course is required. 6 semester hours', 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1204, 'Org Theories and Management', 'EDLD-807', '807', 'EDLD 807 Section A: The emphasis of this seminar is placed on leadership theories, organizational climate, human relations, and communication within organizations. The course covers a historical overview of organization and leadership theories and the culminating project is defining and defending a philosophy of leadership. EDLD 807 Section B: This seminar is designed for students in their first semester of the program to be introduced to the School of Education graduate faculty who will co-teach the course presenting their areas of expertise. This course provides the opportunity for students to be introduced to the faculty so that they can determine who might be applicable members of their dissertation committee.', 58, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1205, 'Program Evaluation and Human Relations', 'EDLD-808', '808', 'EDLD 808 Section A: This seminar focuses on program evaluation techniques including multiple means of assessment that will be discussed and considered. Concepts such as reliability, validity, credibility, and authenticity will be explored as well as summative and formative data collection and analysis strategies. The program evaluation approach will be applied to authentic experiences and scenarios that focus on assessing and evaluating institutions, programs, teaching, and learning.  EDLD 808 Section B: This seminar focuses on the purposes, issues, and controversies surrounding human relations with emphasis on organization development and change theories. The process of strategic planning as a vehicle to improve organizational effectiveness through human relations will be emphasized', 58, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1206, 'International Education', 'EDLD-809', '809', null, 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1207, 'Intro Quant, Qual Methods Research', 'EDLD-811', '811', 'Introduction to Research is an overview course in research methodology and evaluation techniques relevant to the conduct of qualitative, quantitative, action, and mixed methods studies of leadership, curriculum, teaching, and learning. Fundamentals of, quantitative, qualitative, action and mixed methods research will be introduced from five prominent dimensions: leadership, curricula, program evaluation, teaching, and assessment.', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1208, 'Quantitative Research', 'EDLD-812', '812', 'One of the greatest challenges faced by school leaders is harnessing the power of data to drive school improvement.  To this end, in the present climate of rapidly emerging research findings and data-driven decision-making, today\'s leaders must be able to perform, analyze, and critically interpret statistics.  Hence, this course is designed to prepare doctoral students to perform dissertation research by giving them fundamental understanding of the quantitative research methodology.  Overall, this course will provide students with: (a) the fundamental of descriptive and inferential statistics necessary to manipulate quantitative information,(b)the necessary frameworks to describe, interpret, and critique the components of various quantitative research studies in education, and (c)the conceptual understanding of the experimental and non-experimental research methodologies.', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1209, 'Literature Review', 'EDLD-813', '813', 'Literature review EDLD 813 Section A is designed to be taken in the summer of the first year after students have taken introductory research and quantitative research methods in the program.  Conducting the literature review helps refine the student\'s topic, the dissertation proposal, and prepares students for writing the Human Subject approval application.  Literature review theory focuses on the theoretical assumptions associated with the dissertation topic. This course should be taken in the second year of the program after EDLD 813A Literature Review has been taken.', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1210, 'Literature Theory', 'EDLD-813A', '813A', null, 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1211, 'Qualitative Research and Evaluation Stra', 'EDLD-814', '814', 'Qualitative research and evaluative Strategies introduces students to theoretical, paradigmatic and methodological research perspectives associated with the qualitative tradition. Case studies, grounded theory, ethnographic, and narrative approaches will be presented in this class paying particular attention to interpretive, critical, and participatory research techniques, methodologies and methods. Qualitative evaluation techniques used in program evaluations will be emphasized.  EDLD 814 introduces students to practical research techniques including the development of semi structured and open ended interview questions, how to conduct, record and analyze interviews, and the use of field notes when collecting observation data.  Emphasis will be placed on understanding the ramifications of purposeful sampling, forms of credibility, the role of the researcher, and ethical dimensions associated with qualitative inquiry.', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1212, 'Mixed Methods Research', 'EDLD-815', '815', 'Mixed method research introduces students to mixed-method research in the social sciences. Students should have some familiarity with research (quantitative and/or qualitative) and the epistemological and ontological underpinnings of the two methods as well as a basic understanding of their educational or social science research topic. This course completes the process of the proposal preparation expanding methodological and procedural techniques used in dissertation process. Specific objectives for this course include: (a) the history and language of mixed method research in education/social sciences; (b) summarization of current issues related to the paradigm wars and where mixed-methods research currently fits into education/social sciences; (c) advance understanding of research issued in educational/social sciences through discussions about paradigmatic compatibility, the current standing of mixed-methods in academic and political field, and the process and design of mixed-method studies;(d) proposal writing strategies including for mixed-methods research;(e) data sampling, collection and analysis strategies including for mixed method research;(f) reflections about the role of the researcher and their worldview in a mixed methods design. ', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1213, 'Action Research Project', 'EDLD-816', '816', 'The Action Research seminar is the second year summer project designed to help students understand how to conduct, evaluate and disseminate research. This culminating research projects starts after students have completed introduction to research (EDLD 811), quantitative (EDLD 812) qualitative (EDLD 814) and mixed method research (EDLD 815) in the second year of program. Conducting a case study or a collaborative action research project helps refine practical research skills, presentation techniques, and the ability to publish', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1214, 'Postsecondary Teaching', 'EDLD-817', '817', 'Post-secondary teaching provides students the opportunity to determine if working in higher education is preferred. This class is to be taken as a final class in the program course sequence. Repeatable up to 8 credits.', 58, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1220, 'Dissertation: Comprehensive Exam', 'EDLD-845', '845', 'During the third year of the program, students participate in this seminar in preparation for their 30 day, 3 question 45+ page comprehensive examination. Students should only take EDLD 845 after they have completed all of their courses or with the prior approval of their Chair. ', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1221, 'Dissertation: Proposal Defense', 'EDLD-846', '846', 'During the third year of the program, students participate in this seminar which focus on the selection and development of a dissertation proposal. Students are ordinarily expected to complete the major portion of their work on the dissertation proposal prior to the conclusion of the formal part of the program', 58, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1222, 'Continuous Dissertation', 'EDLD-850', '850', 'Individual research and advisement relative to a student\'s dissertation topic is the sine qua non of this course. Doctoral candidates are expected to register for Continuous Dissertation 850 every semester (Fall, Spring and Summer) until their dissertations have received final approval. Prerequisite: Successful completion of EDLD 845 Dissertation Proposal and EDLD 846 Comprehensive Examination. 0 semester hours', 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1223, 'Special Education for Administrators', 'EDLD-864', '864', 'Supervision of Programs & Services for Stu dents with Exceptionalities. This course is designed to prepare school ad ministrators with the skills to supervise and implement appropriate services for students in need of response to intervention services Educational Leadership 312 and/or programs for students identified as in need of special education services. An emphasis is on service delivery models, due process procedures and supervision of specialists responsible for providing services to identified students. 3 semester hours', 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1224, 'Administrative Internship', 'EDLD-881', '881', 'EDLD 800D Continuing Doctorial Seminars meet the nine credit residency requirement designated at the inception of the program.Seminar topics are designed to help prepare doctoral students for the comprehensive examination, dissertation research process, and specific concepts related to students intrests in the Education Leadership Program. EDLD 818a Adminstrative Leadership Experience required for 092 Certifucation in the State of Connecticut. this class should to be taken in conjuction with or after EDLD 816 Action Research Project in the second or third summer of program.', 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1225, 'Administrative Internship + CAT Exam', 'EDLD-881A', '881A', null, 58, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1076, 'Creating Caring Classroom Relationships', 'EDMM-558', '558', '\"Creating Caring Classroom Relationships To  Improve Social Emotional Student Learning\"   Description: Nurturing a student\'s emotional and  social well-being where teachers are skilled in  leading with their heart will create a positive  classroom climate which will support both student  intellectual growth and life skills such as   self-management, self-awareness, responsible  decision making, social awareness and  relationship skills.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1077, 'Gamify Your Classroom', 'EDMM-559', '559', 'Game   mechanics   aren\'t   just   used   in    video   games.   The   Girl/Boy   Scouts   and    the   armed   forces   have   always used    badges   and   ranks   to   motivate.    Businesses   use   gamification   to   train    employees   and   encourage customer   loyalty.    Fitness   trainers   are   using   it   with    clients   to   set   goals.   And   now   K-grad    classrooms   are embracing   gamification    techniques   in   increasing   numbers.   In this  class you will learn   how   to   apply   game    mechanics   to   your   own   Google   (or    actual)   classroom   in   any subject   area.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1078, 'Effective Planning and Instruction', 'EDMM-590', '590', 'This course focuses on high leverage planning and instructional strategies for effective teaching. An overview of the requirements for the clinical practice portfolio in resident teaching is included.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1086, 'No Room For Bullying', 'EDMM-607', '607', 'See and hear what may be going on beneath the surface right in front of you.  Establish a bully free zone in your classes.  Establish positive relationships, respect and tolerance.  Students can\'t learn in a stressful environment and worse than that, they devalue themselves.  Gain the skills to make a difference in your room, school and in a child\'s life. This class will meet on-line Friday and at the Stamford Center on Saturday.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1100, '^Content Review in Elem Liter', 'EDMM-621', '621', 'This course is designed to prepare participants for the Connecticut Foundation of Reading and the Praxis II Reading and Language Arts tests.  This course reviews content from EDUC 573, EDUC 574, and EDUC 440C including Concepts of Print, Phonological Awareness, Phonics, Fluency, Vocabulary, Comprehension, Language in Writing, and Communication Skills of Speaking, Listening and Viewing.', 57, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

The read-aloud plans invite students to grapple, ponder and debate, building student discourse and perspectives.', 57, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1105, '^Principles of Early Childhood Educ', 'EDMM-626', '626', 'This course is designed as an overview of early childhood care and education, including the basic values, structure, organization and programming used in early childhood learning. Students will gain knowledge and understanding of the theoretical and practical aspects of working with children from birth to age four and how to use that knowledge to create healthy, respectful, supportive and challenging learning environments.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1106, '^Questions to Focus Learning', 'EDMM-627', '627', 'Many school systems are using essential questions as part of a reform effort.  Students will learn how to develop, use, and evaluate the effectiveness of essential questions.  In addition students will learn how to apply these questions to daily classroom activities.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1107, '^Family & Community Partnerships in Ece', 'EDMM-628', '628', 'This course provides students with an understanding of how valuable working with families and communities are to a successful early childhood education program. How to create respectful, reciprocal relationships with both the families and community agencies that enhance the child\'s development and early learning will be stressed', 57, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1118, 'Topics: African Amer History', 'EDMM-639', '639', 'In short, the course aims to critically examine African Americans during the 20th century. We will examine the charismatic leaders of the 20th as well as the everyday ordinary folks who constitute the bottom up masses who struggled over the course of the century to achieve equity within American society. Given the current events that are dominating headlines, which deals with the issue of race, gender and class, this course will ask the following questions: What are the historical roots of inequality? How do we define agency of marginal groups? Is the black freedom struggle ongoing? Have we achieved a post racial society? ', 57, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1123, 'Character Education', 'EDMM-644', '644', 'Review strategies for K-12 teachers to develop positive student character through instructional and management techniques. Participants are introduced to a comprehensive model for modern character education, provided opportunities to experience character ed. activities and investigate current resources. A syllabus is available via email. In addition, a copy of the course notes must be obtained prior to class, either by downloading from Class UB Blackboard or by purchasing from the instructor:', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1126, 'Supporting Families/Children W/Disabilit', 'EDMM-647', '647', 'Teachers are specifically trained to understand and teach students with special needs. Forming partnerships with families of students with challenges is the best way to advocate for universal access to educational services for students in need. Learn the most successful approaches to foster family involvement and positive parent-teacher relationships. This class will meet on-line Friday and at the Stamford Center on Saturday.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1127, 'Kindness As Educational Context', 'EDMM-648', '648', null, 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1129, 'Critters in the Classroom', 'EDMM-650', '650', 'How many situations can you think of in which animal critters benefit individuals?  The classroom is another!    Pets within the classroom environment promote an emotionally safe student learning environment and cultivate responsibility, teamwork, compassion and respect for differences as well as kindness.  They also have been used successfully for decreasing anxiety in potentially stressful situations and providing learning opportunities for interdisciplinary approaches that will aid with Next Generation Science Standards. Join us in exploring all of these and implementing specific strategies that will benefit your learning environment!', 57, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1130, 'Service Learning', 'EDMM-651', '651', null, 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1131, '^Digital Teaching Portfolios', 'EDMM-652', '652', 'In this course students will focus on developing a digital teaching portfolio.  Students will affirm their teaching philosophy.  Students will learn which items to include in their portfolio based on their teaching domain.  There will be a focus on understanding the purpose of and audience for the portfolio.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1132, 'Nurturing Teacher/Stud Imagination', 'EDMM-653', '653', null, 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1136, '^Dvlpmtlly Appropriate Ece Classrooms', 'EDMM-657', '657', 'This course presents the key processes involved in the planning, implementation and evaluation of developmentally appropriate practices (DAP) in early childhood education. Main emphasis is on how developmentally appropriate practices translate into everyday decisions and actions found in early childhood classrooms.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1137, 'The Teenage Brain', 'EDMM-658', '658', 'This seminar will introduce the student to current research about the neurological development of the teenage brain and how this influences their decision-making. Participants will learn some effective instructional strategies, social-emotional coping, and parental involvement guidelines.  1 credit', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1138, 'Teaching Shakespeare', 'EDMM-660', '660', ' The name Shakespeare conjures fear in the hearts  of students and teachers  alike. From a student\'s  perspective, the plays of Shakespeare are  difficult and dense. From a teacher\'s point of  view, the material is challenging to make  interesting and understandable. The purpose of  this course is to explore methods of making  Shakespeare less intimidating and hopefully a joy  to teach and learn. Our focus will be on  strategies that will give students \'ownership\' of  the text.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1139, 'Responding to Misbehavior', 'EDMM-661', '661', null, 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1140, 'Instructional Strategies for Teaching de', 'EDMM-662', '662', 'Instructional Strategies for Teaching Decimals and  Fractions to Elementary Students  This course will focus on instructional strategies  to effectively teach fractions and decimals to  students in Grades 3-5.  There will be an  emphasis on utilizing the  Concrete-Representational-Abstract (C-R-A)  approach to instruction and how it aligns to the  Connecticut Core Standards and the Standards for  Mathematical Practice.  Time will also be spent  the Three-Part Problem Solving Plan used in  rigorous real-world problems.', 57, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1141, 'Strat Enhance Substitute Teaching', 'EDMM-663', '663', null, 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1142, 'Preparing for Team Training', 'EDMM-664', '664', null, 57, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1143, 'Connecticut History', 'EDMM-665', '665', 'The history of a place is more than just a  collection of dates and names - it is a hundred  thousand interconnected stories of people who  live there. In this class we will learn about  Connecticut, whose citizens have become some of  the most important and interesting Americans. But  even this limited history is practically endless,  with dozens of stories in every town, in every  family. So, by focusing on a small, yet  fascinating place we will hopefully find an  appreciation for the depth and breadth of history  itself. We will also focus on the way that this  history can be integrated into various classroom  settings, in order to link our students to the  place they live.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1144, '7 Habits Highly Effective Educators', 'EDMM-666', '666', null, 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1150, 'Urban Education', 'EDMM-672', '672', 'Understanding the urban student can be very difficult for educators in the 21st century. Values, attitudes and communication styles are vastly different from students raised in a middle class suburban environment.  This course will discuss how teachers can begin to understand the psychological, social, economic and environmental influences affecting students in urban education today.  ', 57, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1154, '^Content Review for Science', 'EDMM-676', '676', 'This course is designed to offer broad knowledge and competencies in Earth, Life and Physical sciences. It focuses on fundamental scientific concepts, principles, and interrelationships within the content of real-world, meaningful scientific phenomena, problems and issues. It focuses on basic understanding of Earth, life processes, and physical matter and energy. Additionally, an understanding of the nature of science as a complex human enterprise with a distinct philosophy and methodology and a place and role in the society, is crucial. This course helps its participants relate to physical, earth, and life science concepts through discussions, and question-and-answer sessions.', 57, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1155, 'STEM for Teacher Educators', 'EDMM-677', '677', 'The course focuses on the mathematics, biology, and engineering aspects of signal processing.', 57, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1161, 'Bloom\'s Taxonomy & Creative Classroom', 'EDMM-683', '683', 'Bloom\'s Taxonomy accounts for the traditional learning methods occurring in our practicing classrooms, through behaviors and actions. Today\'s learners process information differently than any other generation. By integrating Bloom\'s Digital Taxonomy we can facilitate learning using methods which will increase the competence and quality of student work. Let\'s explore ideas of project and problem based learning using all levels of Blooms. ', 57, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1162, 'Secondary Social Studies Praxis II Prep', 'EDMM-684', '684', 'This course is designed for you to pass the Praxis II Social Studies: Content Knowledge exam. The course will provide you with a comprehensive overview and increase your odds of success on this standardized test: review all key content areas, learn test strategies, and implement a study plan.  This is an essential course for all secondary social studies majors.', 57, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1163, 'Curr Development for Teachers', 'EDMM-685', '685', null, 57, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1164, 'Total Participation Techniques', 'EDMM-686', '686', 'The course would include an understanding of the  research supporting student engagement with  diverse/inclusive environments.    A toolbox of  engagement techniques would be made during the  class and students would plan a short 10 minute  lesson to demonstrate using techniques.   The  course will include all grade levels, K-12.', 57, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1168, 'Athletic Coaching', 'EDMM-690', '690', null, 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1169, 'Athletic Directorship', 'EDMM-691', '691', 'The correct training and education in order to become a high school athletic director is the foundation of this seminar.  This course will start at the beginning with strategies for interviewing and securing the position in this competitive arena.  From there we will cover effective teaching strategies to mentor  and manage different types of coaches in the wide scope of high school athletic departments.  The basic daily administrative functions and overall responsibilities encompassing each coaching season will also be addressed.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1170, 'Teacher Leadership', 'EDMM-692', '692', null, 57, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1171, 'Strat for Program Development in Ece', 'EDMM-693', '693', 'Students will examine the necessary skills and professional competencies needed to be effective early childhood program managers. Topics include: organizational vision and mission, objectives and functions of staff supervision, guidelines for recruiting, hiring, and evaluating a diverse staff, team building, conflict resolution and effective management approaches.', 57, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1172, 'A Practical Guide to CCT', 'EDMM-694', '694', null, 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1173, 'Explore the Common Core', 'EDMM-695', '695', 'Common Core State Standards is a hot topic for everyone in the education community.  Explore the organization, key components and practical strategies for teaching and learning with the Common Core. Come away with resources that will help you in your real life. This class will meet on-line Friday and at the Stamford Center on Saturday.', 57, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1174, 'Strtg Teaching Boys & Girls', 'EDMM-696', '696', null, 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1175, '^Character Study', 'EDMM-697', '697', 'A Character Study Using strong children\'s literature and mini-lessons that stick, participants will learn how to build students understanding of character through questioning, partnership work, jotting and writing long.  Participants will develop mini-lessons that are specific to their individual grade-levels.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1176, 'Data Driven School Practice', 'EDMM-698', '698', 'The NCLB Act places emphasis on using instructional practices that have provided evidence of their effectiveness through rigorous scientific research. This course provides pre-service teachers with the information they need to determine what is meant by evidence, the types of evidence that can be used to support educational change, and the issues that need to be addressed when educators adopt evidence-based practices in their classrooms.', 57, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1177, 'Testing & Assessment Strategies in Educ', 'EDMM-699', '699', 'Tests and assessments are essential to effectively evaluate and enhance students\' learning and teachers\' instruction, conversely, they can confuse and alienate students, distort curriculum, and hinder good instruction. Results are used to improve instruction and hold schools accountable for quality of instruction. Test-based reform efforts have stirred much controversy and are causing educators to rethink assessment. Learn strategies to help you meet standards and understand the public pressures as well as instructional need for good assessment.', 57, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(988, 'Hist & Phil of Educ', 'EDUC-304', '304', null, 56, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');
