insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1226, 'Co-Op Work Experience', 'ELEG-200', '200', null, 59, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1227, 'Engineering Mathematics W/App', 'ELEG-208', '208', 'Course Description: _ This course provides a foundation in mathematical principles with applications in - engineering. It reviews functions, limit, derivatives, and integration and covers a broad spectrum of mathematical techniques important to the solution of engineering problems. Topics include ordinary and partial differential equations, power series, parametric and polar curves, vectors and matrices, linear algebra, the Laplace transform, the z transform, the Fourier series. Application of these topic to the solution of engineering problems is stressed.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1228, 'Engineering Analysis', 'ELEG-209', '209', null, 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1229, 'Digital Design I', 'ELEG-210', '210', 'Basic digital design principles. Boolean algebra. Combinational logic design with gates, MSI, LSI. Sequential logic design; register, counters, memory and programmable logic. Prerequisite: Mathematical sophistication. 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1230, 'Network Analysis I', 'ELEG-233', '233', 'DC circuits, mesh, node voltages, superposition. Steady-state AC, read/imaginary power. Bode plots, Ideal op-amp circuit analysis. Pre-requisite: Math 110 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1231, 'Network Analyis II', 'ELEG-234', '234', 'Transient analysis of 1-pole and 2-ple circuits using differential equations and Laplace transforms. Fourier series derivation and application to electric circuits. Comparison of Fourier transform to Laplace transform. Pre-requisite: Electrical Engineering 233 2 semester hours ', 59, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1232, 'Network Analysis I Lab', 'ELEG-235', '235', 'Use of resistor networks and DC voltage sources in various configurations; measurements of current flow and voltage difference. Introduction to RLC circuits in steady AC conditions. Familiarization with standard laboratory instruments. Co-requisite: Electrical Engineering 233 1 three-hour laboratory, 1 semester hour ', 59, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1233, 'Network Analy II Lab', 'ELEG-236', '236', 'Steady state and transient analysis of RLC circuits. Typical series and parallel resonance circuits are examined and their parameters experimentally determined; two pole network analysis; transformers; frequency response plots. Extensive use of the oscilloscope. Pre-requisite: Electrical Engineering 235, Co-requisite: Electrical Engineering 234. 1 three-hour laboratory, 1 semester hour ', 59, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1234, 'Intro to Microprocessor', 'ELEG-286', '286', 'Theory and application of microprocessors, and associated peripheral devices such as memory, ports, clocks, system design and debugging techniques, including specific design problems using existing devices. Programming aids, including assemblers and simulators. Programming problems including peripheral device service routines and arithmetic operations. Information structures for real-time data acquisition systems. Prerequisite: Computer Engineering 210 and Computer Science 102. 3 lecture hours; 1 three-hour laboratory; 3 semester hours', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1235, 'Econ&Mgmt Engr Projects', 'ELEG-300', '300', 'The design process, engineering economics, project planning and ethics in engineering practice. A required course for all Computer Science majors, normally taken in the junior year, offered both semesters. Prerequisite: Computer Science 102, 102a, Math 215, Physics 112 and junior standing. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1236, 'Fiber Optics', 'ELEG-315', '315', 'Communication via light waves over fiber optics cables. Analysis of light emission and light detection. Absorption loss. Optical devices, connectors, splices and Local Area Network (LANs). Pre-requisite: Physics 112 or equivalent. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1237, 'Fiber Optics Lab', 'ELEG-316', '316', 'Communication via light waves over fiber optics cables. Analysis of light emission and light detection. Absorption loss. Optical devices, connectors, splices and Local Area Networks (LANs). Pre-requisite: Physics 112 or equivalent. 3 lecture hours; 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1238, 'Controls', 'ELEG-317', '317', 'Analysis of steady state and transient response of control systems. Laplace transforms methods. Transfer functions.Stability criteria. Nyquist, Bode and root locus methods. System stabilization, System Design.', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1239, 'Signals and Systems', 'ELEG-333', '333', 'Students learn to analyze theoretically and by computer both continuous and discrete signals and the application of each to realworld problems. Applications involve the definition of a system, defined either by a laplace or z-transform and the output of same to the application of any input signal.', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1240, 'Digital Design II With Laboratory', 'ELEG-336', '336', 'esign of complex digital systems; top-down design and modularization. Implementation of controllers. Use of hardware design languages (VHDL) to implement systems. Rapid prototyping. Fault tolerant design. Prerequisite: Computer Engineering 210. Laboratory includes implementation of digital systems using FPGAs. 3 lecture hours; 4 semester hours; 1 three hour laboratory', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1241, 'Analog Electronic Lab I', 'ELEG-337', '337', 'This is a hands-on analog circuit design lab. You will combine integrated circuits and discrete electronic components to design practical analog circuits for day-to-day industry use.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1242, 'Analog Electronics Lab II', 'ELEG-338', '338', 'This course focuses on designing of BJT\'s and FET\'s amplifiers. Students focus on design parameters such as gain, frequency response and matching impedance. Students develop in-depth understanding of theory of electronic devices and circuits through practical experiments.   ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1243, 'Field Theory', 'ELEG-341', '341', 'The course covers fundamental concepts of RF circuit design. Students will learn circuit level design of high speed analog/RF circuits. Specific topics include impact of scaling and noise in high-speed communication circuits, low noise amplifiers, mixers, power amplifiers and frequency synthesizers. 3 lecture hours; 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1244, 'Modern Communication Systems', 'ELEG-342', '342', 'Eleg 342 is the first course on communications within the Electrical Engineering program.  The objective of the course is to familiarize undergraduate students to the fundamentals of modern digital and analog communications systems.  3cr. Pre-Req: eleg 234', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1245, 'Digital Signal Proc I', 'ELEG-343', '343', 'Basic digital design principles. Boolean algebra. Combinational logic design with gates, MSI, LSI. Sequential logic design; register, counters, memory and programmable logic. Prerequisite: Mathematical sophistication. 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1246, 'Power Electronics', 'ELEG-344', '344', null, 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1247, 'MEMS', 'ELEG-346', '346', 'MEMS (Microelectromechanical systems ) refers to devices and system with very small size in the range of microns. It is one of the most important high technologies developed in 20th century. This course covers the fundamentals of MEMS. It includes the introduction to MEMS, basic microfabrication techniques, MEMS materials and their properties, MEMS device design and simulation, working principle analysis, MEMS device fabrication sequence, MEMS packaging and assembly, signal testing, MEMS applications (inertial MEMS, MOEMS, BioMEMS, RFMEMS, etc ) 3 credit hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1248, 'Electronics', 'ELEG-348', '348', 'Application of diodes, bipolar transistors (BJT) and field effect transistors (FET) to signal amplification and switching. Computer Simulation. Pre-requisite: ELEG 233, Pre-requisite: ELEG 235. 3 semester hours; 3 semester hours', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1249, 'Senior Project', 'ELEG-349', '349', 'Student work for approximately 150 hours performing research work within the department of Electrical Engineering. Emphasis is on good technical writing and imaginative design of solutions to a given problem.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1250, 'Senior Design Project', 'ELEG-349A', '349A', 'Student work for approximately 150 hours performing research work within the department of Electrical Engineering. Emphasis is on good technical writing and imaginative design of solutions to a given problem.', 59, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1251, 'Senior Design Project', 'ELEG-349B', '349B', 'Continuation of Design Project', 59, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1252, 'Communications Lab', 'ELEG-350', '350', 'Hands-on experience with digital and analog communication equipment, AM, FM and digital modulation techniques. Design and test of optimal configuration. Measurement of performance parameters in the presence of thermal noise. Pre-requisite: Electrical engineering 441.   3 Semester hours', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1253, 'Modern Communications', 'ELEG-351', '351', 'The course teaches the undergraduate student the fundamentals of both analog and digital communications, and it shows how analog technology is used to produce modern systems for the transmission of digital data.', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1254, 'Controls Lab', 'ELEG-361', '361', 'Laboratory study of feedback control systems with experiments analyzing different types of plants, transducers and control techniques, emphasis on real-time computer control.', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1255, 'Programmable Logic Control', 'ELEG-364', '364', 'This course will start with the basics of Boolean Algebra; it will cite the differences between PLC control and relay control and full automation of major machines and appliances; the differences in these controls will show how hard relay control is to implement and how flexible PLC control actually is; many different math functions will be analyzed and implemented in the theoretical construction of fully functioning PLC. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1256, 'Digital Integrated Ckts Desn', 'ELEG-383', '383', 'Several integrated circuit architectures are analyzed at the transmitter level to find key parameters by hand analysis as well as computer simulation: rise time, fall time, noise margins, logic state, hysteresis/memory, fanout, and power dissipation. Analysis includes an analysis of the major logic families: TTL,CMOS, NMOS, ECL, PECL, differential logic. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1257, 'Analog Intg Ckt Desn', 'ELEG-388', '388', 'Do a complete analysis of the 741 op-amp, including bandwidth, gain analysis, slew rate, power efficiency and I/O impedances. Analyze ROM, Ram, TTL, ECL, CMOS and more modern logic structures including Fanout, noise margin, latching, contention, logic and delay response. Pre-requisite: Electrical Engineering 348 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1258, 'Ind Study', 'ELEG-399', '399', 'Independent study of advanced topics in Electrical Engineering. Problem assignment to be arranged with and appproved by the department.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1259, 'RF VLSI', 'ELEG-403', '403', 'The course covers fundamental concepts of RF circuit design. Students will learn circuit level design of high speed analog/RF circuits. Specific topics include impact of scaling and noise in high-speed communication circuits, low noise amplifiers, mixers, power amplifiers and frequency synthesizers. 3 lecture hours; 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1260, 'Digital VLSI', 'ELEG-404', '404', 'The objective of this course is to teach students the CMOS transistor design in VLSI circuits. (CMOS stands for complementary metal oxide semiconductor.) Supported by CAD tools, students will learn gate level design, IC design, fabrication, and layout of digital CMOS integrated circuits. With these skills, students will also be able to interact with integrated circuit fabrication process engineers after completing this course. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1261, 'Random Signal Processing', 'ELEG-405', '405', 'Change the name to Random Signal Processing. Topics in the course Statistics for Engineers and Random Signal Processing are the same. However, Random Signal Processing is a better title, since it pertains to modern applications of statistics for Engineers in the real-world.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1262, 'Soft Computing I', 'ELEG-406', '406', 'Modeling and solving engineering problems using computational methods. Topics include exact (provable) methods ( linear and convex programming) and fast methods ( heuristic search, genetic algorithm, neural networks, etc ) 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1263, 'Fuzzy Logic Systems', 'ELEG-407', '407', 'A study of fuzzy set theory and applications. Topics include (a) fundamental concepts of fuzzy logic, (b) fuzzy sets, (c)fuzzy model identification, (d) neuro-fuzzy systems, (e) fuzzy logic in control engineering, and (f) fuzzy logic in pattern recognition and artifical intelligence.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1264, 'Numerical Analysis', 'ELEG-408X', '408X', 'This course is done on the computer using the package Matlab. Course includes mathematical modeling, solutions to one or more linear systems of equations (including Gaussian elimination, iteration, Newton\'s method, and secant method), simple interpolation and spline interpolation, finding values of exact integrals (Romberg and Gaussian quadrature), solution of ordinary differential equations (Euler and Runge-Kutta), and the solution of partial differential equations. ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1265, 'Data Acq & Virtual Instr Lab', 'ELEG-409', '409', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1266, 'Data Acq & Virtual Instr Lab', 'ELEG-409X', '409X', 'This is an introductory lab for the real-time data acquisition and instrument controls. The purpose of this course is to introduce students to the field of data communication between the computers and instruments with experiments. These experiments cover the LabView programming for the interface to communicate with different instruments or data acquisition boards through GPIB, RS232, and USB cables. After the students complete this course, they are expected to be able to set up their own systems for different testing and controls.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1267, 'Bio-Sensors', 'ELEG-410', '410', 'This course will provide an interview of biosensors, including their use in Pharmaceutical research, diagnostic testing, and policing the environment. Topics include the sensitivity resolution, selectivity, dynamic range, and noise of biosensor. Other topics covered include transducer phenomenology, biosensor structure, and sensor performance. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1268, 'Plc Solutions in Industrial Applications', 'ELEG-411', '411', 'This course builds on PLC\'s (ELEG 464) by using sensors (both thermal sensors, motion sensors, and camera input) to control the automation process; topics in servo motors, variable frequency drives, and HMI (human machine interaction) and touch screens are also introduced both in theory and in a lab setting. 3 lecture hours; 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1269, 'Bioelectronics', 'ELEG-412', '412', 'Discipline of biomedical Engineering has emerged due to integration of engineering principles and technology into medicine. This course is intended for engineers and engineering students interested in persuing career in biomedical engineering and health related filed. This copurse will first introduction Applications of electrical engineering principles to biology, medicine, behavior, or health will be identified during first half of the semester. Second half of the course will focus on research, design, development and application of biosensors and Bioelectronics.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1270, 'Bioinformatics', 'ELEG-413', '413', 'The course covers algorithmic aspects of modern DNA and protein analysis. Topics include: (i) Reviews of DNA, RNA and Proteins, (ii) Genome rearrangements, (iii) Sequence Alignment and fast algorithms (BLAST), (IV) Genome expressions and DNA-microarray, (v) Phylogenic trees, (vi) Protein docking and drug discovery, etc 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1271, 'Laser Applications', 'ELEG-414', '414', 'Course studies (i) fundamentals of laser operation and the types of laser operation, (ii) laser applications in spectroscopy and photochemistry, (iii) laser applications in dentistry and eye surgery (LASIK), and (iv) laser applications in bar code readers and welding/cutting.', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1272, 'Fiber Optics', 'ELEG-415', '415', 'Communication via light waves over fiber optics cables. Analysis of light emission and light detection. Absorption loss. Optical devices, connectors, splices and Local Area Network (LANs). Pre-requisite: Physics 112 or equivalent. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1273, 'Fiber Optics Lab', 'ELEG-416', '416', 'Communication via light waves over fiber optics cables. Analysis of light emission and light detection. Absorption loss. Optical devices, connectors, splices and Local Area Networks (LANs). Pre-requisite: Physics 112 or equivalent. 3 lecture hours; 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1274, 'Modern Electronics', 'ELEG-417', '417', 'Application of diodes, bipolar transistors (BJT) and field effect transistors (FET) to signal amplification and switching. Computer Simulation. Pre-requisite: ELEG 233, Pre-requisite: ELEG 235. 3 semester hours; 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1275, 'Fuel Cells', 'ELEG-419', '419', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1276, 'Modern Wireless Comm', 'ELEG-428', '428', 'Evolution of Mobile Radio Communications to cell phones and personal communications: 2nd and 3rd and 4th generation. Concepts include cell fundamentals, path loss, fading, ghosts, modulation techniques, equalization, speech coding and networks. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1277, 'Satellite Communications', 'ELEG-430', '430', 'Detailing concepts and calculations from the entire field is enough to permit the kinds of analysis needed for major systems planning decisions. This course covers channel capacity, picture quality, signal to noise ratio, bit error rate, earth station antenna size and offers new materials on orbital mechanics and geometry. Pre-requisites: Electrical Engineering 441 or equivalent 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1278, 'Field Theory', 'ELEG-431', '431', 'The course covers fundamental concepts of RF circuit design. Students will learn circuit level design of high speed analog/RF circuits. Specific topics include impact of scaling and noise in high-speed communication circuits, low noise amplifiers, mixers, power amplifiers and frequency synthesizers. 3 lecture hours; 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1279, 'Data Acquisition Virtual Instrument Lab', 'ELEG-432X', '432X', 'Data acquisition is an important skill for electrical/electronic engineers to have and virtual instrumentation is powerful for the system simulation and hardware controls.  The lab experiments cover the technologies in LabVIEW program development, instrument interfacing, and networking.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1280, 'Power Electronics Lab', 'ELEG-433X', '433X', 'Power Electronics as an enabling technology are widely used in applications such as flexible production systems, energy conservation, renewable energy, transportation etc.  This lab is an introduction to switched-mode power converters.  It provides a basic knowledge of circuitry for the control and conversion of electrical power.  These converters can change and regulate the voltyage, current, or power; dc-dc converters, ac-dc rectifiers, and dc-ac inverters.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1281, 'Power System Protection and Relaying', 'ELEG-434', '434', 'This course introduces students to the basic concepts and fundamentals of the electric power system protection and relaying. It teaches the methodology to model the different electric component of the power system such as bus bars, generators, motors, transmission lines, and transformers. Also, it analyzes the different types of symmetrical and asymmetrical short circuit faults along with the different protection schemes used to protect the power system component. It presents the philosophy of protecting the power systems and discusses the fundamental relay operating principles and characteristics. It explores the different types of relays and measuring instruments. Finally, it introduces practical techniques/applications and relaying systems used to protect real-life transmission and distribution systems/components.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1282, 'Power System Protection & Relaying', 'ELEG-434X', '434X', 'This course introduces students to the basic concepts and fundamentals of the electric power system\'s protection and relaying. It teaches methadology to model the different electric components of the power system such as bus bars, generators, motors, transmission lines, and transformers. Also, it analyzes the different types of symmetrical and asymmetrical short circuit faults along with the different protection schemes used to protect the power system. It presents the philosophy of protection and discusses the fundamentals of relays. Finally, it introduces practical techniques/applications and relaying systems used to protect real-life transmission and distribution systems/comnponents.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1283, 'Electric Machines', 'ELEG-435', '435', 'The course introduces the laws of electricity and magnetism and prinipals of transformers applicable to electric machine construction.  Machines studied include DC motors, AC induction motors, synchronous motors, stepper motors, relays, and motor/generators.  Both single phase and 3-phase motors are analyzed for their efficiency, speef, and mechanical stability.  The state of the art VFD (Variable frequency drive) is shown to be the best way to improve efficiency and produce the maximum torque and speed control for any given motor.', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1284, 'Adv Power Analysis', 'ELEG-436', '436', 'The course provides the next level of expertise Power Systems and Design.  It includes (i) the modeling of a systems symmetrical and unsymmetrical faults, (ii) the means to protect a system and its components, (iii) the control of power systems, and (iv) the analysis of power systems\' transient operation and behavior.', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1285, 'Microwaves', 'ELEG-437', '437', 'Passive and Active elements for the generation, modulation, amplification and reception of microwaves. Radar and other microwaves systems. Pre-requisites: Field Theory 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1286, 'Power Analysis', 'ELEG-438', '438', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1287, 'Radar Thry & Sim', 'ELEG-439', '439', 'Radar Fundamentals, Radar Cross section, Types of Radars, Radar Detection, Waveform Analysis, SNR, Compression and Wave Propagation. Target Indicator and Tracking. The course will include extensive use of MATLAB for programming and simulation. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1288, 'Power Syst Distribu', 'ELEG-440', '440', 'A comprehensive study of modeling of the distribution of power system components and planning, including load characteristics, application of power transformers, design of transmission lines, distribution sub-stations, primary systems and secondary systems, voltage drop and power less calculations, application of capacitors, harmonics on distribution systems, voltage regulation, fault calculation and protection.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1289, 'RF Communications', 'ELEG-441', '441', 'Special analysis; modulation and demodulation system analysis, including AM, FM, pulse modulation and transmission of digital information. Signal design and system considerations. Pre-requisite: Electrical Engineering 234 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1290, 'Digital Communications', 'ELEG-442', '442', 'Detection of noise in thermal noise. Digital sequences. Optimal filtering and statistical decision theory. Optimum receiver design criteria. Performance, configuration and trade-offs. Pre-requisite: Electrical Engineering 441 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1291, 'Digital Signal Proc I', 'ELEG-443', '443', 'The FFT Spectral Analysis, Filtering in the presence of noise. Correlation. Introduction to stochastic signal processing. Computer projects. Pre-requisite: Electrical Engineering 234 or equivalent 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1292, 'Power Electronics', 'ELEG-444', '444', 'Application of power diodes and power transistors in rectifier arrangements and voltage regulators. Properties and application in power converters, inverters and motor drives. Pre-requisite: Electrical Engineering 348 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1293, 'Motor Drives', 'ELEG-445', '445', 'Application to control speed and efficiency of motors using conventional thyristors control as well as modern variable frequency drives.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1294, 'MEMS', 'ELEG-446', '446', 'MEMS (Microelectromechanical systems ) refers to devices and system with very small size in the range of microns. It is one of the most important high technologies developed in 20th century. This course covers the fundamentals of MEMS. It includes the introduction to MEMS, basic microfabrication techniques, MEMS materials and their properties, MEMS device design and simulation, working principle analysis, MEMS device fabrication sequence, MEMS packaging and assembly, signal testing, MEMS applications (inertial MEMS, MOEMS, BioMEMS, RFMEMS, etc ) 3 credit hours', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1295, 'Semiconductors', 'ELEG-447', '447', 'Crystal fabrication: MBE, MOCVD, LEC, Bridge Mann. Study material and electronic properties of single crystal Si, ploy, a-Si, GaAs, GaN, SiC, Ge and II-VI compounds. Transport properties: Hall Peltier, resistivity, mobility, Analysis of capacitance and I/V data for pn, pin, schottky and hetero-junction devices. Pre-requisite: Mathematics 110. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1296, 'Microfabrication', 'ELEG-448', '448', 'This class covers basic microfabrication processes for semiconductor and VLSI fabrication, including photolithography, plasma and reactive ion etching, ion implantation, diffusion, oxidation, evaporation, vaporphase epitaxial growth, sputtering, and CVD. Advanced processing topics such as next generation lithography, MBE and metal organic CVD are also introduced. The physics and chemistry of each process are introduced along with descriptions of the equipment used for the manufacture of integrated circuits. The integration of microfabrication process into CMOS, bipolar, and MEMS technologies are also discussed. The purpose of this course is to provide students with technical background and knowledge in silicon microelectronic fabrication process. Upon finishing this course, students will be familiar with the basic semiconductor and VLSI microfabrication processes. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1297, 'Wireless Sensor Networks', 'ELEG-449', '449', 'Course studies wireless sensor nodes, which are small, low cost, low power, multifunctional sensor nodes with the capability of sensing certain physical properties, local data processing, and wireless communications.  Focus will be on real time applications in software and hardware.  The architecture of networks will also be utilized and perfected.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1298, 'Communications Lab', 'ELEG-450', '450', 'Hands-on experience with digital and analog communication equipment, AM, FM and digital modulation techniques. Design and test of optimal configuration. Measurement of performance parameters in the presence of thermal noise. Pre-requisite: Electrical engineering 441.   3 Semester hours', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1299, 'Intro Nanotechnology', 'ELEG-451', '451', 'Nanotechnology is the science and engineering involved in the design, synthesis, characterization and application of materials and devices with the size in nanometer (10-9m) scale. As a newly emerged exciting high-technology, it has attracted intensive interest and heavy investments around the world. Nanotechnology is a general-purpose technology which will have significant impact on almost all industries and all areas of society. It can offer better built, longer lasting, cleanser, safer and smarter products for home, communications, medicine, transportation, agriculture and many other fields. This course will cover basic concepts in nanoscience and nanotechnology. 3 lecture hours; 3 semester hours', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1300, 'Multimedia Processing', 'ELEG-452', '452', 'Using state-of-the-art software and hardware, this course shows how to process multi-media signals (for example speech, MPEG, HDTV,video, images). The course teaches how to represent these signals mathmatically, how to compress the data in these signals to fit into a limited workspace, and how to make the processing networks and the signals themselves secure against hackers.  Part of the course involves a research project.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1301, 'Multimedia Processing', 'ELEG-452X', '452X', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1302, 'Pattern Recognition', 'ELEG-453', '453', 'Operation and Design of systems that recognize patters in data, based primarily on statistical and neural network approaches. Topics include Bayesian decision theory, Parametric likelihood estimation, Nonparametric techniques, Linear discriminant functions and Neural Networks.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1303, 'Audio Signal Processing', 'ELEG-454', '454', 'To introduce the fundamentals of speech processing and related applications. Course covers speech enhancement, speech coding, and speech recognition. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1304, 'Microwave Lab', 'ELEG-455', '455', 'Hands on experience with basic microwave coaxial and wave guide components in various circuit cofigurations. Measurement of power, wavelength, VSWR, attenuation, directional coupling, impedance. Use of the smith chart. Pre-requisite: Electical engineering 437. 3 lecture hours; 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1305, 'Adaptive Signal Processing', 'ELEG-456', '456', 'This course introduces students to the field of adaptive signal processing as well as several practical aspects of adaptive systems. This course provides an in-depth analysis of various adaptation algorithms such as least mean square adaptive filters, recursive least squares algorithms, and Kalman filters etc. The subject learning is enhanced through experimentation of adaption techniques using Matlab and/or Labview projects centered on applications such as adaptive noise/interference cancellation, signal estimation/ detection, and system identification etc. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1306, 'Analog VLSI', 'ELEG-458', '458', 'Modeling, design and analysis of analog VLSI circuits. CMOS processing and layout, current mirrors, Opamp, comparators, S/H voltage references, switched-capacitor circuits, data converters, filters and PLLs. Students design analog VLSI layouts , extract the netlists and simulate the circuit behavior. Transistors sizing will also be discussed. EDA tools PSPICE Mentors Graphics are used.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1307, 'Audio Proc Lab', 'ELEG-459', '459', 'Introduction to TMS320C55x Digital signal Processor, Audio Signal Processing, Basic Principles of Audio Coding, Speech Enhancement Techniques, Quantization of Audio Signals. Calculating LPC coefficient using C55xIntrinsic, Matlab Implementations of noise Reduction (NR), Mixed C55x Assembly and Intrinsic Implementations of Voice Activity Detection (VAD), Combining AEC with NR, Voice over Internet Protocol Applications, Overview of CELP Vocoders. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1308, 'Controls', 'ELEG-460', '460', 'Analysis of steady state and transient response of control systems. Laplace transforms methods. Transfer functions.Stability criteria. Nyquist, Bode and root locus methods. System stabilization, System Design.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1309, 'Controls Lab', 'ELEG-461', '461', 'Laboratory study of feedback control systems with experiments analyzing different types of plants, transducers and control techniques, emphasis on real-time computer control.', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1310, 'Adv Controls', 'ELEG-462', '462', 'This is a graduate level course and aims to introduce the analysis of nonlinear system. The course will cover: the state space description of nonlinear system; the phase portrait analysis of the second order system; stability analysis of the nonlinear system based on linearization method; the Lyapunov stability theory, etc. 3 lecture hours; 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1311, 'Industrial Controls & Instrumentation', 'ELEG-463', '463', 'This course covers the basics of Industrial Controls, including but not limited to relay control, ladders, counters, timers, switches and all electrical components necessary to program the control of a large machine. 3 lecture hours; 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1312, 'Programmable Logic Control', 'ELEG-464', '464', 'This course will start with the basics of Boolean Algebra; it will cite the differences between PLC control and relay control and full automation of major machines and appliances; the differences in these controls will show how hard relay control is to implement and how flexible PLC control actually is; many different math functions will be analyzed and implemented in the theoretical construction of fully functioning PLC. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1313, 'Intro to Robotics', 'ELEG-465', '465', 'Basic robotics including: position and velocity sensing, actuations, control theory, robot coordinate systems, robot kinematics, differential motions, path control, dynamics, and force control. Robot sensing, simulation of manipulators, automation, and robot programming languages are also investigated. Prerequisite: Computer Science 102, Match 214 or Math 314, or permission of instructor. 3 semester hours', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1314, 'Electromagnetic Transients and Faults Ps', 'ELEG-465X', '465X', 'This course introduces the fundamentals of power system transients and faults to participants. All the necessary techniques for identifying and solving power system transient problems and faults are provided. The course is also aimed to supply the essential skills, knowledge, and techniques to become proficient in EMTP-ATP (Electromagnetic Transient Program- Alternative Transient Program), which is regarded as a widely used program for solving electromagnetic transient problems in power systems. A comprehensive knowledge to perform modelling, design and analysis of electromagnetic transients, faults and protection of power systems is provided through series of realistic case studies.', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1315, 'Introduction to Mechatronics', 'ELEG-467', '467', 'This course covers development of Mechatronics theory and application to intelligent systems dependent upon the integrated disciplines of mechanical, electronic, computer and software engineering. The course examines the following: mechatronics system design, sensors and transducers, actuating devices, signals systems and controls, real-time interfacing, hardware components and software with applications in mechatronics. 3 semester hours credit', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1316, 'Introduction to Mechatronics', 'ELEG-467X', '467X', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1317, 'Digital Control Systems', 'ELEG-468X', '468X', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1318, 'Multi Controls Sys Design', 'ELEG-470X', '470X', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1319, 'Solar Energy & Solar Cell', 'ELEG-479', '479', 'This course offers a review of renew-able energy (solar, winds, and tides) versus bioenergy (coal, oil, natural gas). The concept of light as electromagnetic radiation and pure energy as well as the concepts of converting sunlight into thermal energy will be discussed. Students will learn the semiconductor and electronic properties of solar cells, used to convert light into electricity. Secondary solar energy sources include solar Hydrogen and concetrator technology. 3 semester hours', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1320, 'Digital Electronics', 'ELEG-480', '480', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1321, 'Electric Energy Systems', 'ELEG-480X', '480X', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1322, 'Analog Electronics Lab', 'ELEG-481', '481', 'With a set of 6 experiments and simulating them using P-Spice, the goal of this course is to teach the concepts from the theory of analog electronics. The use must have solid understanding of the basic electronics and circuit theory aka Network Analysis. Prerequistie: Electrical Engineering 348, 234 or equivalent. 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1323, 'Analog Intg Ckt Desn', 'ELEG-482', '482', 'Do a complete analysis of the 741 op-amp, including bandwidth, gain analysis, slew rate, power efficiency and I/O impedances. Analyze ROM, Ram, TTL, ECL, CMOS and more modern logic structures including Fanout, noise margin, latching, contention, logic and delay response. Pre-requisite: Electrical Engineering 348 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1324, 'Digital Integrated Ckts Desn', 'ELEG-483', '483', 'Several integrated circuit architectures are analyzed at the transmitter level to find key parameters by hand analysis as well as computer simulation: rise time, fall time, noise margins, logic state, hysteresis/memory, fanout, and power dissipation. Analysis includes an analysis of the major logic families: TTL,CMOS, NMOS, ECL, PECL, differential logic. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1325, 'Ac Motor Drives', 'ELEG-485X', '485X', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1326, 'Wireless Sensor Networks Lab', 'ELEG-487X', '487X', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1327, 'Sustainable Energy', 'ELEG-490', '490', 'This is a graduate level course and aims to introduce the alternative energy technologies in photovoltaic cells (PV) and fuel cells. It will cover: the physics, energy conversion efficiency, and challenges in PV cells, the principles, the stack and system design in fuel cells. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1328, 'Nuclear Power Syst', 'ELEG-491X', '491X', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1331, 'Electronic Cooling', 'ELEG-503', '503', 'Electronic Cooling', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1333, 'Medical Electronics', 'ELEG-510', '510', 'Electrical safety is studied by full analysis of grounding and modeling of the human body under various electric shock conditions. The ECG machine (for measuring heart performance) is analyzed a both an analogy and a digital machine, with emphasis on cleaning up signal problems and extending the analysis of the data recorded. Other instruments that are analyzed include the blood sugar tester, the hospital thermistor, the lung pressure machine, the anesthesia vaporizer, the pulse oximeter and various cardiac output devices. Discussion made about the minimum alveolar concentration (MAC) as it applies to anesthesia. Discussion is also made about modern hearing aids and advances in eye replacement via electrical means. Prerequisite: Electrical Engineering 348, 234 or equivalent. 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1334, 'Medical Machines- Signal Processing Lab', 'ELEG-511', '511', 'Students learn to obtain, process, and interpret data from various Medical Machines (e.g. EEG, ECG, EMG, pulse oximeter, spirometer, blood pressure, skin resistance).  Students analyze data via the computer package MATLAB.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1335, 'Biomaterials', 'ELEG-511X', '511X', null, 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1336, 'Biomedical Image Processing', 'ELEG-513', '513', 'This course is an elective course.The content of this course include the fundamentals of Digital Image Processing and its applications in biomedical field. Sampling and Quantization of signals are mentioned in order to introduce the digital images, some basic relationship between pixles are mentioned. Introduction  to Fourier Transform, Discrete Fourier Transform and Fast Fourier Transformed are explained.MATLAB programming with Image Procesing Toolbox will be introduced to empathize and rigid the understanding of students. Others important fundamental theorems, e.g., Image Enhancement, Image Segmentation, Representation and Description are also mentioned. Students are required to implement some program using theorems learnt in classes.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1337, 'Fiber Optic Networks', 'ELEG-515', '515', 'This course focuses on architectures, design and control of multi-wavelength optical communication networks. This includes OSI, TCP/IP, and MPLS layers. It also includes a study of WDM network elements and components. Physical and link layers will be covered to understand the advantages and limitations of optical transmission technology, including SONET, CFP, Gigabit Ethernet, and packet switching.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1338, 'Advanced DSP', 'ELEG-542', '542', '(1) review briefly the concepts of DSP (E443), including digital filter design and windowing (2) Carry on with new topics in Adaptive Filters, Wiener Filters, Kalman filters, power spectrum and related topics, statistical signal processing, and stochastic processes. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1339, 'DSP Lab', 'ELEG-543', '543', 'Centered on a set of experiments for the ADSP 21061 and ADS21065L, the goal of this course is to teach how to program the ADSP21061 and ADS21065L using visual DSP++ and MATLAB and illustrate concepts from theory of digital signal processing. The user must have solid understanding of DSP algorithms as well as appreciation of basic computer architecture concepts. Pre-requisite: Electrical Engineering 443 or equivalent. 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1340, 'Wavelets & Filter Banks', 'ELEG-544', '544', 'This course is offered to provide students with the basic understanding of the wavelet theory along with multi-resolution signal processing tools, which can be employed effectively to solve practical signal processing and analysis problems. The first half of the course introduces wavelet transforms from an engineering point of view. The topics covered include short time Fourier transform, continuous wavelet transform, and discrete wavelet transform and filter banks. The second half of the course presents a number of interesting applications of wavelet based advanced signal processing techniques such as filter banks, multi-rate signal processing, wavelet packets and lifting algorithms in areas of image compression, signal de-noising, signal estimation, signal enhancements, and transient detection etc. Prerequisite: Basic Digital Signal Processing Course 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1341, 'Biosignal Processing', 'ELEG-546', '546', 'The course teaches all of the basic of image processing as applied to biometrics analysis and medical imaging. 3 semester hours ', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1342, 'Bio MEMS', 'ELEG-547', '547', 'BioMEMS is the application of MEMS(Microelectromechanical Systems) technology in the fields of biomedical and health sciences.  Due to their small size, BioMEMS have the advantages of low weight, low cost, quick response, high throughput, high effeciency, requirring much less sample.reagent and easy Integration.  BioMEMS found broad applications in disease diagnosis, prevention and treatment. Various BioMEMS products have been developed, such as microfluidic devices, neural interface devices, uTAS, lab-on-a-chip, DNA chips, micro drug delivery system, microsurgicalo tools, bio-senors.  This course introduces to students the fundementals of BioMEMS technology, typical bioMEMS devices and their applications.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1343, 'Low Power VLSI Circuit Design', 'ELEG-548', '548', 'With the rapid development of mobile computing, low power VLSI design has become a very important issue in the VLSI industry. A variety of low-power design methods are employed to reduce power dissipation of VLSI chips. This course is designed to cover low-power design methodologies at various design levels (from system level to transistor level). The basic low-power design strategies will be introduced in the class. Students will use the learned knowledge to design low power VLSI circuits. Upon completion of this course, students will be able to analyze the power consumption of VLSI circuits, and design low-power VLSI circuits using various strategies at different design levels. The major target is to design VLSI chips used for battery-powered systems and high-performance circuits not exceeding power limits. 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1344, 'VLSI Testing', 'ELEG-549', '549', 'As VLSI continues to grow in its complexity, VLSI testing and design-for-testability are becoming more and more important issues. This course will cover VLSI testing techniques such as VLSI fault modeling (stuckat-fault), automatic test generation, memory testing, design for testability (DFT), etc. VLSI scan testing and built-in self-test (BIST) will also be covered. Student will learn various VLSI testing strategies and how to design a testable VLSI circuit. 3 lecture hours; 3 semester hours', 59, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1345, 'Analog and Digital Systems VLSI', 'ELEG-550', '550', 'This course will provide students with an in-depth understanding of the basic design methodologies of modern digital VLSI systems. Various perspectives of VLSI systems will be discussed, such as MOS transistor device characteristics, interconnect, time and power, clock distribution, packaging and I/O issues. VHDL system design and logic syn-thesis. Upon completing this course, students will have a comprehensive understanding about digital VLSI system design. 3 lecture hours, 3 semester hours ', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1346, 'Adv Digital Signal Proc Lab', 'ELEG-559', '559', 'Lecture will cover background material pertinent to lab, in these areas: .	The acoustics and acoustic analysis of audio/speech .	The physiology of audio/speech production .	Sentence-level phenomena .	The perception of audio/speech .	Audio/Speech disorders .	Echo Cancellation', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1347, 'Instrumental Analysis Nanomaterials', 'ELEG-561', '561', 'The course will give an overview on several important analytical tools for nano materials characterization. Mechanical, electrical and electronic and biological property testing of the nano materials such as carbon nanotubes, metal nanoparticles, quantum dots, nanowires conformable nanoelectronics materials, polymer nanoparticles and biomedical nanomaterials willbe discussed. Process and product evaluation by physical, chemical and microscopic methods for materials in nano-regime will be highlighted. Modern materials science depends on the use of a battery of analytical methods carried normally in specialized laboratories. This course explains the fundamental principles associated with various methods and familarize the students with them,their range of applicability and reliability especially when materials are of nanoscopic dimension.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1348, 'Nanofabrication W/ Soft Materials', 'ELEG-562', '562', 'This is an advanced level graduate course focusing on fabrication of soft materials.Nanofabrication processes and nanosystem products will be discussed.Fundamentals associated wth chip fabrications and linking them toward soft materials asssemblt will be detailed. Emerging nanotechnology based methods for soft and green electronics, mechanical parts, MEMS, PCBS will be covered.Gene chip, label free sensory asssay using micro and nanofluidics will be discussed. Transfer printing, DNA- protein interactions using the chip and several nano-scale asssembles for soft materials fabrication will be discussed.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1349, 'Magneto Bio-Engineering', 'ELEG-573', '573', 'Magneto-Bioengineering is a fast-developing field of research , its practical and environmental aspects being a topic of ever-increasing number of applications encompassing the field of biomedical engineering including but not limited to MRI ) magnetic Resonance Imaging ), magnetic therapy, neural stimulation, magnetic field treatment for nonunion (fractures that fail to heal ) and so on. At the same time, physically, the biological effects of weak magnetic fields or Extremely Low Frequency (ELF) magnetic fields are still regarded as a paradox. This course deals with such issues and fills in the theoretical gap in biomedical engineering. It reviews and analyzes the experimental evidence that yields useful insights into the primary physical processes of magneto-reception and the frequency and amplitude spectra of the action of weak magnetic fields in living system and hence the course addresses important issues in biomedical engineering.  Also, the course reviews the available hypothetical mechanisms for that action as applicable to the field of biomedical engineering. Besides this the presence of magnetic crystal s in certain species of prokaryotes as well as in birds ( for migration ) and in humans is still under active investigation and is also covered  in this course as a possible way of exploiting such information for application in biomedical engineering.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1350, 'Magneto-Bioengineering', 'ELEG-573X', '573X', 'Magneto-Bioengineering is a fast-developing field of research , its practical and environmental aspects being a topic of ever-increasing number of applications encompassing the field of biomedical engineering including but not limited to MRI ) magnetic Resonance Imaging ), magnetic therapy, neural stimulation, magnetic field treatment for nonunion (fractures that fail to heal ) and so on. At the same time, physically, the biological effects of weak magnetic fields or Extremely Low Frequency (ELF) magnetic fields are still regarded as a paradox. This course deals with such issues and fills in the theoretical gap in biomedical engineering. It reviews and analyzes the experimental evidence that yields useful insights into the primary physical processes of magneto-reception and the frequency and amplitude spectra of the action of weak magnetic fields in living system and hence the course addresses important issues in biomedical engineering.  Also, the course reviews the available hypothetical mechanisms for that action as applicable to the field of biomedical engineering. Besides this the presence of magnetic crystal s in certain species of prokaryotes as well as in birds ( for migration ) and in humans is still under active investigation and is also covered  in this course as a possible way of exploiting such information for application in biomedical engineering.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1351, 'Adv. Bioinformatics', 'ELEG-579', '579', 'Over the past few decades rapid developments in genomic and molecular research and development in information technology have combined to produce a tremendous amount of information related to molecular bioengineering. This course focuses on designing and development of algorithms for biological problems. String, Tree and Sequencing algorithms are studied in this course to solve biological problems.  Student will work with popular string based bioinformatics algorithms not only to understand algorithms design methodologies but also to identify the potential weaknesses in traditional bioinformatics algorithms. Labs are workshops are integral part of the course.  Practical exercises using both bioinformatics software and simple Java programs will help students understand how bioinformatics algorithms really work. The course is aimed both at biomedical engineering and computer science students. Though no prior experience in Java is required, students are expected to have mathematics and some programming background. During the course students are expected to attend workshops and labs in addition to that they are expected to spend few hours weekly in computer lab to solve problems and learn required programming skills. The class discussion will focus on solving computational problems, such as Mappings DNA, Sequencing DNA, Comparing sequences, Predicting genes, Finding Signals, Identifying proteins etc.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1352, 'New Product Commercialization', 'ELEG-580', '580', 'The objectives of the course are to understand and apply concepts and techniques of product commercialization.  The course focuses on taking student created product concepts and having student teams drive the concepts to become actual products.  Product design, prototype creation, market analysis, and financial analysis all come together within the student team to crete a viable product.  If ideas are worthy, teams may work with the University\'s CTech IncUBator to actually commercialize their products.  Students are strongly encouraged to find a sponsor to actually commercialize their product ideas.', 59, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1353, 'Elec Engineering Seminar', 'ELEG-596', '596', 'Lecture hours and topics to be arranged with instructor. 1 credit hour ', 59, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1356, 'Ind Study', 'ELEG-599', '599', 'Independent study of advanced topics in Electrical Engineering and submission of project report as required. insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1445, 'High Intermediate ESL', 'ELI-130', '130', 'High Intermediate level English for academic purposes; English language skills in grammar, informal speaking, oral presentations, listening, lecture note taking, academic reading, essay writing, critical thinking; outcomes consistent with the Common European Framework of Reference for Language Level Bl. ', 64, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1446, 'Advanced ESL', 'ELI-140', '140', 'Advanced level English for academic purposes; English language skills in grammar, informal speaking, oral presentations, listening, lecture note taking, academic reading, essay writing, research skills, critical thinking; outcomes consistent with the Common European Framework of Reference for Language Level B2. ', 64, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1376, 'Basic Composition', 'ENGL-100', '100', 'Techniques of composition, including sentence structure, paragraph development, organization of the whole theme, with regular written assignments. Additional emphasis on fundamentals to assist students with weak backgrounds. A passing grade admits the students to ENGL C101. Students who have a grade of A or B at the end of the semester may take the essay final for ENGL C101. If they score an A or B on that examination, they may waive ENGL 101. 3 semester hours', 63, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1377, 'Basic Composition Intensive', 'ENGL-100A', '100A', 'Techniques of composition, including sentence structure, paragraph development, organization of the whole theme, with regular written assignments. Additional emphasis on fundamentals to assist students with weak backgrounds. A passing grade admits the students to ENGL C101. Students who have a grade of A or B at the end of the semester may take the essay final for ENGL C101. If they score an A or B on that examination, they may waive ENGL 101. 3 semester hours', 63, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1378, 'English Communication', 'ENGL-100E', '100E', 'English Communication Skills is designed to help students with emerging English proficiency develop and improve the listening and speaking skills in English necessary to communicate successfully in diverse situations, especially academic ones. The successful students will be able to demonstrate proficiency in spoken English, with emphasis on pronunciation and fluency; express themselves orally in English about topics in their academic discipline in formal and informal presentations, participate in group discussions and other authentic academic environments.  Students practice listening to their peers, taking notes, and querying classmates when they don\'t understand as continued reinforcement of what they are doing in classes in their discipline.   The final project is an individual presentation in which the students to need to convince their classmates (using persuasive language) of a product or service that they think is the best (or the worst.).', 63, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1379, 'Developmental Engl', 'ENGL-100I', '100I', 'For those who need academic preparation before studying in English, this course provides focused, individualized work on special problems in using English fundamentals, oral/aural problems, reading and oral comprehension, English patterning and structures, leading to the production of short written works. Students receiving a grade of D+ or below must take ENGL 100. 3 semester hours', 63, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1380, 'Composition & Rhetoric I', 'ENGL-101', '101', 'English 101 (Composition and Rhetoric) introduces students to the techniques for clear and effective college-level writing.  The goal will be to improve your writing ability and to sharpen your reading and critical thinking skills.  We focus on the best ways to approach different types of college writing assignments.  Students will study and practice the fundamentals of academic discourse, including essay organization and development, analysis, research techniques, documentation, and critical evaluation of academic writing.  Grammar and word mechanics will also be reviewed to ensure that students communicate successfully in various tasks.', 63, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1381, 'Introduction to Literature', 'ENGL-102', '102', 'A writing intensive course that uses representative examples of poetry, drama, and fiction to develop one?s ability to analyze and appreciate literature. 3 semester hours', 63, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1382, 'Intro to Drama', 'ENGL-105A', '105A', 'Introductory study of drama. Readings are drawn from a variety of genres and literary periods. 3 semester hours ', 63, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1383, 'Intro to Fiction', 'ENGL-105B', '105B', 'Introductory study of fiction. Reading include short stories and several nvoels. 3 semester hours ', 63, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(1384, 'Development English', 'ENGL-11', '11', 'For those who need academic preparation before studying in English, this course provides focused, individualized work on special problems in using English fundamentals, oral/aural problems, reading and oral comprehension, English patterning and structures, leading to the production of short written works. Students receiving a grade of D+ or below must take ENGL 100. 3 semester hours', 63, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');
