insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2271, 'Introduction to Public Health', 'MPH-501', '501', 'Introduction to Public Health is a graduate level course that provides graduate and professional students, with foundational knowledge of public health\'s historical contributions; the ethical bases; key terms and concepts; system organization; and the social, behavioral, environmental, and biological factors that contribute to specific individual and community health outcomes through interactive learning strategies and the application and integration of concepts to understand and prevent current public health problems and those facing public health in the 21st century.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2272, 'Principles of Epidemiology', 'MPH-502', '502', 'In this introductory course, students will learn and apply basic concepts of epidemiology to multiple domains of public health. We will illustrate and practice using epidemiology to better understand, characterize, and promote health at a population level. The class will engage the students in active and collaborative learning through team activities, individual projects, case studies, group discussion, and individual projects.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2273, 'Biostatistics', 'MPH-503', '503', 'This course is an introduction to statistical methods used in biological and medical research. Elementary probability theory, basic concepts of statistical inference, regression and correlation methods, analysis of variance, and study design are covered. Emphasis on applications to medical problems.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2274, 'Public Health Policy', 'MPH-504', '504', 'This course presents an introduction to health policy, i.e., the various ways in which the government plays a role in health and in the provision of health care. Health policies can have a profound effect on quality of life. Accessibility, cost, quality of health care; safety of food, water, and environment; the right to make decisions about our health; these issues are vitally tied to health policies.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2275, 'Research Methods', 'MPH-505', '505', 'This course will provide students an opportunity to establish an understanding of research through critical exploration of research language, ethics, and approaches. The course introduces the language of research, ethical principles and challenges, and the elements of the research process within quantitative, qualitative, and mixed methods approaches. Participants will use these theoretical underpinnings to begin to critically review literature relevant to their field or interests and determine how research findings are useful in forming their understanding of their work, social, local and global environment.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2276, 'Social & Behavioral Aspects of Health', 'MPH-506', '506', 'The course is designed to help students develop basic literacy regarding social concepts and processes that influence health status and public health interventions. The course also hopes to help students develop insight into populations with whom they have worked in the past or will work in the future, and to develop one kind of effective writing tool (the narrative) for communicating about psychosocial issues in public health. These overall aims are approached through lectures, discussion, readings, workshopping, individual compositions, and group discussion of student writings.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2277, 'Introduction to Environmental Health', 'MPH-507', '507', 'Examines health issues, scientific understanding of causes, and possible future approaches to control of the major environmental health problems in industrialized and developing countries. Topics include how the body reacts to environmental pollutants; physical, chemical, and biological agents of environmental contamination; vectors for dissemination (air, water, soil); solid and hazardous waste; susceptible populations; biomarkers and risk analysis; the scientific basis for policy decisions; and emerging global environmental health problems.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2278, 'Global Public Health', 'MPH-508', '508', 'This course examines major global health challenges, programs and policies. You will be introduced to the world\'s vast diversity of determinants of health and disease. You will analyze current and emerging global health priorities, including emerging infectious diseases, poverty, conflicts and emergencies, health inequity, health systems reforms, and major global initiatives for disease prevention and health promotion.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2279, 'Community Health Issues', 'MPH-509', '509', 'Community Health provides a theoretical background for the study of community health nursing and is based on the synthesis of nursing theory and public health science.  Emphasis is on health promotion, health maintenance and disease prevention among populations.  The course assists students to recognize and analyze the interrelationships between individuals, families, population groups, and communities in determining the health status of each.  The impact of political, economic, social, environmental, and cultural concerns on the health of populations is examined.', 103, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2280, 'Emergency Management Health Issues', 'MPH-510', '510', 'This course is a study of the concepts of medical and healthcare issues in emergency management in mass-casualty and high-impact incidents. The student will learn about the planning and coordination-- from the national to the local levels--necessary to respond to disasters that are natural (such as earthquakes, floods, tornadoes and heat waves); industrial, technological and transportation (such as hazardous materials, air crashes and mass gatherings); conflict-related (such as terrorist attacks and mass shootings); as well as the education, training and research done before, during and after these events.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2281, 'Occupational Health', 'MPH-511', '511', 'This course is an introduction to major concepts and issues in occupational health and safety. Students from the fields of Industrial Hygiene, Occupational and Environmental Health Nursing, Occupational and Environmental Medicine, Injury Epidemiology and others identify a conceptual framework for working with populations of workers and apply public health principles. Work-related hazards are described in terms of recognition and control. This course relies on the synthesis of knowledge in the behavioral sciences, industrial hygiene, injury epidemiology, safety, nursing theory, toxicology and epidemiology while applying these within a program development and management framework.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2282, 'Infectious Diseases', 'MPH-512', '512', 'Global Infectious Disease Epidemiology is part of the interdisciplinary Public Health Leadership Program, which prepares public health professionals for leadership positions. Global Infectious Disease Epidemiology covers the interaction between an infectious agent, host, and environment, modes and dynamics of transmission, the role of immunity in infectious disease epidemiology, and disease elimination strategies, focusing on issues affecting a global society.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2283, 'Global Health Issues', 'MPH-520', '520', 'This course explores contemporary issues, problems, and controversies in global health through an interdisciplinary perspective; examines the complex tapestry of social, economic, political, and environmental factors that affect global health; analyzes global health disparities through a social justice and human rights lens; and exposes students to opportunities in global health program and research.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2284, 'Program Planning for Global Health', 'MPH-521', '521', 'This course will familiarize students with concepts and methodologies required for effective public health program planning and evaluation in a variety of settings, domestic and global. Students in this course will develop a program plan while learning the essential competencies for planning, implementing and evaluating sustainable programs for the maternal and child health population. Given the importance of public health planning and evaluation occurring within the context of interdisciplinary teams, students will also discuss and practice skills for building highly functional teams and accomplishing individual and group objectives through team work.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2285, 'Essentials of Econ & Fin for Global Hlth', 'MPH-522', '522', 'This course examines economics and finance principles as they apply to global health. Students will study issues in the organization, delivery and financing of health care in developing countries. The course first provides students with a \'toolkit\' for analyzing issues related to global health economics and finance and then asks the students to apply this \'toolkit\' to a variety of a global health issues including demand for health, policy tools to increase demand for health, healthcare financing, social insurance, pharmaceuticals and HIV/AIDS.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2286, 'Community Health Sciences', 'MPH-530', '530', 'Community-based health interventions are a major public health strategy for promoting population health.   This   course   provides   an   introduction   to   the foundations   of   community-based health interventions and the factors influencing their design, implementation, evaluation, and outcomes. Using social ecological  and   community-based   participatory   frameworks,   key principles   and   strategies underlying community-based health interventions are examined. Successful community-based strategies for addressing various public health issues are assessed. Challenges to  implementing,  evaluating  and sustaining  successful  community-based  health interventions,  and  implications  for  promoting  health equity are discussed.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2287, 'Prog Planning, Res & Eval for Comm Hlth', 'MPH-531', '531', 'Careful planning and evaluation of public health programs are essential competencies for public health professionals. Through this course students will gain a basic understanding of how to implement public health programs and evaluate their effectiveness. As this course is designed to be grounded in public health practice, you will complete the course with the skills necessary to develop both a program and evaluation plan. Given the importance of public health planning and evaluation occurring within the context of interdisciplinary teams, students in this course will also discuss and practice skills for building effective teams and accomplishing individual and group objectives through team work.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2288, 'Urban Health & Social Policy', 'MPH-532', '532', 'This course will provide students with a foundation for understanding how history, power, privilege and structural inequality interact to produce urban health disparities. An advanced sociology course, Disparities in Urban Health will introduce students to the impact of city life on health and health care in the U.S. and internationally. We will look at the advantages and disadvantages of urbanization on both physical and mental health and the root causes of racial and ethnic disparities in health. We will trace the interaction between specific aspects (e.g., housing, transportation, food outlets, crime) of the urban environment and their impact on health, discuss quality measurement, evaluate strategies for designing healthy communities, and develop recommendations for systems and policy change.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2289, 'Health Economics & U.S. Policy', 'MPH-540', '540', 'This course provides an overview of the United States healthcare system using a microeconomics lens. You will be introduced to microeconomic theory and empirical studies that will deepen your understanding of how consumers, firms, and the government influence healthcare expenditures (including its quantity and prices), healthcare quality, and patient health outcomes. These economic models will enable you to predict how changes in consumer behavior, the industrial organization of firms, and government policies affect healthcare and health outcomes.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2290, 'Public Health Law', 'MPH-541', '541', 'This course is about the legal and social justice framework for urgent public health issues, such as regulation of vaccinations, tobacco control and infectious diseases such as Ebola. The course focuses on the U.S. Constitution and the way in which it defines government powers, duties, and restraints to assure the health of all populations. The course also examines the theories and concepts behind public health law, the constitutional tensions between public health efforts and the counterbalancing rights to liberty, freedom of speech, of association, and others. Students also will learn how to spot the policymaking issues involved with implementation of laws in a community, including public health community organizing and advocacy efforts.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2291, 'Public Health Policy As a Prevention Str', 'MPH-542', '542', 'This course provides an overview of a policy adoption and implementation model, including a discussion of factors to consider when developing policies and key components of policy implementation. This course will introduce students to a prevention policy framework; will present the philosophical, ethical, economic, political and efficacy rationale for this approach to prevention; will contrast policy approaches to prevention with individual-based approaches; and will present examples of different policy mechanisms.', 103, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2583, 'Group Recorder II', 'MSED-222X', '222X', null, 111, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2584, 'Group Instruction Recorder I', 'MSED-227', '227', 'The recorder is one of the most important tools in music education today. This class will present the history, physics, and repertoire of the recorder. It will provide students with pedagogical tools and strategies for teaching all levels of music education. 3 semester hours', 111, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2585, 'Group Instruction Recorder II', 'MSED-228', '228', 'This class will focus on repertoire and performance of repertoire most pedagogically useful when teaching recorder classes. This class, in conjunction with Group recorder I M227, and participation in early music ensembles will equip students with enough solo and ensemble ensemble techniques to develop and teach innovative recorder programs. Prerequisite: ME227 3 semester hours', 111, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2586, 'Field Exp in Music Ed', 'MSED-240', '240', 'Consists of developing teaching styles, plans, and materials designed to: (1) help the student determine professional goals. (2) provide insights and experiences in music teaching prior to professional music education classes. 0 semester hours', 111, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

Students will refine their own vocal and piano techniques, will learn strategies for leading and accompanying group sining, and will gain an understanding of vocal development and pedagogy for children and adolescents. insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2594, 'Choral Literature & Technique', 'MSED-331', '331', 'A study of choral literature appropriate for the middle and high school levels. Includes techniques of voice testing, tone development, range, diction, and musicianship. Prerequisite: Mse 183 or permission of instructor. 3 semester hours', 111, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2595, 'Literature and Techniques for Band Orch', 'MSED-332', '332', 'Study of band and orchestra literature with emphasis on rehearsal techniques and problems related to band and orchestra organization. Prerequisite: Mse 221, 223, and 225 3 semester hours', 111, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2018, 'Anatomy I With Lab', 'MSPA-511', '511', 'This course introduces the functional anatomy of the human body. Students will have the opportunity to locate, identify, and dissect all major muscular, nervous, vascular, bony, and soft tissue structures using cadaveric specimens.  3 credits', 97, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2019, 'Anatomy II w/Lab', 'MSPA-512', '512', 'This course builds on Anatomy I investigating the functional anatomy of the human body by offering students the opportunity to locate, identify, and dissect all major muscular, nervous, vascular, bony, and soft tissue structures using cadaveric specimens. 2 credits', 97, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2020, 'Physiology I', 'MSPA-521', '521', 'This course offers fundamental and integrated approach to human physiology and biochemistry starting with basic processes of metabolism and homeostasis including carbohydrate, lipids and protein metabolism, cell cycle and DNA replication, cellular energy production, tissue types and their functions.  This course presents an in-depth exploration of the nervous system, musculoskeletal functioning and cardiac physiology.   2 credits', 97, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2021, 'Physiology II', 'MSPA-522', '522', 'This course builds on MSPA 521 to offer a fundamental and integrated approach to the circulatory, pulmonary, gastrointestinal and endocrine systems. The circulatory system will highlight regulation of local flow, Starling forces equilibrium and function of lymphatics.  The pulmonary system will cover ventilation, perfusion and gas exchange processes.  The GI system will address details of nutrient digestion, peristalsis, secretion and absorption processes as well as autonomic nervous system impact on regulation of GI tract. The endocrine system will discuss hormones and the types of receptors they affect.  2 credits', 97, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2022, 'Physiology/Biochemistry III', 'MSPA-523', '523', 'This course builds on MSPA 521 and 522, offering a fundamental and integrative approach to human physiology/biochemistry of Genitourinary, Renal, Hematologic and Immune systems. The genitourinary system module will cover the regulation and function of reproductive hormones and changes they facilitate in reproductive organs.  The renal module addresses the processes of filtration, reabsorption, secretion and elimination, as well as the role of the kidneys in systemic blood pressure regulation. The hematologic system module focuses on red blood cell life cycle, structure and function of the hemoglobin.  The immunologic system module focuses on white blood cell function and considers clinically important innate and adaptive characteristics.  2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2023, 'Pathophysiology I', 'MSPA-526', '526', 'This course provides an overview of the mechanisms of adaptation with injury at the cellular and tissue levels.  Clinical application using pathophysiologic scenarios emphasize diseases of the nervous, musculoskeletal and cardiac systems. A review of basic pathology will focus on inborn errors of metabolism of carbohydrates, lipids and proteins.  This course correlates with MSPA 521  2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2024, 'Pathophysiology II', 'MSPA-527', '527', 'This course is builds on MSPA 526 and MSPA 521 presenting the pathophysiology of diseases of the circulatory, pulmonary, gastrointestinal and endocrine systems. This course uses correlation with clinical disease states throughout the course. This course correlates with MSPA 522. 2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2025, 'Pathophysiology III', 'MSPA-528', '528', 'This course builds on MSPA 526, 527, 521 and 522 presenting the pathophysiology of diseases of Genitourinary, Renal, Hematologic and Immune systems.  This course correlates with MSPA 523. 2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2026, 'Clinical Medicine I', 'MSPA-529', '529', null, 97, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2027, 'Clinical Medicine II', 'MSPA-530', '530', 'This course is an organ-systems-based exploration of cardiac, pulmonic, and gastrointestinal diseases. Emphasis is on the integration of anatomy, physiology, pathophysiology, microbiology, history and exam findings and diagnostic procedures in order to formulate a differential diagnosis; on ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests in order to develop a working diagnosis; and on developing and implementing treatment plans including as needed therapeutic procedures, pharmacology, referral and patient education and counseling.  6 credits', 97, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2028, 'Intro Clinical Lab and Microbiolgy', 'MSPA-531', '531', 'This course will provide the student with advanced microbiology, virology and immunology to understand the complexities of infectious disease. Emphasis will be placed on clinically relevant pathogens, isolation and aseptic techniques,identification and treatment. 3 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2029, 'Clinical Medicine III', 'MSPA-533', '533', 'This course is an organ-systems-based exploration of genitourinary, endocrine, renal, obstetric, gynecologic, and hematologic diseases.  Emphasis is on the integration of anatomy, physiology, pathophysiology, microbiology, history and exam findings and diagnostic procedures in order to formulate a differential diagnosis; on ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests in order to develop a working diagnosis; and on developing and implementing treatment plans including as needed therapeutic procedures, pharmacology, referral and patient education and counseling.  8 credits', 97, 8, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2030, 'Correlative Medicine I', 'MSPA-534', '534', 'This course gives students the skills to develop differential diagnoses and complete, patient-centered management plans.  Family medicine, psychosocial medicine and actual patient contact are aspects of this course.  2 credits', 97, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2031, 'Clinical Genetics', 'MSPA-541', '541', 'This course familiarizes students with concepts of cellular and molecular biology; different types of mutations and their effects;inheritance patterns; genetic testing techniques; counseling referrals and key resources with an emphasis on accurately creating and interpreting the pedigree in regards to disease identification and/or susceptibility, therapeutic options and future clinical applications of genetics in primary care. 2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2032, 'Correlative Medicine II', 'MSPA-542', '542', 'This course continues to emphasize the development of differential diagnoses, management plans, complete medical notes and oral presentations. Patient contact allows students to practice these skills in real-life settings.  2 credits', 97, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2033, 'History and Physical Exam I With Lab', 'MSPA-551', '551', 'This course has three aims.  First, it helps students develop the skills of obtaining a comprehensive and a problem-focused history.  Second, students gain the ability to write a medical note.  Last, students learn interviewing techniques and the affective aspects of the medical encounter.  2 credits', 97, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2034, 'History/Physical Exam II With Lab', 'MSPA-552', '552', 'The second course in this series focuses on performing a comprehensive physical examination.  This course further emphasizes the integration and interpretation of findings to create a foundation for further clinical evaluation. This course further emphasizes normal versus abnormal findings and on accurate and appropriate documentation. 2 credits', 97, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2035, 'History/Physical Exam Lab III', 'MSPA-553', '553', 'This on-going course builds on H&P I and II in developing skills of obtaining a comprehensive history and a problem focused history; performing a comprehensive screening exam and an appropriate problem focused exam; the ability to integrate and interpret the findings from any of these to create a foundation for further clinical evaluation. Emphasis is placed on identifying normal versus abnormal findings and on accurate and appropriate documentation. 3 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2036, 'Patient Education, Nutr and Counseling', 'MSPA-556', '556', 'This course is an evidence-based approach to educate and counsel patients in order to improve lifestyle, increase adherence and reduce medical errors. This course will emphasize disease prevention, health promotion during various stages of life with emphasis on the nutritional aspect of health. 2 credits credits', 97, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2037, 'Health, Wellness & Nutrition Lifespan', 'MSPA-561', '561', 'This course will emphasize disease prevention, health promotion during various stages of life with emphasis on the pediatric and geriatric population. 2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2038, 'Integrative Medicine & Practice', 'MSPA-565', '565', null, 97, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2039, 'Clinical Pharmacology I', 'MSPA-570', '570', 'This course introduces the student to the basic principles of pharmacology, including mechanisms of action; absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion; pharmacokinetics; interactions with other drugs and with food; problems with special populations (prenatal, neonatal, the elderly); rational drug usage for clinical disorders (therapeutics): clinical measures; and toxicology. 2 credits', 97, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2040, 'Clinical Pharmacology II', 'MSPA-571', '571', 'This course builds on Clinical Pharmacology I with more advanced principles of pharmacology, including mechanisms of action; absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion; pharmacokinetics; interactions with other drugs and with food.  A presentation of drug classes as they relate to the different organ systems includes anticipated results and adverse reaction monitoring.  2 credits', 97, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2041, 'Clinical Pharmacology III', 'MSPA-572', '572', 'This course builds on Clinical Pharmacology II with more advanced principles of pharmacology, including mechanisms of action; absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion; pharmacokinetics; interactions with other drugs and with food. Patient cases track therapy success and shortcomings including the financial and logistical aspects of safe therapy. This course includes dose calculations, hospital protocols and managed care issues. 2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2042, 'Clinical Pharmacology III', 'MSPA-573', '573', 'This course builds on Clinical Pharmacology II with additional advanced case-based principles of pharmacology, including mechanisms of action; absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion; pharmacokinetics; interactions with other drugs and with food; problems with special populations (prenatal, neonatal, elderly); rational drug usage for clinical disorders (therapeutics): clinical measures; and toxicology.', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2043, 'Medical Ethics and Professional Practice', 'MSPA-574', '574', 'This course presents the student with the four- topic method of evaluation of ethical issues. Student examine ethical issues in terms of medical indications, patient preferences, quality of life and contextual features to provide a response to the ethical dilemma. Additionally, this course incorporates the history, development, certification and licensure process of the PA profession. PA web sites and professional organizations.   Special topics include risk management, professional liability, and, patient safety.  Billing, reimbursement, and the organization of healthcare in the US and in other countries are also explored.  2 credits', 97, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2044, 'Global Health & Preventive Medicine', 'MSPA-575', '575', null, 97, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2045, 'Pharmacology I', 'MSPA-581', '581', 'This course explores principles of pharmacology, including mechanisms of action; absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion; pharmacokinetics; interactions with other drugs and with food.  A presentation of drug classes as they relate to the different organ systems includes anticipated results and adverse reaction monitoring.  3 credits', 97, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2046, 'Pharmacology II', 'MSPA-582', '582', 'This course builds on Pharmacology I with more advanced principles of pharmacology, including mechanisms of action; absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion; pharmacokinetics; interactions with other drugs and with food.  A presentation of drug classes as they relate to the different organ systems includes anticipated results and adverse reaction monitoring.  3 credits', 97, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2047, 'Technical Skills', 'MSPA-591', '591', 'The demonstration and practice of technical procedures frequently encountered in primary care, emergency medicine, surgical settings are explored in this course. The emphasis is on such skills as intravenous cannulation, suturing, urethral catheterization, splinging and casting incision and drainage and nasogastric lavage. 2 credits', 97, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2048, 'Indep Study', 'MSPA-599', '599', null, 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2049, 'Infor Literacy & Medical Writing', 'MSPA-602', '602', 'This course develops the ability to identify a clinical problem and to collect, process, analyze, summarize and present an evidence-based approach solution to that problem. The topic can be a medical challenge in terms of diagnosis or treatment of a disease state, or management issues for patients or their family\'s issues of which there is lack of consensus or a lack of clear guidelines.  2 credits', 97, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2050, 'Medical Ethics and Professional Practice', 'MSPA-603', '603', 'This course presents the student with the four- topic method of evaluation of ethical issues. Student examine ethical issues in terms of medical indications, patient preferences, quality of life and contextual features to provide a response to the ethical dilemma. Additionally, this course incorporates the history, development, certification and licensure process of the PA profession. PA web sites and professional organizations.   Special topics include risk management, professional liability, and, patient safety.  Billing, reimbursement, and the organization of healthcare in the US and in other countries are also explored.  2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2051, 'Professional Practice/Policy', 'MSPA-604', '604', 'This course incorporates the history, development, certification, licensure, reimbursement and key organizations of the PA profession as well as the role of the PA in public health and state and federal policy making. 2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2052, 'Global and Preventative Health', 'MSPA-608', '608', 'This course offers the student the opportunity to investigate the impact of health issues in other countries and the interactive effect on all populations in terms of epidemiology, disease, disasters, economics, health initiatives, ethics and policy. 2 credits', 97, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2053, 'Clinical Medicine I', 'MSPA-611', '611', 'The first of a four-semester series, this course is an organ-systems-based exploration of psychiatric, neurologic, and dermatologic diseases, as well as diseases of the head, eyes, ears, nose, and throat. Emphasis is on the integration of anatomy, physiology, pathophysiology, microbiology, history and exam findings and diagnostic procedures in order to formulate a differential diagnosis; on ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests in order to develop a working diagnosis; and on developing and implementing treatment plans including as needed therapeutic procedures, pharmacology, referral and patient education and counseling.  3 credits', 97, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2054, 'Clinical Medicine II', 'MSPA-612', '612', 'The second of a four-semester series, this course is an organ-systems-based exploration of cardiac, pulmonic, and gastrointestinal diseases. Emphasis is on the integration of anatomy, physiology, pathophysiology, microbiology, history and exam findings and diagnostic procedures in order to formulate a differential diagnosis; on ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests in order to develop a working diagnosis; and on developing and implementing treatment plans including as needed therapeutic procedures, pharmacology, referral and patient education and counseling.  6 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2055, 'Clinical Medicine III', 'MSPA-613', '613', 'The third of a four-semester series, this course is an organ-systems-based exploration of genitourinary, endocrine, renal, obstetric, gynecologic, and hematologic diseases.  Emphasis is on the integration of anatomy, physiology, pathophysiology, microbiology, history and exam findings and diagnostic procedures in order to formulate a differential diagnosis; on ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests in order to develop a working diagnosis; and on developing and implementing treatment plans including as needed therapeutic procedures, pharmacology, referral and patient education and counseling.  6 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2056, 'Clinical Medicine IV', 'MSPA-614', '614', 'The last of a four-semester series, this course is an organ-systems-based exploration of pediatrics, infectious, and musculoskeletal diseases as well as conditions found in emergency medicine.  Emphasis is on the integration of anatomy, physiology, pathophysiology, microbiology, history and exam findings and diagnostic procedures in order to formulate a differential diagnosis; on ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests in order to develop a working diagnosis; and on developing and implementing treatment plans including as needed therapeutic procedures, pharmacology, referral and patient education and counseling.  5 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2057, 'Fund of Surgery', 'MSPA-620', '620', 'This course presents the fundamentals of the approach to surgery and the surgical patient. Emphasis is on pre, intra and post-operative care, as well as organ-based surgical indications, interventions and techniques.  2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2058, 'Technical Skills', 'MSPA-621', '621', 'The demonstration and practice of technical procedures frequently encountered in primary care, emergency medicine, and surgical settings are explored in this course. The emphasis is on such skills as intravenous cannulization, suturing, urethral catheterization, splinting and casting incision and drainage and nasogastric lavage.  2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2059, 'Integrative Medicine/Pract I', 'MSPA-632', '632', 'The first of a three-part series, this course exposes students to the philosophy, practice and techniques utilized in alternative and complementary medicine. The focus of this course is on occupational therapy, physical therapy, Tai Chi, Qi Gong, Yoga, Chiropractic techniques and Massage Therapy.  Students have an opportunity to experience some of the modalities, such as Yoga or Massage Therapy, in guided exercise classes.   1 credit', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2060, 'Integrative Med & Practice II', 'MSPA-633', '633', 'The second of a three-part series, this course exposes students to the philosophy, practice and techniques utilized in alternative and complementary medicine. Ayurveda, Traditional Chinese Medicine, Acupuncture, Naturopathic medicine, Homeopathy, Hypnotherapy are presented in this course. The emphasis of this course is on dietary, herbal and ancient traditional medicine approaches.  1 credit', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2061, 'Integrative Medicine & Practice III', 'MSPA-634', '634', 'The last of a three-part series, this course exposes students to the integrative approach to common conditions, such as hypertension, diabetes, dysmenorrhea, anxiety and depression.  Emphasis is on commonly used alternative therapies with regards of their effectiveness and safety.  1 credit', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2062, 'Medical Seminar I', 'MSPA-642', '642', 'The first of a three-course series, this course gives students the skills to develop differential diagnoses and complete, patient-centered management plans.  Family medicine, psychosocial medicine and actual patient contact are aspects of this course.  2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2063, 'Medical Seminar II', 'MSPA-643', '643', 'The second of a three-course series, this course continues to emphasize the development of differential diagnoses, management plans, complete medical notes and oral presentations.  Patient contact allows students to practice these skills in real-life settings.  2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2064, 'Medical Seminar III', 'MSPA-644', '644', 'The last of a three course series, this case-based course refines the formation of diagnoses and complete management plans of common symptoms. The synthesis of material previously learned in a case-based format refines skills in critical thinking, medical problem solving, the written and the oral presentation of clinical cases 2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2065, 'Medical Seminar IV', 'MSPA-644B', '644B', 'This ongoing course utilizes a variety of techniques designed to supplement and integrate content from all didactic courses and clinical experience on rotation. Students will also be required to complete online PANCE prep, engage in in-class presentations and case discussions to include clinical medicine topics, Integrative Medicine, Global Health, Medical Ethics and Interdisciplinary patient care. This course will convene at call backs for blocks 1 through 4.', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2066, 'Medical Seminar V', 'MSPA-645', '645', 'This course is the culmination of the Information Literacy course MSPA 505 and Information Literacy and Medical writing MSPA 602. The acceptance of your proposal for the Clinical Review Project (i.e. Capstone Project) will be at the end of term 4. The goal of this course is to become an expert in an area of study. The clinical review project is NOT original research. This Project is the review existing published literature and based on a research question or domain of study.', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2067, 'Research Methods', 'MSPA-647', '647', 'This course provides a foundation in qualitative research and evaluation methods appropriate for health professionals. Students will develop competencies in working with communities to identify and understand health related conditions and will be able to evaluate interventions and health outcomes.  2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2068, 'Internal Medicine Clerkship', 'MSPA-651', '651', 'This six-week clerkship provides direct patient care experiences in the in-patient setting. Under the direction of board-certified internists, students learn to evaluate and formulate treatment plans for patients with a wide variety of adult illnesses. Emphasis of this clerkship is on critical thinking skills, synthesis of pertinent clinical information, the presentation of problem-oriented patient data, indications for and interpretation of laboratory studies, and competence in clinical procedures.  4 credits', 97, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2069, 'Pediatrics Clerkship', 'MSPA-652', '652', 'This six-week clerkship explores the care of children from birth through adolescence. Acute illness, developmental delay, genetic abnormalities, psychosocial issues and preventive medicine are explored.   4 credits', 97, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2070, 'Surgery Clerkship', 'MSPA-653', '653', 'This six-week clinical experience focuses on the care of the surgical patient in the pre-operative, operating room and post-operative settings.  Determination of surgical diagnoses and immediate management of life-threatening conditions are stressed.  4 credits', 97, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2071, 'Emergency Medicine Clerkship', 'MSPA-654', '654', 'This six-week clerkship provides opportunities to evaluate and treat patients with urgent and emergent medical complaints under the supervision of an emergency medical physician. The care of patients with life-threatening illness as well as patients seen in the sub-acute \"fast track\" are emphasized.   4 credits', 97, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2072, 'Obstetrics/Gynecology Clerkship', 'MSPA-655', '655', 'Experiences in the full range of woman\'s health issues throughout the reproductive and post-menopausal years are offered in this six-week clerkship, including participation in common gynecological surgical procedures and assisting in labor and delivery.  Students learn to provide pre- and post- partum care and family planning as well.  4 credits', 97, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2073, 'Family Medicine Clerkship', 'MSPA-656', '656', 'Family Medicine Rotation Students work with board-certified family physicians and general internists to evaluate, diagnose and treat patients of all ages with a wide variety of illness in this six-week clerkship. Emphasis is on health care delivery in the outpatient setting, health promotion, preventive medicine and the patient-centered medical home.   4 credits', 97, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2074, 'Psychiatry Clerkship', 'MSPA-657', '657', 'The diagnosis, treatment and management of patients with psychiatric illness in the in-patient, outpatient and emergency settings are stressed in this six-week rotation. This clerkship requires students develop and demonstrate a variety of skills under the supervision and guidance of an experienced psychiatric practitioner.  4 credits', 97, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2075, 'Elective Clerkship', 'MSPA-658', '658', 'This six-week experience offers the opportunity to explore a discipline of interest in depth.  Students are responsible to enhance their understanding of this discipline through by self-motivation. 4 credits', 97, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2076, 'Elective Clerkship', 'MSPA-659', '659', 'This six-week experience offers the opportunity to explore a discipline of interest in depth.  Students are responsible to enhance their understanding of this discipline through by self-motivation. 5-credits', 97, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2077, 'Capstone Project I', 'MSPA-661', '661', 'This course guides students through the formulation of a hypothesis-driven paper. Students collect and analyze either pilot data or use established data sets. Students begin to plan and develop a presentation of their findings.', 97, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2078, 'Capstone Project II', 'MSPA-662', '662', 'The second part of the Capstone project experience. Students continue the work begun on the projects in Capstone Project I drawing on skills gained in Information Literacy and Research Methods.', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2079, 'Clinical Clerkship VIII', 'MSPA-670', '670', null, 97, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2080, 'Clinical Seminar', 'MSPA-670A', '670A', 'This is a 7 week long online clinical course that develops and assesses skills necessary for practicing as a physician assistant in clinical settings. The course allows students to actively apply their didactic knowledge to a diverse set of clinical cases and settings, demonstrate clinical reasoning, and apply evidence-based approach in developing management plans.', 97, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2081, 'Research Methods', 'MSPA-671', '671', 'The course presents the epidemiologic tools needed to analyze medical literature, as well as describe the elements of constructing a research paper. Special emphasis is given to the various modalities used in medical written presentation.', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2082, 'Clinical Clerkship IX Elec 2', 'MSPA-680', '680', null, 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2083, 'Graduate Practice Logistics', 'MSPA-695', '695', 'This course presents a complete review of clinical medicine in preparation for the summative examination.  This course helps students identify content weaknesses.  Program resources can best aid students to complete their study and prepare for the NCCPA certifying exam. ', 97, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2084, 'Capstone Project', 'MSPA-698', '698', 'This course guides students through the selection of a topic through presentation of a complete literature search of a topic of interest. 2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2085, 'Capstone Project II', 'MSPA-699', '699', 'This course is the second part of the Capstone Project experience. Students will continue the work begun on the projects in semester 6 in MSPA 698 Capstone Project, drawing on the skills gained in MSPA 605 Information Literacy and MSPA 647 Research Methods. This course has the added requirement of presenting the project either in poster or presentation form to the program faculty. 2 credits', 97, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2494, 'Performance Seminar', 'MUSC-101', '101', null, 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2495, 'University Singers', 'MUSC-103', '103', 'Presentation of choral works from a variety of cultural and historical perspectives. Performances at university and community functions. All who enjoy singing are encouraged to enroll. 1 semester hour', 110, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2496, 'Chamber Singers', 'MUSC-104', '104', 'This select ensemble drawn from the University Singers sings demanding music written for small vocal ensemble.  Much repertoise is sung a cappella.  The group is selected by audition, and the number of singers chosen will depend on which voice parts are needed to maintain a balanced ensemble at all times.  In addition to solid aural skills, music reading ability is a prerequisite for this group.  This group performs frequently both on and off campus, and without the University Singers.', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2497, 'Chamber Singers', 'MUSC-104F', '104F', 'This select ensemble drawn from the University Singers sings demanding music written for small vocal ensemble. insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2514, 'Music Theory I', 'MUSC-109', '109', 'A thorough exploration of music fundamentals: principles of notation, clefs, time signatures, musical terms, rhythmic concepts, scales, keys, and seventh chords. Application of these fundamentals is emphasized through study of musical literature. 3 semester hours ', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2515, 'Aural Theory I', 'MUSC-109A', '109A', 'Development of aural recognition and singing. Includes intervals. Scales, and triads in all forms. 1 semester hour ', 110, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2516, 'Music Theory II', 'MUSC-110', '110', 'Counterpoint. Beginning with first species tonal counterpoint and progressing to four part chorale textures, students will develop the skills of writing multiple musical lines according to standard practices. Musical examples are studied. 3 semester hours', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2517, 'Aural Theory II', 'MUSC-110A', '110A', 'Continues the development of aural recognition and singing, with emphasis on two- part music. 1 semester hour ', 110, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2518, 'Concert Band', 'MUSC-111', '111', 'A university-community wind ensemble offering opportunity for public performance.', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2521, 'Introduction to Composition', 'MUSC-115', '115', 'Specific creative projects to be performed by University ensembles or soloists. Techniques of instrumentation and notation are emphasized. Prerequisite: Music 216 or permission of instructor. 3 semester hours ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2522, 'Music in Film', 'MUSC-120X', '120X', null, 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2523, 'Music Appr - Western', 'MUSC-121', '121', 'A basic course in the elements of music and their historical application in Western music. Active listening and student participation is emphasized. 3 semester hours  ', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2524, 'Music in the Liberal Arts', 'MUSC-122', '122', 'Music in the Liberal Arts is a substitution for traditional music appreciation that focuses on the influences of music on and from fields like literature, mathematics, religion, business and psychology. It is designed to focus on world music in both verbal and instrumental mediums.  The course involves extensive reading and several written assignments.', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2525, 'Song Logic', 'MUSC-123', '123', 'A continuation and development of skills learned in Musc 122 (which is prerequisite). Students will assimilate intermediate level analytical techniques as applied to popular music. Students will learn how some albums are assembled as concept albums using techniques developed by composers in 19th century song cycles. Students will develop an analytical portfolio', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2526, 'Introduction to World Music', 'MUSC-124', '124', 'Music is a universal human practice.  This course  provide an introduction to the diverse musical  traditions of the world, and to thinking about  music from an ethnomusicological perspective.   Folk, popular, and composed music from multiple  regions is studied in terms of structure,  performance practice, social use and cultural  significance.', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

Format and repertoire must be approved by music faculty. Pass / Fail. 0 credit ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2539, 'Masterpieces of Musc I', 'MUSC-201', '201', 'Designed to increase knowledge of musical literature and to refine awareness of musical patterns and syntax. Representative works in contrasting instrumentation are analyzed and compared.', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2540, 'Masterpieces II', 'MUSC-202', '202', 'Designed to increase knowledge of musical literature and to refine awareness of musical patterns and syntax. Representative works in contrasting instrumentation are analyzed and compared. 2 semester hours  ', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2541, 'Music History I', 'MUSC-203', '203', 'The historical development of music and musical styles from ancient Greece to the end of the baroque era. 3 semester hours ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2542, 'History of Music II', 'MUSC-204', '204', 'The historical development of music and musical styles from the baroque era through succeeding classical, romantic and modern periods. 3 semester hours ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2543, 'Music History III', 'MUSC-205', '205', 'An examination of the varied music produced from the late nineteenth century into the twenty-first,including influential works and major composers.Connections will be made to relevant historical,cultural, and philosophical developments.  Prerequisite :  MUSC-122, MUSC-203, or MUSC-204 or permission of the instructor.  3 semester hours', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2544, 'World Music - Indian', 'MUSC-206A', '206A', null, 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2545, 'Hist of Jazz', 'MUSC-207', '207', 'A study of the periods of jazz, jazz performers and composers, trends, influences, stylistic features, and related materials. 3 semester hours ', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2546, 'Jazz Improv & Rep I', 'MUSC-208A', '208A', 'A beginning approach to jazz improvisation through the study of contemporary harmony. Lyrical style will be emphasized. Students analyze and transcribe solos. Prerequisites: Music 109-110. 2 semester hours ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2547, 'Jazz Improv & Rep II', 'MUSC-208B', '208B', 'A beginning approach to jazz improvisation through the study of contemporary harmony. Lyrical style will be emphasized. Students analyze and transcribe solos. Prerequisites: Music 109-110. 2 semester hours ', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2548, 'Business of Music', 'MUSC-209', '209', 'An introduction to the knowledge base and skills needed for professional success in the music business. Topics include artist management, booking, concert and tour production, venues, the recording industry, copyright, performing rights, intellectual property, publishing and marketing as they apply to the commercial music industry.  3 semester hours', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2549, 'Music in America', 'MUSC-210X', '210X', 'This course will study the history and development of popular musical styles in the United States through listening, analyzing, lecture, discussion and writing.  Students will understand how America\'s popular music developed, their important role in society and culture and begin to unpack the complex web of relations among music, history, ethnicity, race, gender, culture, creativity and the marketplace.', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2550, 'Recording Techniques I', 'MUSC-212', '212', 'Introduction to the use of microphones, mixing consoles, digital and analog record ers in the university?s recording studio. Labs include on-campus concerts. 2 semester hours ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2551, 'Recording Techniques II', 'MUSC-213', '213', null, 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2553, 'Songwriting II', 'MUSC-214X', '214X', null, 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2554, 'Musc Theory III', 'MUSC-215', '215', 'Harmony and Analysis. Introduction to the harmonic and formal practices of the seven-teenth and eighteenth centuries in Western music. Examples from the repertoire studied. Continues the study of four-part writing. 3 semester hours ', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2555, 'Aural Thry III', 'MUSC-215A', '215A', 'Continues the development of aural recognition and solfege singing. Includes aural recognition of four-part music, cadences, and modulations. 1 semester hour ', 110, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2556, 'Music Thry IV', 'MUSC-216', '216', 'Harmony and Analysis. Introduction to the harmonic practices of the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries in Western music, with an emphasis on chromaticism and large scale formal considerations. Examples from the repertoire will be examined. 3 semester hours ', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2557, 'Aural Theory IV', 'MUSC-216A', '216A', 'Continues the development of aural recognition and solfege singing. Includes aural recognition of four-part music, cadences, and modulations. 1 semester hour ', 110, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2558, 'Vocal Diction', 'MUSC-220', '220', 'Study of IPA and vowel and consonant production required for singing in Italian, German, French and English. Specific application to the song and operatic literature. 3 semester hours ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2559, 'Writing About Music', 'MUSC-222', '222', 'A writing intensive for music majors. The course will introduce several types of writing, including journalistic essays, program notes, writing liner notes and other writing that incorporates analytical insight but remains readable to the general public.', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2560, 'Tango History and Performance', 'MUSC-240X', '240X', null, 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2561, 'Group Piano', 'MUSC-255', '255', 'A beginning course in the fundamentals of piano technique and playing. Simple pieces, scales, exercises and transposition. 2 semester hours ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2562, 'Group Piano II', 'MUSC-256', '256', 'Keyboard skills are developed which include playing harmonic progressions in any key, cadences, and diatonic and chromatic sequences. Sight-reading diatonic melodies and simple figured bass are also required. 2 semester hours ', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2563, 'Music Through Fiction', 'MUSC-280', '280', '\"Music through Fiction\" is a course in which students will learn musical repertoire, and read works of fiction in which that same repertoire appears. The music becomes part of a larger context when it becomes entwined within a story. Students will be required to buy and read several books for the course. This course counts within the music major, but is also open to students from other majors (for core credit) who have an interest in the musical material that will be covered in the class. Writing assignments and exams will provide an opportunity to develop an understanding of the interaction between the music and the fiction. Students will also occasionally be required to prepare observations ahead of class and to distribute a pedagogically effective handout that will allow them to lead a discussion.', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2564, 'Junior Recital', 'MUSC-295', '295', 'A full-length recital performed on declared major instrument. Format and repertoire must be approved by music faculty. Pass/ fail. 0 credit ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2565, 'Piano Maint & Repair', 'MUSC-298', '298', 'Aspects of piano tuning, regulation, maintenance and basic repairs are studies using project instruments supplied by the university. 3 semester hours ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2566, 'Jazz Arranging I', 'MUSC-304A', '304A', 'Beginning and intermediate study and application of modern techniques of writing for large and small jazz ensembles. Prerequisite Music 215 or permission of instructor. 3 semester hours each ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2567, 'Jazz Arranging II', 'MUSC-304B', '304B', 'Beginning and intermediate study and application of modern techniques of writing for large and small jazz ensembles. Prerequisite Music 215 or permission of instructor. 3 semester hours each ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2568, 'Psychology of Music', 'MUSC-306X', '306X', 'This course introduces students to the field of music psychology: how our minds learn, perceive, process, and respond to musical information. Students will gain basic familiarity with the various subfields in music psychology, understand how the field impacts their academic and professional specialties, be able to design experiments that test research questions in music psychology, and demonstrate critical thinking about research goals and methodology in the field.', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2569, 'Conducting I', 'MUSC-311', '311', 'Fundamental patterns and expressive techniques of conducting. Emphasis in choral techniques and conducting choral ensembles. 3 semester hours ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2570, 'Conducting II', 'MUSC-312', '312', 'Advanced patterns and expressive techniques of conducting. Emphasis in instrumental techniques and conducting instrumental ensembles and orchestras. 3 semester hours  ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2571, 'Counterpoint I', 'MUSC-317', '317', null, 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2574, 'Senior Recital', 'MUSC-395', '395', 'Student prepares and performs a recital of  approximately 30-45 minutes of solo and small  ensemble repertoire, providing a printed program  and program notes, as a public demonstration of  skills and knowledge developed throughout their  collegiate music study.', 110, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2575, 'Internship', 'MUSC-398', '398', 'Professional, supervised, work experience in an organization related to career goals ( may be unpaid ). Prerequisite: Permission of advisor and School director. 3 semester hours  ', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2576, 'Independent Study', 'MUSC-399', '399', 'Specialized advanced projects in subjects not covered by course offerings. Conferences with designated Independent Study advisor. Prerequisite : Permission of advisor and school director. 3 semester hours ', 110, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2577, '^Business of Music', 'MUSC-414', '414', 'Practical knowledge of skills necessary to function and flourish as a professional musician. Standard business models for private studio teaching, not-for-profits, performing contracts, artist management, recording and publishing. 2 semester hours ', 110, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');
