insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2646, 'Pharmacology for the Professional Nurse', 'NURS-208', '208', 'This course focuses on the basic principles of pharmacology and nursing implications.  The nursing process is used to explore the therapeutic effects of pharmacological interventions. Patient education and clinical applications are emphasized for pharmacology interventions in patient care. The course also explores the indications, modes of action, effects, contraindications and interactions for selected drug classifications.  Specific nursing responsibilities related to drug administration care are emphasized.', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2647, 'Nursing Topics-Ind Study', 'NURS-299', '299', null, 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2648, 'Nursing Theory & Evidence-Based Practice', 'NURS-301', '301', 'This course is designed to introduce the RN student to the conceptual, philosophical, scientific and ethical bases for professional nursing practice.  The relationship among theory, research and evidence-based practice is explored and applied to real life practice situations.  The role of the nurse in support of this theory, research and evidence-based practice is addressed through a theoretical paper, research critiques, and discussion of evidence-based care in selected scenarios. 3 Credits', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2649, 'Health Assessment', 'NURS-302', '302', 'The focus of this course is to provide the essential elements of health assessment relevant to the role of the BSN graduate.  Skills and tools for holistic health assessment are provided that facilitate the implementation of safe, quality nursing care across the lifespan.', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2650, 'Community Health', 'NURS-303', '303', 'This clinical course is designed to provide students with the opportunity to apply the nursing process to the community as the health client.  Students will use principles of epidemiology to investigate a community health problem.  The health needs of populations at risk within the community are identified and plans are formulated to meet those needs.  Practical experiences utilize a variety of community settings.  4 Credits', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2651, '^Professional Seminar', 'NURS-304', '304', 'A seminar course focusing on issues pertinent to professional nursing practice. This course provides an opportunity for the RN student to complete the synthesis to the BSN role prior to program completion while exploring current trends that impact the practice of professional nursing. 3 Credits', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2652, 'Leadership & Management in Nursing', 'NURS-305', '305', 'Introduces the RN student to organizational theory, management, structure of nursing care delivery systems and components of leadership behavior.  This course focuses on the role of the nurse as both a formal and informal leader in multiple roles of organizing, teaching, decision making, evaluating, and managing conflict.   4 Credits', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2653, 'Quality, Safety/Health Policy', 'NURS-306', '306', 'This course examines health care policy and politics as it relates to the quality and safety of nursing practice. Historical, ethical, political and economic factors are discussed and the nurse\'s responsibility and role in health care policy is explored.  A project facilitates application of principles addressed in the course.(1 credit for a clinical practicum and 3 credits didactic)', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2654, 'Nursing & Healthcare Informatics', 'NURS-307', '307', 'The focus of this course is to introduce the principles of health care informatics, communication networks, and health care technology in the assessment, delivery, and evaluation of quality nursing care in a variety of settings.  Ethical and legal considerations are integrated into the application of technological best practice to care.  3 Credits', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2655, '^Capstone II', 'NURS-308', '308', ' This seminar style course is designed to provide an opportunity for synthesis of learning experiences from past and current learning to promote professional practice emphasizing principles of lifelong learning and caring practices.  Collaboration with other health care providers to improve evidence-based outcomes of care for individuals, families, and communities is emphasized.  The application of these concepts through the development of a professional portfolio will document a strategic change project that reflects successful completion of individual goals and program learning outcomes.   3 Credits', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2656, 'Population and Global Health', 'NURS-310', '310', 'Course Description: ___ Pre-req: NURS 303. This course is for RNs and focuses on application of community and population health. Students apply concepts of the nursing process to a selected aggregate population through completion of a community assessment project demonstrating successful completion of practice experiences. A global health experience may be used to meet completion of this requirement. (1hr seminar; 2hr didactic;  35 hr. practice experience).', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2657, 'The Research Process in Nursing', 'NURS-314', '314', 'This course is designed to introduce the conceptual, philosophical, scientific and ethical basis for professional nursing practice.  It examines theories of nursing and other theories relevant to nursing practice.  The relationship of theory, research and evidence-based practice is explored and applied to real life practice situations.  The structure and function of interprofessional relationships are examined as evidence based practice is discussed and applied.  ', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2658, 'Statistical Reasoning', 'NURS-315', '315', 'This course will provide a basic overview of statistical analysis and how certain tests can be performed to determine if there is a statistically significant relationship bewteen variable.  The student will recieve an introduction to the use of statistical software for data analysis.', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2659, 'Health Maintenance & Restoration II', 'NURS-316', '316', 'This course emphasizes holistic nursing care for patient experiencing changes in metabolism, elimination, oxygenation and perfusion status.  Students integrate theoretical knowledge into their clinical practice of the health-illness continuum in a variety of health care settings.  Core values and competencies are examined throughout the roles and behaviors of provider of care, designer/manager/coordinator of care, and member of a profession.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2660, 'Clinical Health Maint & Rest', 'NURS-316C', '316C', 'Clinical course offered concurrently with Health Maintenance and Restoration lecture course.   Students integrate theoretical knowledge into their clinical practice of the health-illness continuum in a variety of health care settings.  Core values and competencies are examined throughout the roles and behaviors of provider of care, designer/manager/coordinator of care, and member of a profession.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2661, 'Essentials Psych/Mental Health Nursing', 'NURS-318', '318', 'This course explores the application of concepts and principles of psychiatric/mental health care to individuals, groups, families, and communities to promote, restore and maintain optimal health for those experiencing psychopathology.  Students examine the social and environmental impact upon patients and families abilities to meet the challenges of mental illness and refine their delivery of nursing care and therapeutic communication.  Students are encouraged to examine their personal values and feelings in caring for patients in this setting and their interaction with the inter-professional mental health team. (4cr = theory 3cr & clinical 1cr)', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2662, 'Clinical Psych/Mental Hlth', 'NURS-318C', '318C', 'Clinical course offered concurrently with Essentials of Psychological/Mental Health Nursing. Students examine the social and environmental impact upon patients and families abilities to meet the challenges of mental illness and refine their delivery of nursing care and therapeutic communication.  Students are encouraged to examine their personal values and feelings in caring for patients in this setting and their interaction with the inter-professional mental health team.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2663, 'Essentials of Family Nursing', 'NURS-323', '323', 'This course focuses on holistic nursing care of the child-bearing and child-rearing family. The roles of the nurse as provider, designer/manager/coordinator of care and member of the profession are implemented across the health-illness continuum.  Opportunities are provided in a variety of clinical settings for family centered nursing that is evidence-based and incorporates nursing informatics and patient care technology.', 116, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2664, 'Clinic Family Nursing', 'NURS-323C', '323C', 'Clinical course offered concurrently with Essentials of Family Nursing.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2665, 'Maternity Clinic Family Nursing', 'NURS-323CM', '323CM', 'This clinical experience exposes the BSN student to childbearing nursing care in a variety of settings.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2666, 'Pediatric Clinic Family Nursings', 'NURS-323CP', '323CP', 'This clinical experience exposes the BSN student to childrearing nursing care in a variety of settings.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2667, 'Health Maintenance & Restoration III', 'NURS-326', '326', 'This course emphasizes nursing care of patients experiencing changes in immunity/cellular regulation, skin integrity, and perfusion.  Nursing care of patients with complex, multi-system failure is introduced and the roles of the nurse as provider, designer/manager/coordinator of care and member of the profession are demonstrated in selected patient care environments.  Students are expected to integrate and synthesize theoretical knowledge, core values, and competencies when providing safe, effective, quality nursing care.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2668, 'Clinical Hlth Maint & Rest III', 'NURS-326C', '326C', 'Clinical Course Rptation offered concurrently with Halth Main & Rest This course emphasizes nursing care of patients experiencing changes in immunity/cellular regulation, skin integrity, and perfusion.  Nursing care of patients with complex, multi-system failure is introduced and the roles of the nurse as provider, designer/manager/coordinator of care and member of the profession are demonstrated in selected patient care environments.  Students are expected to integrate and synthesize theoretical knowledge, core values, and competencies when providing safe, effective, quality nursing care.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2669, 'Hlth Policy & Health Systems', 'NURS-328', '328', 'This course examines health care policy, health systems, and political issues as they relate to nursing practice.  Historical, ethical, legal, political and economic factors are discussed and the nurse\'s responsibility and role in examining and contributing to the development of health care policy is identified.  ', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2670, 'Hlth Promo Ii: the Community', 'NURS-344', '344', 'This course explores the concepts and principles of caring for clients in the community setting and the community as clients.  Diverse nursing roles and interventions are examined and in-depth community assessment employing epidemiological principles and data collection strategies is emphasized.  Discussion of the determinants and operations of the health care system from a broad political, economic, social and legal perspective are integrated throughout.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2671, 'Hlth Prom Ii: Pop Hlth Clinic', 'NURS-344C', '344C', null, 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2672, 'Leardership & Mgt Roles in Nursing', 'NURS-345', '345', 'This course introduces organizational theory and structure of nursing care delivery system and components of leadership behaviors within the nursing roles of provider or care, designer/manager/coordinator of care, and member of the profession.  Focus is on the role of the nurse leader in the multiple expectations of organizing, teaching, decision making, evaluating, and managing conflict.  The principles of delegation, priority setting and the management of patient care are emphasized throughout the course as they are applied in the classroom and clinical settings.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2673, 'Current Issues & Trends Nursing', 'NURS-357', '357', 'This seminar course focuses on timely issues pertinent to professional nursing practice and provides an opportunity for students to design and lead a seminar.  Practice, economic, political, social, technology, legal, ethical, and spiritual needs are all examined in relation to the integrity and standards of professional nursing practice.', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2674, 'Transition to Prof Practice: Sr. Pract', 'NURS-358', '358', 'This course explores the students\' transition into professional nursing practice.  Holistic care is emphasized as a student selects a specialty area of practice in a clinical arena in an area of choice.  Students integrate core knowledge of nursing to provide care within the health-illness continuum in the roles of provider, designer/manager/coordinator of care and member of the profession.  ', 116, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2675, 'Clinical Transitions to Prof Pract', 'NURS-358C', '358C', null, 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2676, 'Capstone II', 'NURS-393', '393', 'This course facilitates an in-depth evidence based study of a student selected area of interest related to nursing practice.  Leadership and research concepts are integrated and the study results in a capstone ready for presentation.  Synthesis of nursing knowledge, liberal arts and sciences are expected.  The course requires application of the research process, project development, and critical thinking that demonstrates synthesis of knowledge and skills relevant to the practice of the BSN nurse.', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2677, 'Theory and Evidence Based Practice', 'NURS-540', '540', 'Scholarly inquiry begins in analyzing the nature and purpose of theoretical thinking and critical evaluation of research. The review of research methodologies, hypothesis, research questions and research design, in the persistent search for truth, is emphasized throughout the course. Exercises in the literature review for evidence-based practice and decision-making are implemented to investigate clinical and educational best practice.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2678, 'Advanced Pharmacology', 'NURS-550', '550', 'This course is designed to advance the student\'s knowledge of pharma-co-kinetics, pharma-co-dynamics, pharma-co-genomics, and pharma-co-therapeutics, in the management of health and desease states across the lifespan.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2679, 'Adv Pathophysiology & Health Assessment', 'NURS-560', '560', 'This course provides students with advanced anatomy, physiology, and pathophysiology of systems in relation to an individual\'s health across the lifespan. The application of this knowledge is combined with the acquisition of advanced health assessment and clinical reasoning skills. Students apply the diagnostic (clinical) reasoning process to develop a comprehensive plan of care for patients in a variety of settings throughout the lifespan. Emphasis is placed on health promotion, disease prevention and risk assessment.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2680, 'Quality Safety & Policy', 'NURS-575', '575', 'This course examines health care policy and politics as it relates to the quality and safety of nursing practice. Historical, ethical, political and economic factors are discussed and the nurse\'s responsibility and role in health care policy is explored.  A project facilitates application of principles addressed in the course.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2681, '^Nursing Informatics', 'NURS-590', '590', 'The focus of this course is to introduce the principles of health care informatics, communication networks, and health care technology in the assessment, delivery, and evaluation of quality nursing care in a variety of settings.  Ethical and legal considerations are integrated into the application of technological best practice to care.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2682, 'Curriculum Development & Design', 'NURS-602', '602', 'Graduates integrate learning theory, philosophy of education with an organization\'s mission and values, including specific learning outcomes. Students design and develop a curriculum focused on social implications and organizational assessments.', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2683, 'Teaching, Assessment & Evaluation of Out', 'NURS-604', '604', 'This course provides a background on effective teaching strategies including activities that promote student learning and engagement. Students present and map assessment and evaluation of outcomes that foster student learning of the instructor\'s and/or of the institution\'s educational objectives. Various approaches are offered for evaluating and interpreting teaching effectiveness and achievement of outcomes including student ratings, self-reviews, peer evaluations, and objective criteria such as student performance.', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2684, 'Resource Management and Finance', 'NURS-606', '606', 'This course presents an introduction to U.S. accounting regulations and practices. Students are expected to interact effectively with the accounting and finance departments and create a business proposal including a budget.', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2685, 'Organizational Leadership', 'NURS-608', '608', 'The student will explore principles of leadership and management that form the basis of change theory in healthcare and academic environments. Building knowledge through the study of theory and chanage processes for contemporary healthcare and healthcare education. Evolving roles of managers, leaders, and educators are discussed with a focus on leading and managing transitions, encouraging teamwork, fiscal management, planning, etc.', 116, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2686, 'Education Practicum', 'NURS-610', '610', 'The practicum course will integrate all education courses in a practicum that is student-driven, focused on problem-solving in the education domain and produces new knowledge for the profession of nursing. Students may develop a thesis.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2687, 'Leadership Practicum', 'NURS-612', '612', 'The culmination of learning is demonstrated in the practicum experience through hands-on activities in the organization of choice that permits students to analyze, apply, and integrate learned knowledge and skills through the exercise of problem-solving, resource management, interdisciplinary collaboration, and effective communication. The experiential role is with a leader in nursing for 64 hours.', 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2688, 'Nursing Block', 'NURS-BLOCK', 'BLOCK', null, 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2689, 'Nursing Elective', 'NURS-ELECTV', 'ELECTV', null, 116, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2690, 'Orientation to Computer', 'NUTR-001', '001', null, 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2691, 'Basic Nutrition', 'NUTR-107', '107', null, 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2692, 'Anatomy & Physiology', 'NUTR-121', '121', 'Available Summer and Fall terms This course provides a detailed study of the structure and function of cells, tissues, and organ systems, control systems of the human body, homeostatic mechanisms, and the interrelations between the systems are studied. (6 credits)  ', 117, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2693, 'Intro Biochemistry', 'NUTR-122', '122', 'Available Summer and Fall terms The course meets for six weekend day sessions. The first two meetings reviews basic General Chemistry topics including Atomic Theory, Periodic Law, Chemical Bonding, Chemical Reactions, Kinetics, and Acid & Base Concepts. The second two meetings deals with Organic Chemistry and includes topics in Isomerism, and the Physical & Chemical Properties of the different Organic Functional Groups. The last two meetings is an introduction into Human Biochemistry concentrating on the structural and functional properties of Carbohydrates, Lipids, Proteins and Nucleotides. The roles of these biological chemicals in Nutrition and Metabolism is also discussed. (4 credits', 117, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2694, 'Basic Nutrition', 'NUTR-123', '123', 'Available Summer and Fall terms A study of the basic principles of nutrition and the influence of nutrients and food choices on health promotion and disease prevention and a detailed knowledge of the metabolsim of proteins, carbohydrates, fats and macro and micro nutrients. (2 credits) ', 117, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2695, 'Nutritional Biochemistry', 'NUTR-204', '204', 'This course will teach the basic principles of the science of human nutrition and nutritional biochemistry with an emphasis on the effects of nutrition on dental health.  The focus will be on the roles of micro- and macronutrients and the importance of proper energy balance, digestion, absorption and metabolism of these nutrients.  Correlations to dental hygiene are discussed at each class as it pertains to the weekly subject matter.  Strategies of counseling patients to improve oral health are taught throughout the course.', 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2696, 'Fundamentals of Nutrition', 'NUTR-205', '205', null, 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2697, 'Community Nutrition', 'NUTR-350', '350', 'This course will provide students with the knowledge, skills, tools and evidence-based approaches needed by community nutritionists to promote health and prevent diseases.', 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2698, 'HNutr Co-op', 'NUTR-500', '500', null, 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2699, 'Pathophysiologic Basis', 'NUTR-560A', '560A', 'A study of the underlying mechanisms of disease and the complex interrelationships between critical systems including respiratory, urinary, cardiovascular, digestive, nervous and endocrine. Lectures will include fluid and electrolyte imbalances, acid and base imbalances, inflammation, hypersensitivity, infection, necrosis, and neoplasm?s. The influence of various nutrients on systemic function will be stressed. Prerequisite: Anatomy & Physiology I, II. 4 semester hours', 117, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2700, 'Biochemistry of Nutrition', 'NUTR-560B', '560B', 'A lecture course covering the static and dynamic aspects of the biochemistry of carbohydrates, lipids, amino acids, proteins, nucleic acids, cat ions, anions, enzyme kinetics, hormones and vitamins in the healthy individual. Integration and control mechanisms of the various metabolic pathways are particularly emphasized. Prerequisite: Introduction to Biochemistry. 4 semester hours', 117, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2701, 'Vitamin & Minerals', 'NUTR-560C', '560C', 'Basic and clinical aspects of nutrient homeostasis concentrating on vitamin and mineral metabolism at the cellular and tissue level. Lectures will include specific functions, requirements, sources, assay methods, effects of deficiencies and excesses of each vitamin and mineral. Prerequisite: Nutrition 560B. 4 semester hours', 117, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2702, 'Clin Biochem&Adv Assessment', 'NUTR-560D', '560D', 'A lecture course dealing with the biochemistry of disorders arising from acid/base imbalance and the abnormal metabolism of the carbohydrates, lipids, proteins, nucleic acids, bile pigments, vitamins, and hormones. Prerequisite: Nutrition 560B. 3 semester hours', 117, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2703, 'Assessment in Nutrition', 'NUTR-560E', '560E', 'Clinical and laboratory analytical procedures for evaluation of nutrient status, including blood and other tissue analysis, dietary records and questionnaires, case history, physical examination, anthropometrical methods, etc. 3 semester hours', 117, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2704, 'Functional Nutritional Therapeutics', 'NUTR-560F', '560F', 'A survey of diseases with primary or secondary nutritional implications and related nutritional strategies. For each disease covered, the etiology, pathology, epidemiological, and prevailing methods of treatment will be presented. The mechanism of action of various nutritional therapies and the role of nutrition in support of other treatments and modalities will be explored. 4 semester hours', 117, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2705, 'Lifelong Healing With Food', 'NUTR-560G', '560G', 'This course will teach the use of foods as medicine across a wide variety of demographics and health conditions.  Menu and recipe planning, cooking methods, food preparation and safety will be covered.  Cultural perspectives on nutrition will be addressed to include Chinese and ayurvedic food therapy and functional foods.  Specialized nutrition plans will also be covered to include allergy elimination diets, detoxification and anti inflammation.', 117, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2706, 'Developmental Nutrition', 'NUTR-560H', '560H', 'Nutritional considerations and health related concerns of growth and development. Special attention will be given to pregnancy/ lactation, fetal/neonatal, and infant/pediatric stages of development. Nutritional needs of the adolescent and elderly will be discussed. 3 semester hours', 117, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2707, 'Functional Medicine Nutrition', 'NUTR-560I', '560I', 'This course will teach advanced biochemical assessment using clinical testing and critical analysis of client history with clinical testing from a functional medicine perspective. Functional lab testing will be evaluated in detail with case studies.  Topics will be relevant to preventive as well as therapeutic nutrition care.', 117, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2708, 'Research in Nutrition', 'NUTR-560J', '560J', 'Independent research project with faculty guidance, based on literature survey or original research. Project approval is required. Prerequisite: Advanced standing, permission of advisor. 3 semester hours', 117, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2709, 'Virtual Clinic', 'NUTR-560K', '560K', 'This final semester course will incorporate critical thinking and scientific knowledge as you complete 4 monthly modules on clinical training online with different instructors.  You will learn key skills in assessment, clinical test analysis, designing treatment plans for specific common health conditions, weight loss strategies and how to effectively start and grow your nutrition practice. Synchronous data technology will be used to learn with your classmates and instructors.', 117, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2710, 'Nutrition and Exercise', 'NUTR-560L', '560L', 'An instructional class for nutritionists detailing proper dietary protocols for enhancing endurance and performance during exercise and sports. Elective. 3 semester hours', 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2711, 'Evidence Based Nutrition Reasoning', 'NUTR-560M', '560M', 'The course describes the analytical approaches for searching and interpreting clinical research data reported in the literature using evidence based practice with emphasis on the application of those data in clinical practice. Biological variation, experimental design, data and fact differences, matching analysis to design, integrity in analysis, and bias in design and analysis, are considered in detail. 3 semester hours', 117, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2712, 'Anat & Physiology for the Clinical Nutritionist', 'NUTR-560N', '560N', null, 117, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2713, 'Botanical Medicine', 'NUTR-560P', '560P', 'A study of the use of herbs in nutritional practice. Discussions on individual herbs will include botany, mechanism of action, pharmacological/toxicological properties, clinical application, product standardization, and recommended dosages. 3 semester hours', 117, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2714, 'Nutrition and Cancer', 'NUTR-560Q', '560Q', 'This course will provide an understanding of the etiology of cancer from a functional medicine paradigm, understand current allopathic assessment and treatment options and how to implement nutritional therapy to assist cancer patients undergoing treatment.  This course will also teach complementary supplementation strategies, and understand the role of diet and lifestyle in prevention of primary and secondary cancer and establish communication skills to enhance collaboration with oncologists.', 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2715, 'Nutrition & Culture', 'NUTR-560R', '560R', 'This course reviews nutrition principles, examines dietary patterns, and outlines the cultural importance of food in various ethnic and American societies. This course is designed to provide an overview of the cultural aspects of food, the societal influences and origins of food traditions. It will cover aspects of American (including Native American) and selected ethnic cuisines. Material will cover a brief overview of culinary history and future trends. 3 semester hours', 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2716, 'Nutrition Seminar', 'NUTR-560S', '560S', null, 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2717, 'Nutrition and Autism', 'NUTR-560T', '560T', 'To acquire a foundational understanding of Autism Spectrum Disorder and relationships to dietary modifications to facilitate improvements in cognition and overall health.', 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2718, 'Intro Biochem for Clin Nutr', 'NUTR-560U', '560U', null, 117, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2719, 'Nutrition Fundamentals', 'NUTR-560V', '560V', null, 117, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2723, 'Nutrition Electv', 'NUTR-ELECTV', 'ELECTV', null, 117, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2724, 'Supervision and Team Building', 'ORLD-341', '341', null, 118, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2725, 'Non-Profit Management', 'ORLD-342', '342', null, 118, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2726, 'Org Change and Leadership Organizational Change and Leadership', 'ORLD-350', '350', 'This course offers students a comprehensive, relevant perspective on leadership and management. While the course provides grounding in important concepts, it also stresses application to professional and community settings. Students analyze concepts such as leading as an interactive process (involving the leader, the \"followers\", and the situation), managing with innovation and creativity, escaping from embedded practices, and embracing new managerial principles.', 118, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2727, 'Challenges in Leadership Seminar', 'ORLD-351', '351', null, 118, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2749, 'Fundamentals of Pathology', 'PA-611', '611', 'This course is a study of pathophysiological processes and the gross, microscopic, and clinical manifestations of disease. Basic processes of inflammation, repair, degeneration, necrosis, immune response, and neoplasia are presented. This course is also an introduction to diseases of the lymphatic, hematopoietic, and neuromus-culoskeletal systems. Laboratory includes the study of gross and microscopic changes as well as clinical presentations of various diseases and functional disturbances. Prerequisites: All anatomy courses, PH521, BC511 2 lecture hours, 1 laboratory hour, 2.5 semester hours', 121, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2750, 'Systems Pathology', 'PA-622', '622', 'This course is a continuation of PA611. This course emphasizes the pathological basis of systemic diseases of the cardiovascular, respiratory, gastrointestinal, urogenital, endocrine, and renal systems. The gross, microscopic, and clinical manifestations of various disease processes are presented. Prerequisites: PA611, PH612. 4 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours, 5 semester hours', 121, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2941, 'Summer Program for Intl Students', 'PDEN-01', '01', null, 135, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2861, 'Nutrition and Exercise', 'PG-912', '912', 'Nutrition concepts relating to how the body uses the macronutrients and micronutrients to fuel energy systems will be explored.  Nutritional recommendations for the physically active person and for intense training and competition will be discussed.  Examination of popular performance enhancing and ergogenic aids and fundamentals of energy balance, exercise and weight control.', 130, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2862, 'Nutrition and Autism', 'PG-912A', '912A', 'To acquire a foundational understanding of Autism Spectrum Disorder and relationships to dietary modifications to facilitate improvements in cognition and overall health.', 130, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2863, 'Chinese Medicine Conference', 'PG-913', '913', 'One day conference covering topics covering the modern and traditional practice of Chinese Medicine.  Speakers from the US and China will present topics ranging from Traditions and Ethics in Chinese Medicine to Modern Efficacy & Interpretations of CHinese Medicine.', 130, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2900, 'Clinical Educators Workshop', 'PGDH-101', '101', null, 131, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2802, 'Organ Syst Microscopic A&P I', 'PH-521', '521', 'This class will focus on understanding the microscopic anatomy and physiology of the organs of the immune and endocrine systems. Major emphasis will be placed on the role of non-specific and specific defense mechanisms in health maintenance and provide an introduction into immune system disruption as it relates to hypersensitivity and autoimmunity. The endocrine system will be studied in it?s primary role in cellular communication and maintenance of homestasis. Special emphasis will be placed on the interaction and communication between the nervous and endocrine systems. 2 lecture hours, 2 semester hours', 127, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2803, 'Organ Syst Microscopic A&PII', 'PH-612', '612', 'The microscopic anatomy and physiology of the cardiovascular, respiratory, digestive and reproductive systems will be introduced. An emphasis will be placed on the relationship of tissue organization and function of the organ systems. Laboratories in this class will utilize case studies to emphasize how an understanding of normal physiologic mechanisms and how they are crucial to understanding pathophysiology. Prerequisites: AN511, PH521. 4 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours, 5 semester hours', 127, 5, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2804, 'Toxicology/Pharmacology', 'PH-713', '713', 'This course is the study of drugs and chemicals and how they interact with the living organism. Pharmacology is a study of the sites, absorption, and metabolism of common drugs. Toxicology studies the adverse reactions of drugs and poisons. The therapeutic use and toxic effects of various drugs, chemicals, nutritional supplements and other substances are studied. Prerequisites: PH612, PA611, NS612, PA622 2 lecture hours, 2 semester hours', 127, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2758, 'General Philosophy', 'PHIL-101', '101', 'A survey of the central problems of meta-physics, epistemology, and ethics. Topics include the  existence of God, extreme skepticism, the  relationship between mind and body, free will  versus determinism, and freedom of expression. The course includes analysis of representative  thinkers.', 123, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2759, 'Men, Women, Issues', 'PHIL-103', '103', 'A discussion of gender differences and sex  equality. The course critically examines top- ics such as sexual harassment, comparable  worth, monogamous marriage, prostitution,  and rape. These topics are examined from a  variety of perspectives, including conserva- tism, liberal feminism, traditional Marxism,  radical feminism, and the care and justice out- looks that Carol Gilligan has identified. 3 semester hours', 123, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2760, 'Logic & Scientific Mthd', 'PHIL-104', '104', 'Study  of  logical  inference,  both  deductive   and inductive. Analysis of propositions, argu- ments, fallacies, language, and the nature and  functions of the methods of the sciences. 3 semester hours', 123, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2761, 'Health Care Ethics', 'PHIL-110', '110', 'Explores ethical issues relating to health care.  Topics include doctor-patient confidentiality, the right to refuse treatment, animal experiments, abortion, and euthanasia, among others.', 123, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2762, 'Ethics', 'PHIL-203', '203', 'A study of problems of applied ethics, such as  abortion, animal experimentation, affirmative  action, and gay and lesbian rights. These problems are explored form the standpoint of ethical  theories such as utilitarianism and Kantian ethics . The course helps students formulate and  interpret moral values by which they may think and act.', 123, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2763, 'Hist Western Phil', 'PHIL-205', '205', 'A survey of the historical development of philosophy from antiquity through the 19th Century, with weight given to the contributions of Greek philosophers and those of the Middle Ages and the Enlightenment. In the 19th Century, attention is given to the rationalist, idealist, and empiricist schools of thought and their influence. 3 semester hours', 123, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2764, 'Animal Rights', 'PHIL-210', '210', 'Do animals have rights? What ethical constrains should guide our treatment of cats, dogs, and other companion animals? Should people be vegetarians? Are animal experiments morally wrong? Are there good reasons to create genetically engineered animals? Are hunting and fishing morally permissible? Is anything wrong with zoos and aquariums? Should animal rights activities ever resort to violence in order to advance their goals? Philosophy 210 explores these and other ethical issue relating to animals.', 123, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2765, 'Phil of Human Rights', 'PHIL-211', '211', 'Philosophy 211 explores the following questions: Do human beings have rights? What rights do human beings have? Is torture ever morally justified? How far should freedom of speech and freedom of action extend? Does a fetus have a right to life? To what extent does a free market promote human rights? To what extent does socialism promote human rights? To what extent are Confucian ideas compatible with human rights?', 123, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2766, 'Philosophy of Science', 'PHIL-213', '213', 'This course will introduce students to the philosophy of science by focusing on connections between science and philosophy.  Students will examine the ontological status of theories, the social organization of science and interactions between these topics and epistemological questions.', 123, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2767, 'Environmental Ethics', 'PHIL-235X', '235X', 'Environmental Ethics: The moral understanding, if any, that plants, animals and ecosystems have, and explores moral issues raised by climate change, deforestation, air and water pollution, and other kinds of damage to maintain a healthy environment.', 123, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2768, 'Classics in Political Theory', 'PHIL-323', '323', 'Analysis of principles of political theories of the Ancient Greek, Roman, Medieval, and Early Modern periods. Emphasis on the thought of Plato, Aristotle, the Stoics, St. Augustine, St. Thomas Aquinas, Machiavelli, Hobbes, Locke and Montesquieu. Application of these theories to contemporary political ideas and problems. 3 semester hours', 123, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2769, 'Selected Topics', 'PHIL-340', '340', 'Philosophy and Fiction studies movements, such as existentialism and feminism, to which both philosophers and literary figures have made significant contributions.  Readings include mostly novels.  The course is cross-listed with English 357.', 123, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2770, 'Internship', 'PHIL-398', '398', null, 123, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2771, 'Independent Study', 'PHIL-399', '399', null, 123, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2785, 'Basic Concepts I', 'PHYS-103', '103', 'Space and matter, particles in motion, new-tonian mechanics, atoms and heat, wave phenomena. 2 lectures, 1 two-hour lab, 3 semester hours  Lab Fee Assessed', 125, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2786, 'Prin Physics I', 'PHYS-111', '111', 'The principles of mechanics and their applications. Kinematics, Newtonian mechanics, conditions for equilibrium, static?s work, energy and conservation laws. Rotation. Simple harmonic motion, Co-requisite: mathematics 110, or 111. 3 lectures, 1 three-hour lab, 4 semester hours  Lab Fee Assessed', 125, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2787, 'Prin Physics II', 'PHYS-112', '112', 'Electric forces and fields, electrical potential, electric properties of matter. Magnetic forces and fields, charges in motion, magnetic properties of matter. Electromagnetic induction, Maxwell?s equations. Wave motion, electromagnetic waves. Prerequisite: Physics 111, Co-requisite; Math 112. 3 lectures, 1 three-hour lab, 4 semester hours  Lab Fee Assessed', 125, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2788, 'Gen Physics I', 'PHYS-201', '201', 'A non-calculus course which presents an introduction to classical mechanics, heat and thermodynamics. Prerequisite: Mathematics C105 or its equivalent. 3 lectures, 1 three-hour lab, 4 semester hours  Lab Fee Assessed', 125, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2789, 'General Physics II', 'PHYS-202', '202', 'A non-calculus course covering the fundamental laws of electricity and magnetism, electric circuits, and optics, including topics from modern physics. Prerequisite: Mathematics C105 or its equivalent, Physics 201 or its equivalent. 3 lectures, 1 three-hour lab, 4 semester hours  Lab Fee Assessed', 125, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2790, 'Princ of Physics I', 'PHYS-207', '207', 'The principles of mechanics and their applications. Kinematics, Newtonian mechanics, conditions for equilibrium, static?s work, energy and conservation laws. Rotation. Simple harmonic motion, Co-requisite: mathematics 110, or 111. 3 lectures, 1 three-hour lab, 4 semester hours', 125, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2791, 'Princ of Physics II', 'PHYS-208', '208', 'Electric forces and fields, electrical potential, electric properties of matter. Magnetic forces and fields, charges in motion, magnetic properties of matter. Electromagnetic induction, Maxwell?s equations. Wave motion, electromagnetic waves. Prerequisite: Physics 111 or Phys 207 (min grade C), Co-requisite; Math 112. 3 lectures, 1 three-hour lab, 4 semester hours', 125, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2792, 'Princ of Physics III', 'PHYS-209', '209', 'Heat, heat transfer and thermal processes. Thermal properties of matter, entropy and Laws of Thermodynamics.  Generation of electromagnetic waves and the nature and propagation of light.  Physical and geometric optics.  Special theory of relativity.  Photons and the particle nature of light.  DeBroglie Hypothesis and matter waves. Prerequisite: PHYS 208 (minimum grade C);  Co-requisite: MATH 215.  3 lecture periods; 1 recitation, 3 semester hours', 125, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2793, 'Principles of Physics III Laboratory', 'PHYS-209L', '209L', 'The laboratory component of Phys209 serves as an extension of the lecture course by introducing selected topics in a practicum setting (heat exchange, optics and elements of modern physics). Prerequisite: PHYS 209; Co-requisite: MATH 215.  1 two-hour lab; 1 semester hour', 125, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2794, 'Advanced Analysis for Scientists and Eng', 'PHYS-351', '351', 'Matrix algebra and the eigen value problem. Fourier series, integrals and transforms. Partial differential equations. Sturm-Liouville Systems and Orthogonal Functions. Bessel, Legendre, Gamma, Dirac-delta and other special equations. Applications to various areas of science and technology. Prerequisites: \"C\" or better in MATH 281 and MATH 215. 3 Semester hours', 125, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2795, 'Advanced Analysis II', 'PHYS-352', '352', 'Functions of a complex variable. insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2922, 'Princ Pract I:Chiro History & Philosophy', 'PP-511', '511', 'This is a course in which the history of healing is traced from its known origins through discovery of chiropractic to the present day. The basic concepts of chiropractic philosophy are discussed, as well as their current interpretation and clinical significance. Particular emphasis is placed upon chiropractic as a distinct profession in the health care community. 2 lecture hours, 2 semester hours', 133, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2924, 'Princ Pract III:Ethics', 'PP-513', '513', 'Studenst are introduced to various codes of behaviour as they relate to patient relations, advertising, insurance reporting and professional and general personal behavior.', 133, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2925, 'P&PIV: Contemp Chiro Studies', 'PP-523', '523', null, 133, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2926, 'Prin Pract IV:Subluxation Complex', 'PP-524', '524', 'this courses introduces students to the current concepts of the subluxation complex and how it is intergrated with the science, art and philosophy of chiropractic care. the course covers the various components of the subluxation complex, including biomechanical, pathophysiological, and neurological aspects, this information is correlated to the effects of chiropractic manipulation of the subluxation complex, Prerequisite: pp511, an512', 133, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2947, 'Essentials of Project Management', 'PRST-241', '241', 'This course develops a foundation for the key project management concepts of planning, scheduling, controlling, resource allocation, and performance measurement; as well as the introduction of project management tools.', 136, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2948, 'Budgeting & Finance for Org', 'PRST-250', '250', null, 136, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2949, 'Organizational Behavior', 'PRST-300', '300', 'COURSE DESCRIPTION:  This course provides a comprehensive analysis of individual and group behavior in organizations. Its purpose is to provide an understanding of how organizations can be managed more effectively and at the same time enhance the quality of employees work life. Topics include motivation, rewarding behavior, stress, individual and group behavior, conflict, power and politics, leadership, job design, organizational structure, decision-making, communication and organizational change and development.', 136, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2950, 'Project Planning and Implementation', 'PRST-320', '320', 'The course explores principles of successful project planning, organization, and implementation using real-world examples to identify mistakes and pitfalls in project management. Topics covered include project scoping, estimating, budgeting, scheduling and staffing, tracking and controlling, and software tools.', 136, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2951, 'Leadership in Project Management', 'PRST-325', '325', 'This course will explore the role of leadership in project management. Special emphasis is placed on motivation, performance management, communication, team building, innovation and strategic management.', 136, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2952, 'Independent Study', 'PRST-399', '399', 'Students apply methods, theories, and tools learned from coursework to real-world business situations. 1-3 credits', 136, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2953, 'Professional Studies', 'PRST-ELECTV', 'ELECTV', null, 136, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');
