insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(522, 'Clinical Psychology', 'PS-711', '711', 'This course is designed to familiarize stustudents with current psychological theory and practice. Students are instructed in behavioral assessment and recognition of psychological disorders. Interviewing and counseling techniques are presented as well as criteria for appropriate referral of patients to providers of psychological services. Prerequisite: All courses, Semesters I-V. 2 lecture hours. 2 semester hours', 38, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(523, 'Clinical Psychology', 'PS-811', '811', null, 38, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2805, 'American Government', 'PSCI-101', '101', 'The Constitution. Structure and function of the national government: proper citizenship, civil rights, elections, and party organizations. 3 semester hours', 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2806, 'Intro Political Science', 'PSCI-103', '103', 'This course serves as a gateway to the study of political science for IPED majors and political science/international relations minors. We?ll survey the historical and philosophical foundations of the political science discipline, major subject fields under the general category of political science, key concepts and issues in political science, and basic scientific methods in political science study and research. 3 semester credits', 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2807, 'Co-Op Work Exp', 'PSCI-200', '200', null, 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2808, 'U S Foreign Policy', 'PSCI-203', '203', 'This course examines contemporary US foreign policy from theoretical and policy perspectives. How American foreign policy is formulated and conducted will be discussed during the first half of the semester. The second half will be devoted to evaluations of US policies, especially economic and trade policies, towards key regions of the world. 3 semester credits', 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2809, 'Govt and Politics Abroad', 'PSCI-204', '204', 'Principal institutions, methods, and problems of government of selected foreign countries in Europe, Asia, Africa, and Latin America as compared with the American System. 3 semester hours', 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2810, 'Political Economy of North/South Rels', 'PSCI-206', '206', 'Political-economic disparities between ?North? (the developed nations) and ?South? (developing countries). The causes of these disparities analyzed from an interdisciplinary point of view. Recurring patterns of obstacles to development in some new nations. The role of international financial and other organizations. 3 semester hours', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2811, 'World Politics', 'PSCI-207', '207', 'This course explores the principal elements of world politics, examining the context in which the major actors play their roles, as well as the salient features of the international community. It will review the most significant aspects of global politics by examining such topics as foreign policy, the nature of national power, and war. It will examine the origin, organization, and function of the ma-jor international institutions, and conclude with a discussion of global issues. 3 semester hours', 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2812, 'Public Intl Law', 'PSCI-208', '208', 'History and nature of international law, territorial sovereignty, natural resources and international norms (e.g. exclusive economic zones, the continental shelf, outer space, etc.), diplomatic & consular relations, International Court of Justice and other tribunals, and the use of force in international law. 3 semester hours', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2813, 'Intro U.N. Studies', 'PSCI-209', '209', 'Examination of the successes and failures of the United Nations, its prospects for the future, principal organs, especially the Security Council, budgetary system, role in arms control, relations between the United Nations and the United States, and related issues. 3 semester hour', 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2814, 'Intl Human Rights', 'PSCI-215', '215', 'A study of the international protection of human rights. The course analyzes the origin and nature of human rights, the content of human rights standards guaranteed by international law, as well as the global international mechanism for the protection of human rights. It includes a comparative examination of the regional systems in Europe, the Americas, Asia, and Africa for the protection of human rights. 3 semester hours', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2815, 'Gender Politics From a Global Perspectiv', 'PSCI-216', '216', 'This course examines the main theoretical approaches, questions, debates, and findings about the role of gender in politics across countries. Students will analyze the global variation in women\'s political participation and voting behavior; women\'s representation in executive and legislative offices; the impact of women\'s leadership on various policy areas; and women\'s participation and activism in civil society.', 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2816, 'Race and Politics', 'PSCI-217X', '217X', 'This course examines critical questions and debates about race, ethnicity, and politics. It uses a multi displinary approach to study the history of minorities in the US and American politics.', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2817, 'Human Security', 'PSCI-218', '218', null, 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2818, 'Pop,Resources & Envir', 'PSCI-223X', '223X', null, 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2819, 'Political Econ China', 'PSCI-229', '229', null, 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2820, 'Intro US Legal System', 'PSCI-233', '233', 'This course will offer a comprehensive overview of the U.S. legal system, including an overview of legal practice sources and techniques with emphasis on the major substantive areas of the law. Students will begin by examining issues in constitutional law, with an overview of how government functions and how laws are made. A legal writing segment of the course will allow students to use legal analysis while refining their writing skills. 3 semester credits', 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2821, 'Sun Tzu, Leadership and Strategy', 'PSCI-249', '249', 'This course focuses on the art of thinking in human competition. It teaches about outthinking rather than outfighting your opponent. It is designed to familiarize students with Sun Tzu\'s teachings on leadership and strategy via reviewing the text of The Art of War on contemporary culture, leadership, and relationship.', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2822, 'Selected Topics', 'PSCI-299', '299', null, 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2823, 'Political Econ East Asia', 'PSCI-301', '301', null, 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2824, 'Political Econ of Latin Am', 'PSCI-303', '303', 'This course will explore pre-Colombian, as well as colonial and post-colonial political and economic development in Latin America. It will pay particular attention to sociopolitical developments of the Cold War period as well as recent significant initiatives such as the Santiago Commitment, MERCOSUR, and NAFTA, attempting to assess their impact upon Latin America?s transformation from develop mentalism, to Third World politics, to an emerging center of democratic capitalism. 3 semester hours', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2825, 'International Relations', 'PSCI-305', '305', '\"PSCI 305 is an upper-level course focused on the study of the interactions between diverse international actors, ranging from states and international organizations to individuals and non-governmental organizations (NGOs). In this course, we will explore some of the persistent problems of global politics, such as violence, inequality and environmental degradation.\"     ', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2826, 'Geopolitics of Oil', 'PSCI-311X', '311X', null, 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2827, 'Diplomacy & Foreign Policy', 'PSCI-312', '312', null, 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2828, 'Pol Econ East Asia', 'PSCI-321', '321', 'In recent decades, the East Asian region has often been described as a model of socioeconomic development, which newly developing regions should emulate. This course will encourage learners to explore the extent to which the East Asian paradigm of development is valid for other regions. This course will explore the cultural and historical factors contributing to the political and economic trajectories China, Korea, and Japan. Through studying East Asia?s unique sociopolitical and economic trajectory, students should be equipped to better contextualize and assess the challenges and opportunities currently facing the Peoples Republic of China, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Japan, and the Koreas. 3 semester hours', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2829, 'Classics in Political Theory', 'PSCI-323', '323', 'Analysis of principles of political theories of the Ancient Greek, Roman, Medieval, and Early Modern periods. Emphasis on the thought of Plato, Aristotle, the Stoics, St. Augustine, St. Thomas Aquinas, Machiavelli, Hobbes, Locke and Montesquieu. Application of these theories to contemporary political ideas and problems. 3 semester hours', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2830, 'Recent Political Theory', 'PSCI-324', '324', 'Analysis of the major contemporary ideologies, their historical-philosophical backgrounds and public policy implications. Among the ideologies and belief systems considered are liberalism, conservatism, Marxism (including Leninism and Maoism), fascism, anarchism, religious fundamentalism, and feminism. The cultural expressions of these ideologies in arts and literature are also examined. 3 semester hours', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2831, 'Constitutional Law', 'PSCI-343', '343', 'This course examines the operation of the U.S. Constitution, as well as its origins, philosophical underpinnings, and current issues.  Course work includes reading, discussing, and writing about constitutional issues.', 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2832, 'International Political Economy', 'PSCI-354', '354', null, 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2833, 'Terrorism', 'PSCI-371', '371', 'This course introduces terrorism as a subject of sociological, legal, military, political, and strategic study.  The course considers the objectives of the terrorist and terrorist organizations, and recent counter-terrorism strategies.  The course also encourages students to think about long-term strategies to combat terrorism, both within a nation-state and across international borders.', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2834, 'Islam & Democracy', 'PSCI-373', '373', 'This course aims to address the following questions: Are Islam and democracy compatible? How is religious interest defined? How are Islamic images and institutions used? What is the historical relationship between Islam and politics? When and under what conditions is Islam publicized and politicized? Is Islam compatible with modernity? Is it possible to be modern and Muslim at the same time? How do Islamic scholars deal with the questions of \"difference\", democracy, and science? The major task of this course will be to assess how religion makes an impact on politics, state and society and in turn is impacted upon and potentially transformed by society, politics and the state. Instructor\'s permission may be required for this course. 3 semester hours', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2835, 'Senior Thesis', 'PSCI-395', '395', null, 128, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2836, 'Internship', 'PSCI-398', '398', 'Professional, supervised, unpaid work in an organization related to career goals.  Prerequisite: Permission of advisor and School Director. 3 semester hours.', 128, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2837, 'Independent Study', 'PSCI-399', '399', 'This course permits the advanced political science student to undertake individual research in the area approved by the instructor. Continuous consultation with the instructor is required. Prerequisite: Permission of School Director. 1-6 semester hours', 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2838, 'Political Science', 'PSCI-ELECTV', 'ELECTV', null, 128, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2954, 'Intro Psychology', 'PSYC-103', '103', 'An introduction to the field of psychology, including such topics as research methods, the brain, neuronal structure and functioning, sleep and dreaming, cognitive and social development, learning, memory, intelligence, personality, psychopathology, psychotherapy, social cognition, and social influence. This course is a prerequisite of all other psychology courses.', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2955, 'Child Psychology', 'PSYC-201', '201', 'Physical, cognitive, language, personality, moral, and social development from conception to pubescence.', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2956, 'Psychology of Adolesence and Adulthood', 'PSYC-202', '202', 'This course will examine the theories and issues surrounding biological, cognitive and psychsocial development from pubescence to adulthood.  Students explore experiences and calues related to risk taking, friendship, peer-groups, peer-pressure, marriage, relationships, parenting and sexuality.', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2957, 'Maturity and Aging', 'PSYC-203', '203', 'This course is the third course in the human development series in the Psychology program at the University of Bridgeport. In this series, we discover the challenges and rewards of various life stages. We discuss biological, cognitive, emotional and social change through the lifespan and relate the course material to our own lives.  This course engages us in important questions about health, longevity, aging, death and dying and life and living. We will emphasize the topics of healthy living, ageism, grief, bereavement and the dying process as it relates to individuals and to caregivers.  We will consider historical and cultural differences, but will focus on present day American life. We will also consider the many positive aspects and rewards of the aging and dying process. Perhaps most importantly, we\'ll emphasize making the most of our lives given the inevitability of our own aging death.   The course will be interactive and focused on our own experiences and reactions. There will be a series of current, original readings that we will discuss in class. We will watch at least one video that deals with aging and another that deals with death and dying. We will have a series of guest speakers who will share their work. Finally, we will choose two different personal experiential projects and report on our experiences.   ', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2958, 'Lifespan Developmental Psychology', 'PSYC-205', '205', 'This course will examine the theories and issues surrounding biological, cognitive, and psychosocial development from birth through death. Topics will include attachment, social development, theories and theorists related to developmental change, aging, and health factors impacting each stage of development. ', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2959, 'Abnormal Psychology', 'PSYC-230', '230', 'The course will focus on the study of those thoughts, feelings, and behaviors that interfere with psychologically adaptive functioning. The causes and appropriate treatments of mood disorders, personality disorders, schizophrenia, adjustment reactions, and other disorders as specified in the DSM will be discussed.  Prerequisite: Must have taken PSYC 103 and passed with a minimum grade of \"C\". ', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2960, 'Social Psychology', 'PSYC-240', '240', 'This course is designed to provide an overview of the field of social psychology. Learning will be accomplished through reading and discussion of the text, as well as presentation of supplemental material provided by the instructor along with in-class activities, videos and discussion. Topics will include discussion of the varying domains of research in social psychology, important studies in the field, and how it applies to academia and everyday life. Specific topics will include: attitudes and attitude formation, persuasion, aggression, conformity, obedience, culture, helping behaviors, attraction, self-concept, as well as discrimination and prejudice. Prerequisite: Must have taken PSYC 103 and passed with a minimum grade of \"C\". ', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2961, 'Multicultural Psychology', 'PSYC-280X', '280X', 'This course will examine various multicultural  issues relevant to psychology. Topics covered  will include culturally relevant styles of  communication, values from different cultures,  racial identity, power and privilege, and issues  involving affirmative action.  It will help  prepare students grapple with issues of  multiculturalism in the modern diverse society.', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2962, 'Emerging Topics in Psychology', 'PSYC-289', '289', 'Emerging Topics in Psychology Examination of one or more prominent topics in psychology such as evidence supported psychoterapies emerging theories and models, and applied topic areas. This is a one credit course that will deeply explore a narrow topic in a short time span. This course will allow students to gain insight into an important topic in psychology and connected disciplines (e.g, conseling and human services) that, while new and relevant, may not warrant a full 3 credit semester experience. Specific topic title and description will be supplied each time the course is administered.', 137, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2963, 'Emerging Topics in Psych', 'PSYC-289X', '289X', 'Examination of one or more currently prominent topics in Psychology such as evidence supported psychoterapies, emerging theories and model, and applied topic areas.  This is a one-credit course that will deeply explore a narrow topic in a short time span.  This course will allow students to gain insight into an important topic in psychology and connected disciplines (e.g. counseling and human services) that , while new and relevant, may not warrant a full 3 credit semester experience.  Specific topic title and description will be supplied each time the course is administered.', 137, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2964, 'Psychology of Videogames', 'PSYC-294X', '294X', 'In this course, students will explore the recent explosion and impact of \"serious\" videogames in health promotion, behavior change, social impact, and education. Using psychological principles and research-based methods, students will gain a foundation in serious videogame design and development through playtesting, analysis, and discussion of a diversity of serious game genres and simulations, as well as how videogames and their impact on humans is being explored in psychology. Perspectives from academia, industry, the non-profit sector, and the gaming community about this field will be discussed. As part of a semester-long project, students will design and present their own serious game designs and paper prototypes using principles of psychology. Prereq: C or better in Psyc-103', 137, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2965, 'Ind Stdy-Topics', 'PSYC-299', '299', null, 137, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2966, 'Psyc of Personality', 'PSYC-303', '303', 'The structure, dynamics and development of personality. Major personality theories- psychoanalytic, trait, behavioral, cognitive, socio-biological, humanistic/existential-and their implications for understanding both normal and  deviant personality.', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2967, 'Psychology of Music', 'PSYC-306X', '306X', 'This course introduces students to the field of music psychology: how our minds learn, perceive, process, and respond to musical information. Students will gain basic familiarity with the various subfields in music psychology, understand how the field impacts their academic and professional specialties, be able to design experiments that test research questions in music psychology, and demonstrate critical thinking about research goals and methodology in the field.', 137, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2968, 'Cognitive Psychology', 'PSYC-307', '307', 'Recent advances in the understanding of thought processes. Focus on attention, perception,  memory, imagery, problem solving, language,  intelligence, creativity, and dreaming.', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2969, 'Industrial & Organizational Psych', 'PSYC-309', '309', 'Application of psychological principles to industry, business, transportation, communications, institutions, and consumer behavior. 3 semester hours ', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2970, 'Psych of Sexuality', 'PSYC-310', '310', 'Physiological and psychological components of human sexuality, and their interaction. Focus on health and social issues and on  individual, gender, and cultural differences', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2971, 'Educational Psychology', 'PSYC-314', '314', 'Application to the teaching-learning process of psychological concepts, principals, theory, and research results. Focus on growth and  development, adjustment and personality, learning, measurement and evaluation.', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2972, 'Current Topics', 'PSYC-316', '316', 'Examination of one or more currently prominent topics in psychology, such as memory reconstruction, sexual orientation, emotional intelligence, brain plasticity, or hate crimes. Prerequisite: Psychology 315 3 semester hours', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2973, 'Research Methods', 'PSYC-321', '321', 'Students explores and evaluates the validity of various experimental and non-experimental research strategies and gain experience collecting psychological data, in groups and individually. Foundations of statistical analysis, including both descriptive and introductory inferential statistics. 3 semester hours ', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2974, 'Theories of Self-Regulation', 'PSYC-322X', '322X', 'Self-Regulation is the conscious and unconcious processes by which people manage their behavior and emotions, control impulses, and strive toward desired goals. The ability to exercise self-regulation is associated with well-being, health, and relationship and occupational success. This course explores how self-regulation shapes, and is shaped by, social relationships; underlying brain mechanisms and development pathways; and which interventions can improve people\'s self-regulation. This course is partially experiential as students will also learn through practicing strategies in their own lives.  3 semester hours.', 137, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2975, 'Exceptional Child', 'PSYC-333', '333', 'Major categories of exceptional children, their identifying characteristics, and programs to meet their special needs.  Course also includes an introduction to child psychopathology.  Nature of different disorders, theories of causation, and treatment approaches such as play therapy, behavioral modification, and family therapy.', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2976, 'Health Psychology', 'PSYC-345', '345', 'Health psychology provides psychology\'s contribution to the interdisciplinary field of behavioral medicine.  The course will examine implications of the mid-body interaction for understanding the effects of stress, the seeking of medical treatment, and the promotion of healthier living.  It will also address the ways in which professionals can understand and modify behavior sources of illness, and thereby lessen peoples\' suffering, increase their life expectancy, and improve their quality of life.', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2977, 'Animal Behavior', 'PSYC-346', '346', 'This course integrates the proximate and ultimate causes of behavior through survey of key concepts, theories and models in the field of Animal Behavior. Students will explore the mechanistic causes of behavior including the, genetic, hormonal, neural and environmental influences on behavioral development and expression. Students will examine behaviors important to survival (such as finding food and avoiding predators) and those important to reproduction (such as selecting mates) while considering the manner in which these behaviors are shaped and constrained by ecology and evolutionary history. Students will actively examine classic theories and research in this area, and compare and contrast it with modem scientific perspectives from numerous disciplines.', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2978, 'Psychology of Gender', 'PSYC-348', '348', 'This course will cover various aspects of the  psychology of women such as gender stereo- types and biases, gender comparisons social  situations,  women  and  work,  love  relation- ships,  women  and  psychological  disorders,   and  violence  against  women.  Prerequisite   Course: PSYC 103', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2979, 'Sports Psych', 'PSYC-355', '355', 'A study of the psychological foundations of physical activity. An overview of the psychological and mental factors that influence and are influenced by participation and performance in sports, exercise and physical activity. Included are applications of the knowledge gained through research to everyday settings. 3 semester hours ', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2980, 'Consumer Psychology', 'PSYC-361X', '361X', 'This course will explore psychological foundations and applications of consumption in our society. We will study psychological reasons behind answers to these questions regarding consumption by examining relevant psychological theories and latest research. Students will analyze real-world cases by reflecting upon their own consumption experiences during class field trips to major shopping and consumption destinations.', 137, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2981, 'Forensic Psychology', 'PSYC-370', '370', 'Surveys the overall intersection of psychology and the American court system. Emphasis will be placed on issues related to clinical psychology/psychiatry in the criminal justice system such as sanity evaluation, criminal profiling and assessment of dangerousness. Students will explore how forensic psychologists have been involved in the jury selection process and have contribution to our understanding, of eyewitness testimony (limitations of memory) and the detection of deceit through the polygraph and other techniques. Finally, students will explore how professionals trained in development, organizational, and clinical psychology interact with the court system when they serve as ?expert witnesses? in a variety of civil and probate matters. 3 semester hours ', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2982, 'Psychology of Stigma', 'PSYC-375', '375', 'This course will broadly explore the psychological foundations of stigma,as well as the ramifications of being stigmatized. Theories as to why people stigmatize others, how this is justified and rationalized, and how people cope with being stigmatized will be explored. Specific topics will include racism and discrimination, social exclusion, gender and sexuality bias, stigma consciousness and self-concept, ageism, and taboo behavior. Students will integrate theories of stigma with other modem psychological principles, and will actively discuss and write on these concepts.', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2983, 'Biological Psychology/Neuroscience', 'PSYC-380', '380', 'The biological mechanisms underlying human behavior. Focus on evolution, genetics, and the anatomy and physiology of the human brain and  nervous system as they affect and are affected by sensory systems, movement, waking and  sleeping, homeostasis, hormones, sexual behavior , emotions, learning, memory, and language.', 137, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2984, 'Drug Effects & Bhvr', 'PSYC-381', '381', 'Fundamentals of psychopharmacological research with emphasis on human drug-taking behavior. A discussion of the various psychoactive drugs and implications of their use. 3 semester hours ', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2985, 'Statistical Methods in Psychology', 'PSYC-385', '385', 'This  course  will  provide  the  student  with   an  overview  of  basic  statistical  theories  and methodologies  used  in  modern  psychologi- cal research.  Topics  will  include  the  theo- retical  basis,  application,  and  methodologies involved in descriptive statistics, correlations, t-tests, ANOVAs and regressions. 3 semester hours', 137, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2986, 'Research Practicum in Psyc', 'PSYC-390', '390', 'This  course  is  designed  to  give  students  the opportunity and experience of assisting with  empirical  research  in  psychology,  under  di- rected  mentorship  of  a  faculty  member  at   UB. Prior approval by that faculty member is  required.  Directed  mentorship  in  a  psychol- ogy  laboratory  outside  of  UB  will  be  con- sidered.  Students  will  learn  about  the  ethics involved  in  human  research,  and  will  assist a faculty  member  in  their  research  through activities such as participant recruitment, survey  administration  and  other  forms  of  data collection, data entry, and empirical literature review. Students will provide a written summative  overview  of  their  experience  at  the end of the semester. This course is by instructor permission only, and is limited to psychology  (or  closely  related  area)  majors  with a  minimum  of  sophomore  standing  and  a  3.3  cumulative GPA.  2 - 4 semester hours', 137, 4, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2987, 'Advanced Research', 'PSYC-391X', '391X', 'This course is designed to give students a follow-up hands on research experience, following successful completion of PSYC 390. This course will allow students to develop and conduct their own independent research project, or, work on manuscript creation for a project already conducted. This course will allow students to gain experience as a lead on a research project coordinator and gain skills that will allow them to quickly acclimate to a job in a research lab or graduate research lab experience. Must have taken PSYC 390 with a grade of B or better, and permission of the instructor. This course can be repeated once for up to 3 additional credits (maximum of 6 across semesters) if taken with a different instructor for work on a separate project.', 137, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2988, 'Senior Thesis-Psyc', 'PSYC-395', '395', 'Students work individually with their advisor to produce an integrative review or conduct empirical research on a specific topic within psychology. 3 semester hours ', 137, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2989, 'Simulated Patient Prac', 'PSYC-397', '397', 'In this course, students will learn to perform the role of a simulated patient in mental health. A SP is someone who has been trained to portray a patient with a specific condition in a realistic way. Students in this class will learn to play the part of a patient and perform the role for a class of students. Training includes learning to simulate physical symptoms, like abdominal pain, back pain, fatigue, psychomotor retardation/agitation, etc. Training also includes learning to portray serious and difficult-to-hear information, such as sexual assault, suicidal ideation, and thoughts of hopelessness, worthlessness, rage, irritability and shame. The goal being to increase knowledge and awareness of how mental health is assessed. This course is by instructor permission only, and is limited to psychology (or closely related area) majors with a minimum of sophomore standing and a 3.3 cumulative GPA Prior approval by that faculty member is Required', 137, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2990, 'Internship in Psychology', 'PSYC-398', '398', 'This course is designed to give students practical experience applying their knowledge of psychology and psychology related principles to actual workplace settings. Professional settings must be approved in advance by the Professor and may include businesses, healthcare, recreational, social service, or educational organizations at the local, state, federal, or international levels. During the experience, students receive regular feedback from a qualified supervisor, generally holding a degree beyond the Bachelors level and from experienced staff members within the organization. Students also engage in career development activities during the course including refining their resume, taking interest inventories, documenting hours and activities and requesting a formal letter of recommendation from a supervisor. Reflective writing assignments help students to relate their own practical experience to their growing knowledge base in psychology. ', 137, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2991, 'Independent Study', 'PSYC-399', '399', 'An opportunity to study topics not covered in regular course offerings or to carry out an individual course of instruction. 1-6 semester hours ', 137, 6, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2992, 'Psychology Elective', 'PSYC-ELECTV', 'ELECTV', null, 137, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2798, 'Physiological Therapeutics I: Modalities', 'PT-711', '711', 'This course is an introduction to the clinical use of heat, cold, high volt galvanism, interferential current, low volt galvanism, ultrasound, electrical muscle stimulation, diathermy, and paraffin. The student is instructed on the development of a clinical management plan utilizing adjunctive therapies. 1 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours, 1 semester hours', 126, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2799, 'Physiol Therapeutics I: Modalities Lab', 'PT-711L', '711L', 'This course is an introduction to the clinical use of heat, cold, high volt galvanism, interferential current, low volt galvanism, ultrasound, electrical muscle stimulation, diathermy, and paraffin. The student is instructed on the development of a clinical management plan utilizing adjunctive therapies. 1 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours, 1 semester hours', 126, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2800, 'Physiological Therapeutics II:Rehab', 'PT-722', '722', 'In this course current concepts of active rehabilitative management of injuries, dysfunctions and conditions of the spine and extremities common to the practice of chiropractic are presented. The student receives instruction in a variety of assessment and clinical management protocols including spinal stabilization, therapeutic exercise, PNF, stretching, sensorimotor training and patient education. The application of outcomes and psychosocial risk factors assessment in developing the treatment plan is addressed. 2 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours, 2 semester hours', 126, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(2801, 'Physiol Ther II:Rehabilitation Lab', 'PT-722L', '722L', 'In this course current concepts of active rehabilitative management of injuries, dysfunctions and conditions of the spine and extremities common to the practice of chiropractic are presented. The student receives instruction in a variety of assessment and clinical management protocols including spinal stabilization, therapeutic exercise, PNF, stretching, sensorimotor training and patient education. The application of outcomes and psychosocial risk factors assessment in developing the treatment plan is addressed. 2 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours, 2 semester hours', 126, 1, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3021, 'Merchandising Mathematics', 'RETL-102', '102', 'A functional and realistic approach to retailing principles and operations by the application of mathematical formulas and procedures. Emphasis on income statements, pricing techniques, markup, markdown, sales volume, inventory control, merchandising terminology, and merchandising planning. Math placement test must be taken.  3 semester hours  Required: A grade of at least a ?C? to enter Retailing 304', 141, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3022, 'Seminar Professional Development', 'RETL-180', '180', 'Surveys retail and related career areas, entry requiremnets and employment opportunities. Students are provided with opportunities to develop pertinent retailing related resumes, professional portfolios and interview techniques, as well as letters of application.Detatiled study of the current job market and buisness ethics are also included.', 141, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3023, 'Co-Op Work Assignment', 'RETL-200', '200', null, 141, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3024, 'Retl Advts Fash Promo I', 'RETL-201', '201', 'Principles and methods of advertising and promotion for producers, manufactures and retailers with emphasis on the retailers most often used media - the newspaper.Varying advertising approaches of the mass merchandiser, the prestigious department store and the specially stor are included. Additionally, students work on individual or group assignments in special events planning, visual merchandise, direct marketing, publicity, newspaper and magazine advertizing. The role of the retail buyer and product developer in the advertising function in the planning and budgeting of ads is also included.', 141, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3025, 'Retailing Mathematics', 'RETL-202', '202', 'A functional and realistic approach to retailing principles and operations by the application of mathematical formulas and procedures. Emphasis on income statements, pricing techniques, markup, markdown, sales volume, inventory control, merchandising terminology, and merchandising planning. Math placement test must be taken.  3 semester hours', 141, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3026, 'Fashion & Retl Buying I', 'RETL-203', '203', 'The study of buying theory and techniques for department stores and specially retailers.Analyzes the buying function and examines how buyers responsibilities vary in different types of merchandising organizations.Study of the principles, producers, and the techniques practiced by merchandisers of fashion goods in determining resources to select, and assortments to buy includes private label development.', 141, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3027, 'Textiles I', 'RETL-205', '205', 'Basic convepts of textiles dealing with fibers,yarns and methods of fabric construction.Specific laboratory asssignments devoted to natural and synthetic fiber identification and testing. 15$ lab fee.', 141, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3028, 'Textiles II', 'RETL-206', '206', 'Continuation of textile concepts including the study of films, foams, laminated fabrics, fiber webs, knitted constructions, knotted fabrics, laces and flocked fabrics. In depth study of aesthetic and functional fabric finishes with emphasis on specific needs of the clothing and home finishings industries. Laboratory work applies industry testing standards to individual fabrics.Woven, knitted ans applied fabric patterns are explored using a variety of medium including CAD.CAM software.Students are responsible for submitting testing results and aesthetic development projects in addition to preparing sample books of comercially produced designs and functional finishes. Prerequisite: RETL 205.$25 laboratory fee.', 141, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3029, 'Retail Salesmanship', 'RETL-207', '207', 'Development of professional selling techniques necessary for efficiency and success in all phases of retailing and wholesaling.Expertise in a retail product line is developed thriugh a product research project.', 141, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3030, 'Retail Personnel Management I', 'RETL-213', '213', 'An examination of personnel management within retail organizations. Topics include a survey of personnel theories, practices, and labor legislation in regard to personnel functions.Emphasis is on the special problems encountered by retailers with respect to employee recruitment, training, placement, scheduling, satisfaction, turnover, evaluation, and executive development.', 141, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3031, 'Industry Internship', 'RETL-280', '280', 'Paid work experience in a faculty-approved retail organization. Six week full-time on-the-job asssignment combined with written research into corporate structure and marketing strategy. Holiday selling season of sophomore year. Prerequisite: 2.5 Q.P.R. Students must maintain 2.5 Q.P.R. during the internship semester. Fashion Merchandising and Retailing majors only.', 141, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3032, 'Independent Study', 'RETL-299', '299', null, 141, 2, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3033, 'Mass Merch & Mktg', 'RETL-300', '300', 'An Analytical study of national and multi-national mass merchandising organizations that include origin, concepts, operations, technology, and profitability. Comparision of in-store mass merchandisers and non-store catalog retailers, on-air merchandisers, and on-line marketers.Students research one in-store and one-store masss merchandiser of their choice in depth. Students prepare a catalog, an on-air, and an e-tailing presentation using a mass market approach.Students utilize \"CATALOG\", \"STORY-BOARD\",\"SHOW AND SELL\", and \"VIRTUAL MERVHANDISING\" CAD/CAM software to prepare presentations. PRerequisites: RFTL 201,RFTL 204,RFTL 207 and RFTL 213; open to juniors and seniors only.', 141, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3034, 'Fashion & Retail Buying II', 'RETL-304', '304', 'Inventory and stock control procedures, analysis of consumer demand in the buying and marketing of fashion products. Six month budget planning of sales, goods,and promotional activities. Spreadsheets and computer applications are used to plan, analyze, and adjust retailing activities by revisions in quantities and merchandise assortments.Practice in buying from a variety of domestic and international resources. Prerequisites: RETL 102 with a grade of \"C\" or better and RETL 203', 141, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3035, 'Surface Desn I', 'RETL-307', '307', 'Intriduction to the buisness of Textile Surface Design. Course focus is on applied surface designs using natural and geometric motifs as they apply in a variety of fashion markets including infant\'s and children\'s, womens\'s,men\'s ,domestics and paper goods.Students research current market design and color trends.Using classic,modern, or ethnic motif students work with layout, repeat size and colr ways.Students develop their own collection libraries in paper and disc formats.Students design applied patterns and alternative color ways using \"DESIGN and REPEAT\" and \"EASY COLORING\" CAD/CAM software.Students prepare portfolios of tehir best designs. OPen to juniors and seniors only.Prerequisites : RFTL 205, RFTL 206, Design 103. $50.00 lab fee.', 141, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3036, 'Advanced Textiles', 'RETL-308', '308', 'This course provides an overview of the history and ipmportance of historical fabrics and their relevance in today\'s market.The course includes studying the historical changes of fabrics, improvements in dyeing and weaving techniques as well as importance of designers that produce these fabrics.A portfolio of fashion is required as well as discussion and research on new ecological fibers. Oral presentations and a NYC market trip to textiles companies is required.', 141, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3037, 'Retailing Management', 'RETL-313', '313', 'A study of the management decisions faced by the retail executive in today?s marketplace. Topics include locations, retail store layout, security, the customer service mix, retail credit arrangements and their cost-benefit relationships. Human resource concerns include recruitment, personnel changes, retraining and layoffs; employee benefits and their impact on both morale and budgets. Students research in-depth one of the ten top international retailers for practical solutions to a profitable retail environment. Prerequisite: Retailing 213, Retailing 201, and Marketing 305; junior and seniors majors only. May not be taken same semester as Fashion Merchandising 270. 3 semester hours  ', 141, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3038, 'Intl Fashion Mktg', 'RETL-330', '330', 'An examination of international trade for textile and apparel industries. This course studies supporting agencies, foreign manufacturing,distribution, financing, transportation,tariffs and customs regulation. The studentwill be required to research exporting and importing a product and to prepare both a written and oral presentation. Prerequisites: RETL 205 and RETL 206. 3 semester hours ', 141, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3039, 'Internship', 'RETL-398', '398', 'A full semester of part-time internship experience at a Fashion focused organization outside of the University.  Students may select to intern with a retailer, atextile supplier, a fashion publication, or a showroom.  Generally Corporate internships during the academic term are one or two days a week.  Students need to complete a minimum of 120 hours of professional experience to recieve credit for their experience.    Students submit a fifteen page paper describing the organization in detail, the role their internship position contributed to the organization, a description of their specific job, and how their job was related to their field of study.  Students describe the strengths and weaknesses of the organization as they perceive them and suggest areas of improvement.  Juniors and Seniors only', 141, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3040, 'Independent Study', 'RETL-399', '399', 'Independent study in fashion merchandising, textiles or related retailing techniques. Prerequisite: B.S. Degree Fashion Merchandising and Retailing seniors only; permission of chair. A three-credit internship is possible which combines one-credit of work experience with two-credits of independent research. 1-3 credits', 141, 3, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');

insert into `courses` (`id`, `name`, `name_shorthand`, `number`, `description`, `department_id`, `credits`, `created_at`) VALUES(3041, 'Retailing Elective', 'RETL-ELECTV', 'ELECTV', null, 141, null, '2021-03-21 08:48:11');
